loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is 53 years old and blessed with two children who are already married. 

Lim, like many other villagers, prefers to work in agriculture, especially farming and hog raising. She has been in these two businesses for ages and they return her a suitable income to secure the welfare of the family. Her husband is very helpful, usually assisting her in managing the rice farm when he is available from his distilling business.

At the moment, Lim is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR in order to purchase additional piglets and feed to nourish them. She hopes to yield a better income for her family from the effect of the loan help. In the future, she plans to expand her pig farm and install more piglets for fattening.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed to nourish them.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is 65 years old and a single parent of four children. 

He is the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for four years. He has been working hard every day so that he can sustain the financial needs of his family and support those of his children who are still at school. He typically generates an average of 4 USD each day.

With the requested amount, Sim would like to renovate his house, which is currently affected by the rain. He wants to rebuild the wall made of bricks and concrete the floor. He hopes that Kiva lenders will not reject his loan and continuously help his family better their standard of living.

loans.use: to rebuild the wall made of bricks and concrete the floor.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou is 25 years old, married, and has two children. 

She grows rice on her inherited farmland located in Kompong Speu province. She has been in this business for almost 10 years while her husband is in the business of trading firewood. During the rainy season that lasts from May to October, Nou is always busy with her work at the rice field. Her ability to handle her business is helping her family financially and enabling her to send her children to school.

Nou would like to acquire a loan from HKL and Kiva to make improvements in her current business. She will use it to purchase a plowing machine for the maintenance of the rice field. This machine will enable her to do her business efficiently. Also, she can hire out this machine to local farmers for extra profit when they are in need. In the future, she hopes to own extra plots of farmland and increase her yields.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Racar Bajo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Racar Bajo está formado por 5 socias y 3 socios quienes en su mayoría son familia y se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, esta actividad es tradición de sus padres, también crían animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas. La comunidad de Racar en Cuenca se encuentra rodeada abundante vegetación y su gente aun mantiene viva la llama de su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Delia, es socia del banco comunal Racar Bajo hace 2 años. Tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 10, 9, 7 y 5 años que estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la elaboración de tejas, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su mamá compartiendo gastos.

Doña Delia pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y también le ayuda a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos los que vende en su comunidad, también le ayuda a su esposo en la elaboración de los  ladrillos arte que aprendió de sus padres.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de arcilla para continuar con el negocio de los ladrillos. 

Su meta es construir su casa y que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Racar Bajo communal bank is comprised of 5 women and 3 men members.  Most of them are family.  They devote themselves to making bricks and tiles.  This business activity is the tradition of their parents.  They also raise animals, and many work at different business activities in the city.

The Racar en Cuenca community is surrounded by abundant vegetation.  Its people still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Delia is one of the members of this group.  Delia has been a member of the Racar Bajo communal bank for two years.  She is married and has four children, ages 10, 9, 7, and 5.  The children go to a school in the area.  Her husband works making tiles.  They do not have their own house, so the live in her mother’s house and share expenses.

Delia spends her time at home taking care of her children.  She also helps her husband with expenses.  She raises guinea pigs and chickens that she sells in her community.  She also helps her husband making the bricks, which is an art she learned from her parents.

She will use her loan to buy clay in order to continue with the brick making business.

Her goal is to build her house and that her children come to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Forkland Group

texts.en:
Hamis, who is in his mid 40s, is married with nine children. Four of them are still going to school. He has been running a business selling fruit for three years now. He works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a plot of land, more fruit, improve on the place where he sells his fruit, start selling bedsheets from door to door, and cover household expenses and school fees. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He now wants a loan to buy more bedsheets to resell. His dream is to one day be able to make his business bigger and to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Forkland," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bedsheets to resell

loans.name: Good Work Group

texts.en:
Agripina, who is in her late 30s, is single and has three children who go to school. She has been selling charcoal for six years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in her food store. She started selling soup, paid school fees and household expenses and bought more sacks of charcoal, and she has paid back all her loan successfully.  

She hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell to more customers.  

Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her family house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Good Work," which totals 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Safooran

texts.en:
Ms Safooran is famous in her community for her patterns of hand embroidery. She has been in this work for about 5 years. She works hard every day so she may earn a living for her family. She is a mother of six children. Her husband works as a laborer for daily wages in a factory. There were days when he could not find any work in the factory due to recent energy crises in Pakistan, and had to return home without any money. His heart was heavy with a feeling of guilt and the burden of facing his family's disappointed faces. Safooran's children often slept without having any food. 

When Kashf's loan officers found Safooran in these circumstances they informed her about microfinance and the facilities they had to offer. The couple decided to take a loan so Safooran could start a business of hand embroidery at her home. She said that she remembered doing it with her mother in her childhood and was hopeful that the work would help them fight poverty. 

Currently Safooran has borrowed 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) and has used it to purchase reels of threads and packs of pearls and sequences from the market. She told Kashf that her business has opened new avenues that will help her protect her family from hunger and poverty.

loans.use: To purchase reels of threads and packs of pearls and sequences from the market.

loans.name: Krech

texts.en:
Krech appeared in the photo with his spouse in front of their house located in Kompong Speu province. He is 49 years old and a father of six children. Krech mainly focuses on a farming business as the major source of his income. He is grateful for having a supportive wife and children in managing the business each raining season. He has been doing this business for over 30 years. In addition, Krech works as a cook in a military training center and gets a decent wage to supplement his income.

This loan is to buy a couple of cows for the maintenance of his farm work. He will be able to maintain his business and reduce his expenses on plowing costs as in the old times. He has been with HKL for one loan time already, and he paid his loan back successfully. In the future, he hopes he could expand his rice farm and afford to send his children to a good college.

loans.use: to buy a couple of cows for the maintenance of his farm work.

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
Doung is 49 years old and married with five children: two single children and three married children. Her aim is to improve her family’s living conditions and provide her children a better quality of life. She is engaged in hog-raising to generate additional income. In years to come, Doung plans to improve her business and expand her pig farm so as to increase household income. She typically earns a profit of 20,000 KHR each day. She has been doing this business for almost 12 years. 

To improve the business, Doung is asking for a loan of 400,000 KHR to buy five piglets and feed. She mentions that the loan will enable her to improve her business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy five piglets and feed

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is 63 years old and an industrious woman who has devoted herself to her rice farming business for ages. She continues in this type of business, though it’s quite hard work for an old woman, because it’s the sole source of her family’s income. Through her perseverance and patience, Keo hopes for a better living someday. She has become a widowed mother of four children--one single child and three married children.
 
She is borrowing a loan of 600 USD to pay the outstanding balance to a shop owner, from whom she bought a water pump. This machine will help in carrying water for home use as well as for her rice field. She hopes this loan will be approved, and she promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to pay for outstanding balance to a shop owner, from whom she bought a water pump.

loans.name: Chet's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Chet is a 41-year-old married mother of eight children, four of whom are dependent on her; some are in school and some are too young for school. She farms rice on four hectares of farmland and complements that income by selling grocery items, while her husband works for others for a fee. Together, they are able to earn about 24,000 Riel (KHR) per day and manage to save almost 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield destroyed by insects is the main challenge for her rice-field. 

Chet is a first-time borrower with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. With her portion, she is going to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice quickly and fruitfully so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ibtihaj

texts.en:
Ibtihaj is a 38-year-old married woman who has three family members from AL Russeifeh, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and household goods. 

She wants to expand her home and start a business to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou, 37, is a farmer who lives in a rural area of the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia. She has five children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

Growing rice is the main source of family’s income,and she has been in this business for 12 years to support the family. Besides farming, her husband also supplements the income by producing palm juice. Chanthou’s family's daily income is 15,000 KHR, but she can manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Flood is the main challenge for her rice-paddy business.

She has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully repaid the past loans. Her group co-member is new with VisionFund this cycle.

Chanthou has wisely used the past three loans to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as she can keep up the good progress of her lifestyle and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Yas' Group

texts.en:
Yas is a 26-year-old married mother of two children who are dependent on her and too young for school. She lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia.

She has made a living through farming rice on a 2.5-hectare area of farmland while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area. The current business earns them about 25,000 KHR and they manage to save almost 20,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Insects are the main challenge for her rice-paddy business. 

This is the first loan for Yas’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Yas and her group co-member are requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR and 1,500,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to buy a buffalo to help her in her rice-paddy field. 

She hopes to receive high production and earn more income from the paddy so as to sustain her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and a buffalo to help in the farming.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: A resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Chreb is 34 years of age. She is married and has four children, three daughters and one son, all of whom are in school and dependent on her. The main source of her income comes from her rice-growing business and sesame-planting business. She has fourteen years of experience in the current business. Chreb received funding from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, one loan cycle ago, with which she succeeded in securing her family’s finances. As the shortage of water remains her main challenge and lowers her yield, Chreb is leading a group to request a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR each. Chreb will spend some of her loan portion on paying the gasoline fee for pumping water for her cash-crop, while using another portion of it to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She dreams of having sufficient working capital for her field of business and to boost her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a food vender. She sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together) and kenkey at Eguafo. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a security man.  

Abena has been selling waakye and kenkey for seven years. She assists her husband in providing for their family. She will use her loan to buy bags of  rice and maize for food preparation. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and maize for food preparation.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Ms Asma is a 32-year-old woman and a mother of three. She and her husband run a business of selling milk. The man shown in the photo is Asma's husband. They have been in the business for 2 years now and she says that these two years have been a blessing for her family in terms of business growth. They provide for her children who are going to school because unlike other children in town their mother is able to pay for their education. 

While speaking to Kashf's team Asma shared that life was not like this before. She along with her husband and children lived in a one room house which is in deplorable condition with the minimum of necessities. Taking a loan from Kashf helped her pay for expenses they thought she could never afford. 

At present she requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy another buffalo. She is expecting a huge boost in her income from the increase in the sales of milk.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Baños  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Baños este conformador por 7 señoras que viven por la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, este es un lugar turístico por sus aguas termales en donde se puede disfrutar de momentos amenos con la familia, la variedad de su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente se caracteriza por su hospitalidad y carisma, son personas que mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, trabajan a diario para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Enma y se encuentra realizando el primer crédito en el banco comunal Baños. Tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 12 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Doña Enma es oriunda del cantón Santa Rosa provincia del Oro, ha llegado a la ciudad de Cuenca hace 8 años para mejorar su calidad de vida, por el momento se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos pero con este crédito va a iniciar el negocio de venta de ropa.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra ropa de todo tipo para iniciar en este negocio.
 
Su meta es de llegar a tener su casa propia en la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Baños communal bank is made up of 7 women who live in the Baños parish in Cuenca. This place is a tourist attraction because of its thermal baths where pleasant times can be enjoyed with family. Its cuisine attracts the palate of its own people and of visitors. Its people are characterized by their hospitality and charisma. They maintain the culture and traditions of their people, working every day to improve the financial stability of their homes. 

One of the members of this group is Enma and she is taking out her first loan with the Baños communal bank. She is 32, married and has two children aged 12 and 4. Her oldest daughter is in high school. Her husband works as an employee in a private business. The house they live in is rented. 

Enma is from the Santa Rosa canton in the Oro province. She came to Cuenca 8 years ago to improve her quality of life. Right now she does houework and cares for her children but with this loan she is going to start a clothes selling business. 
 
She will invest the loan in buying cclothes to start the business.
 
Her goal is to own her own home in the city.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Aferdita

texts.en: Aferdita has been active in agriculture/livestock farming for 10 years in her rural home in the southern area of Albania, where she lives with her husband. She is in her late fifties and currently produces apples, vegetables and other fruits to sell in the local market along with milk and cheese. She has requested a loan for 100,000 LEK from VisionFund Albania to help her buy pesticides for her apple orchard in order to early prevent damage from pests and other insects. She says she wants to improve her farm income so that she can save for her retirement. This loan will be Aferdita’s second from the same institution; the previous one has been repaid.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for an apple orchard.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Yang is 70 years old, married and the father of five children, four of whom are married. He lives with his family in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. He is very industrious and skilled in farming because he has been in this type of work for over 40 years. He usually generates an average income of 8,000 KHR per day to cover his daily needs. At this moment, Yang is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to apply on his rice crops. With these supplies, Yang is convinced that he will be able to make improvements in his business and have a fruitful harvest in the coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to apply on his rice crops.

loans.name: Sherife

texts.en:
Sherife is married and has three children, who are 21, 18 and 16 years old and are still attending schools. They all live in south central Albania. She has been practicing animal husbandry for the past 10 years and has been selling delicious cheese and organic salty and unsalted butter to the local market and milk to dairy farms. These products have been liked by many locals who beg her for more. 

Sherife was extremely poor at first, and through VisionFund Albania, she found financial help. She is very grateful to the staff and institution because the five loans she got from them have helped her improve their lives and business.

This time, Sherife is requesting another loan to stock up on winter feed for the animals.

loans.use: To stock up on winter feed for the animals.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Esperanza tiene la edad de 47 años vive en el municipio de San Juan de la Concepción, dio inicio a su negocio con liquidación que obtuvo de su trabajo anterior en una zona franca de Managua donde laboro 8 años, poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con créditos obtenidos de otras casa financieras. Hoy en día solicita apoyo de crédito con AFODENIC para la compra de granos básicos, productos enlatados, embutidos, lácteos, repostería carnes y golosinas, para aumentar el inventario de su negocio; ella es soltera madre de 2 hijos por los que trabaja a diario para darles el sostén de cada día y un mejor futuro, tiene el apoyo de ellos en el negocio, al comienzo fue un poco difícil por la falta de experiencia en el negocio pero con el tiempo fue aprendiendo y hasta el día de hoy le va bien.
texts.en: Esperanza is 47 years old and lives in the town of  San Juan de la Concepción. She started her business with a severance package she had from a previous job in the Free Trade Zone of Managua where she worked for 8 years. Little by little she invreased her inventory with loans from other finance institutions. Today she is asking for a loan from AFODENIC to buy basic grains, canned goods, deli meats, dairy products, pastries, meats and snacks to increase her business inventory. She is a single mother of 2 children whom she works to support every day for a better future. They help her in the business. At first it was difficult due to lack of business experience, but over time she learned and today it is going well for her.

loans.use: to buy deli meats, dairy products, pastries, meat and snacks.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
From the Prey Chor district, Sun lives peacefully with her family, which is composed of seven members. She is 38 years old, a married woman, who has been involved in rice farming for the past 12 years. The skills required for this activity have come down to her from her ancestors, and it has been the primary source of her family’s income over time. Every rainy season, Sun has her husband and some her children assist her in the farm work. Sun wishes to have a suitable house for her family, as her present house was made of palm leaves, which are now old and broken. 

Sun would like to acquire a loan to add to her savings in order to purchase timber and other construction materials for housing purposes. With the help of her loan, she will be able to provide good living conditions for her family. She will be glad and thankful if the loan is approved. She promises to pay her loan back in full and on time.

loans.use: to buy timber and other construction materials to build a better house for her family.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is 36 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns about $2 each day. In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Sopheap is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more groceries to sell. By doing so, she will earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house to provide a higher quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nong

texts.en: Nong is 41 years old, and she has four children. Three of her children are single and one is married. She has a common-law relationship with her husband, who grows rice and sells recycled materials. Nong makes a living by purchasing and sourcing hair for local hairdressers. She has been in this type of business since 2000, and she usually yields approximately 20,000 KHR per day. Due to insufficient capital for investment in her business, Nong decided to take out a 2,100,000 KHR loan in order to purchase more hair to sell. She plans to save some of her profits and use some to pay school fees for her children and be prepared for future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair to sell to hairdressers.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun is 38 years old. He is married and resides with four children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a blacksmith for more than a year, earning approximately $12 per day. His wife runs a small cafe that sell foods and drinks. She earns about $20 per day. Oun is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase timber to build sheds to provide more space for customers. This money will help him expand the cafe. In the future, they would like to run an additional business and help their children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, they hope to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build sheds to provide more space for customers at his wife's cafe.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon is 56 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately $5 daily. One of her children is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phon is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more groceries to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea is 52 years old and a very diligent woman who is responsible for three school-aged children. She owns and manages a rice farm to earn a living.  Since she has been an farmer, she has gradually improved her business. She usually plants rice twice a year, because she gets enough water from the local irrigation system, and the land is favorable for growing crops. Chea works hard to increase her family's income, and she plans to set up a hog-raising business for additional income. Due to the lack of capital, she is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase piglets for fattening. She hopes to save for the betterment of her family and believes that her profits will provide a good, high quality life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 46 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been sewing clothes for more than four years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $2 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Mom is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more cloth to use for sewing. This purchase will help her sew more clothes to sell and earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to purchase more sewing machines to expand her shop and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to use for sewing

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 46 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been fattening up cattle for more than three years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a taxi driver. He earns about $4 daily. Two of her children are employed in Korea. They earn about $30 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Ly is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou is 30 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than two years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband runs a timber sawing service. He earns about $5 each day. Chanthou is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao is 39 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $18 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 daily. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $5 every day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Mao is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice. This purchase will help her expand her farming business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a pig farm and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she wants to move her house so she can live nearer to the market.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Vong lives in a thatched house in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is 52 years old and the mother of one child. As is common in her village, she has devoted herself to rice farming. Her husband works with her to ensure better yields and earn enough money to meet their living needs. Through hard work, they hope to uplift their family out of poverty someday. Vong is requesting a loan for $500 to purchase supplies such as pesticides and fertilizers to apply to her crops. Vong is very thankful for this loan, which will allow her to make her business more productive and earn more money from her day-to-day work.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en: Sophors is 39 years old. She is married and resides with her parents-in-law and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $10 per day. Sophors is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a mortar for her husband to use in mixing cement, sand and rock. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a mortar for her husband to use in mixing cement, sand and rock.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Tang is 22 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than a year, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $13 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Tang is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice. This purchase will help her expand her farming business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Oung

texts.en:
Oung, 53, manages a few hectares of farmland, on which she and her husband grow rice and vegetables for sale each harvest season. Through their farming practices and experience, they are able to make a good income of 30,000 KHR per day. With the income they earn, Oung is able to pay for her daily food and an allowance for one of her children, who is currently attending high school.

Oung wants to improve her farming business. That is why she is asking for financial support from HKL and Kiva, in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR, to purchase a water pump and fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs. She is confident that she will improve her current business through her loan and her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and fertilizer and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin is 43 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $3 each day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory, too. They earn about $9 per day. Because the present motorbike is old, Chin is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his taxi service. This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou is 33 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling dried fish and smoked fish for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 daily. Her husband runs a tilling service and earns about $5 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Chanthou is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more dried fish and smoked fish to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish and smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. He is 26 years old and married. To make a living, he has been involving in motorbike repair while his wife supplements the family's income by farming rice and raising pigs. Having been in this business for one year, he is able to earn about 12,000 Riels (KHR) per day and manage to save about 6,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Insufficient working capital is the main challenge for his business. 

This is the first microloan for Saron with Kiva's partner VisionFund. He is  requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. With this loan, he is going to buy spare parts for supporting his repair business and also buy a motor for resale. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase the income from the current business so as to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his repair business

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural area of the Kror kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Sok is 22 years old and married with two dependent children, both of whom are too young for school. She has earned a living through rice farming on 1.5 hectares of farmland for one year, earning about 13,000 Riels (KHR) per day. She manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from insects is the main challenge for her rice-paddy business. 

Sok's group consists of two members who are taking their first loan from VisionFund. She is leading her group to seek for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to buy a buffalo for helping her in the rice-field. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a buffalo

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Pho is 50 years old, married and lives with her two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and raising livestock for more than 20 years, and earns about $5 daily. Her husband is a teacher who earns about $2 per day. Her children have jobs and each earns about $3 a day. Pho is requesting a loan for $1,300 to buy a walking (or hand) tractor to use on her farm. In the future, she would like to expand her business and also build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a walking tractor to use on her farm.

loans.name: Vouch Lor

texts.en: Vouch Lor is 46 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband sells coconut. He earns about $10 per day. Two of her children are coconut vendors as well. They earn about $10 per day. In order to improve her business, Vouch Lor is requesting a loan of $600 to pay to have her truck repaired. This money and the truck repair will help to transport coconuts faster. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children gain higher education. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to pay to have her truck repaired.

loans.name: Sareum

texts.en: Sareum is 59 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 daily. One of her children is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day. In order to improve her business, Sareum is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk thread to use for weaving. This money will help her produce more woven cloth to sell and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase silk thread to use for weaving.

loans.name: Serena Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is just 22 years old, is married and has a baby who is still younger. She has been running a beauty salon for two years. She works from 9am to 10pm daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock missing beauty salon items, cover household expenses, some amount saved and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a new loan to buy salon equipment and home food. Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Serena, which totals 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and home food.

loans.name: Roerun

texts.en: Roeurn is 29 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband earns a living by selling dharma books. He earns about $20 per day. Roeurn is requesting a loan for $500 to purchase more dharma books for him to sell. This will allow him expand his business and earn more money for the family. In the future, she would like to begin a new business of raising pigs so that she can earn enough money to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more books for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Kov

texts.en:
Kov is 54 years old and a married woman, who lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Kov has five children, but four of them are already married and no longer live with her. Kov helps her husband in earning income, by dedicating herself to a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for more than three years, operating from a wooden pigpen behind her house. Also, Kov makes a kind of Khmer cake and retails cakes throughout her neighborhood, for additional income. However, her husband is the main earner of income for the household. He goes fishing every day along Tonle Sap River, and then he brings his catch to the marketplaces on the public transportation service.

In order to reduce transportation costs and make the couple's business more viable, Kov would like to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva, in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR, to help them purchase a used motorcycle for transporting fish to the marketplaces. She thanks all her kind lenders for the generosity of the loan. She has never made any late payment for her previous two loans. In the same manner, she will pay this loan back punctually as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for transporting fish to the marketplaces.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Kin is 41 years old and has six children. She is farmer who grows crops, especially rice, on a few lots of farmland alongside her spouse. She has been in this business for more than 20 years, usually earning an income of 6,000 KHR each day. Her business is somewhat tiring, but it is a great help in bringing up her children, some of whom need daily school allowances. Through her patience and hard work, she hopes to improve her business and, some day, to  experience good living conditions.

Kin wants to grow various kinds of beans on her farmland, to add to the income she generates from growing rice. But, because of her reduced level of income, she would like to take out a loan of 1,700,000 KHR to purchase the necessary seeds and supplies. Her revenue from this investment will go for her children’s education, and she will reinvest a portion of that revenue in her farming business for increased growth.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and supplies needed for farming.

loans.name: Futuro De Vida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro de vida está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de clima frió,  su accidentada geografía nos regala hermosos paisajes y es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gentes es amable y gentil al igual que las socias de este banco comunal quienes trabajan día para mejorar la situación económica de sus familias, mantienen viva la llama de la cultura y tradiciones que un día sus padres les inculcaron. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Livia, se encuentra realizando el sexto crédito en el banco comunal Futuro de Vida, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años, está separada de su esposo pero fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 20, 18, 17, 14, 10 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija y tercer hijo estudian y trabajan para ayudar a solventar los gastos de la casa, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente, su tercer hijo pasa en casa ayudando en los quehaceres del hogar y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es fruto de su trabajo.

Doña Livia se dedica al arreglo de casas, trabaja sin un horario fijo ya que su trabajo se acaba cuando las casas están arregladas, también se dedica a la crianza de pollos, esta actividad la inicio con el primer crédito que realizo en la banco comunal, estos animalitos los vende en pie o pelados.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para seguir creciendo en este negocio.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
The membership of the “Future of Life” communal bank consists of 7 women and 1 man. They live around Cuenca, a city with a cold climate. Its rugged geography offers beautiful vistas and since December 1999, it has been officially a part of the “Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.” Teh inhabitants are kind and gentle, as are the members of this communal bank, who work daily to improve the economic situation of their families, while keeping alive the call of their culture and traditions which their parents inculcated in them.

One member of the group is Livia, who is requesting her 6th loan with her bank. She lives in the Monay sector of Cuenca city, is 39 years old, and separated from her husband. But the fruit of their conjugal union is 6 children, ages 20, 18, 17, 14, 10 and 7. Livia's 1st daughter and 3rd son study and also work to help cover household expenses. Her 2nd daughter is married and lives independently. Livia's 3rd son remains at home, assisting with household chores, while the 2 youngest children are studying at a little school in the city. The house they live in is the fruit of their labor.

Livia cleans houses, working without a fixed schedule, since her work ends when the houses are cleaned. Also, she raises chickens. Livia began this activity with her 1st loan through her communal bank. She sells the chickens either live or butchered.
 
Livia's loan will be invested in purchasing chickens to continue expanding the business. 

Livia's goal is to finish her house, since some sections are not yet completed.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son is 33 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling several kinds of cake in front of the school for more than seven years, earning approximately $15 daily. Her husband runs a business of purchasing junk materials to resell. He earns about $20 per day. One of her children is a garment worker, who earns about $3 each day. In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Son is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a Tuk-Tuk, for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help her husband to generate additional income for the family. Son's goals for the future are to build a new house, and to help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk-Tuk for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: 040312Thôn Thành Xuân - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Duyên is 48 years old and is married with four children. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Duyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Duyên faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 040310Thôn thành xuân - Hoằng Trường solidarity group. Duyên supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Duyên has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. In the future, Duyên hopes for her business to do well and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Orn is 33 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating agricultural crops for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband sells bread. He earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Orn is requesting a loan of $1000, which she will use to purchase farmland for cultivating agricultural crops. This purchase will help her increase her crop harvest, and she will earn more income for the family. Her future plans are to expand the business and to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila, who is in her early 50s, is a married parent of six children. She has been working very hard to support her family. Five of her children are in their 20s and one of them still attends school. The family lived in another northern municipality that is more rural and where they experienced many difficulties prior to moving to their current location. She has a livestock business that has been going very well, especially the past seven years. She has been selling milk and animals and has been making a good profit. Dila is borrowing 300,000 LEK through VisionFund Albania to build a new stable.

Dila has been sustaining her business activities through the past 20 years and this is only her second time requesting a loan. Dila hopes that with lenders' support, she will be able to build the stable before winter kicks in.

loans.use: to build a new stable before winter kicks in.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila, 52, is married with two children, one of them still in school and the other born disabled. Looking after him has been a full-time job for her. She never worked until five years ago when she started selling cement and lime from her home. 

The need for items she sells in her town has been high ever since she started because construction has been growing with the relocation of families from the rural areas.

Dila wants to buy more items to resell and this is the reason she is requesting a loan from VisionFund Albania. With the profit, she plans on improving the living conditions for her children and especially for her disabled child.

loans.use: to buy more cement and lime to resell.

loans.name: Mt Uluguru Group

texts.en:
Lilian, who is in her late 30s, is married and has three children who go to school. She also looks after one relative (an orphan). She has been running a genge business (fruits and vegetable) since 2004. She works from 4 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be her 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to build a display frame for her business, to buy a TV and DVD deck and to pay for household expenses and school fees; she has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase the stock of fruits and vegetables to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own family house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mt Uluguru, which totals 13 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her fruits and vegetables stock to resell.

loans.name: 04.7.2 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Nhân is 42 years old, married and has three children, two of them dependents and the other grown up. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat and has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Nhân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and beef to resell. Nhân is the group leader of the 04.7.2 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Nhân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhân has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nhân hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and beef to resell.

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Uy is 34 years of age and the mother of a teenaged child and an infant.  She resides with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She does farm work as her primary business activity, and she can generate income of 20,000 KHR each day to meet her daily needs and care for her children. She has been working in her business for ages, and she employs good farming practices to make progress during her entrepreneurship.

Uy would like to have additional financial support through HKL in order to purchase planks of wood and columns to make renovation of her present house. The house is too old and was broken due to its great age. She hopes to obtain this loan, so she can get her house re-built and own an appropriate shelter to keep her family warm and dry, especially in the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase planks of wood and columns to renovate her broken house.

loans.name: Gentiana

texts.en:
Gentiana is a 34-year-old married mother of three daughters, 15, 8 and 2 years old. She lives with her husband and children in northwest Albania. The main hardship Gentiana faced was that she married a Catholic man and people in her village did not want her there anymore. This caused them to move to a new location five years ago where inter-religious marriages where embraced and not judged.
 
While the relocation was not at all easy for them, starting an Internet café business in the new location made the move worthwhile. Over the past three years, the business has been going well and she plans on expanding it in the near future by bringing in the latest high-definition computers. 

For the moment, Gentiana is requesting her first loan to add more and different inventory items for her business, knowing that this will generate more income.

loans.use: to add more and different inventory items to her Internet cafe business.

loans.name: Tereze

texts.en:
Tereze is 54, married and has two children, ages 20 and 18, who both attend school. They live in a little town in northeast Albania, where Tereze has been operating a little general store for the past five years. Despite the fact that she has been the only one to support her family financially, the business has been doing very well and she has been generating a good income from it.

Tereze is requesting a loan of 100,000 LEK to add more items to her store for resale. This will be her first loan through VisionFund Albania, yet she wants to assure every lender that, as a responsible person, she will pay the loan back and she is appreciative of everyone for their financial support.

loans.use: To add more items to her general store for resale.

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his early 20s, is married and has one child who is still young. For one-and-a-half years now, Salum has been earning a living by running a food shop.  He works from 6:00am to 11:00pm daily and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

He requests a third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a plot of land, made more bricks, increased his inventory of rice, covered household expenses, and has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase the food shop's inventory.  His dream is to one day be able to build a house.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Uwezesho", which totals 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the food shop's inventory.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Doña Concepción tiene la edad de 56 años, de familia agricultora desde hace 40 años se dedican a esta actividad, cultiva 2 manzanas de cítricos en donde ella sola saca adelante esta labor con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes todos son mayores de edad y le ayudan con el trabajo de la agricultura y otros le brindan apoyo económico para los diferentes gastos del hogar. Este es su noveno crédito solicitado para comprar abono, urea, completo e insecticida, al comienzo Concepción tuvo muchas dificultades para dichas siembras pero poco a poco logro el financiamiento el que ha sabido aprovechar, para que  en un futuro heredarles a sus hijos y nietos las plantaciones que con mucho esfuerzo saco adelante.
texts.en:
Concepción is 56 years old.  She comes from a farming family and has worked for forty years as a farmer.  She cultivates two plots of citrus.  She does the work with the help of her children who are all adults.  They help her with the farming work and others provide financial support for her household expenses.

This is her ninth loan and she will use it to purchase manure, fertilizer, and insecticide.  At the beginning, Concepción had many difficulties with her crops but slowly she was able to take advantage of financing.  In the future, she wants to leave her children and grandchildren the land that she has improved with a lot of effort.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Tuyangatane Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her mid 30s, is married with one child who goes to school.  She has been running a food vendor business since 2002 and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use to renovate the place where she sells the food and to restock the missing items in the food store. Her dream is to one day be able to own a big cafe.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tuyangatane" which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to renovate the place where she sells the food and to restock the missing items in the food store.

loans.name: Mareth

texts.en:
Mareth is 60 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling rice, drinks and gasoline for more than seven years, earning approximately $10 daily. Two of her children are employed in a rice mill. They earn about $6 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Mareth is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase all kinds of drinks and gasoline to sell. This money will help her to expand the business and earn more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to run a food store and help her children to earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she wants to build fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of drinks and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with her seasonal agricultural farming business.

loans.name: 04.16.2 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to make tailor-made clothing and to do clothing repairing service. Thu has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business, is lack of capital.

Thu is 46 years old, and she is married and has two children. She is the group leader of the 04.16.2 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. Thu, who has two dependents, lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough profit to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines to make tailor-made clothing and to do clothing repairing service.

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Abubakari, who is in his early 30s, is single with one child who is still going to school. Abubakari has been selling secondhand clothes for two years now. He works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Abubakari's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more secondhand clothes to resell and for household expenses, and he has paid back his loan successfully. His dream is to one day be able to obtain a place in a better trading center. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Royal", which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Silvia Yamileth

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su mamá y dos sobrinos. Ella desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, como a la siembra de maíz, maicillo y fríjol, junto a su mamá. Silvia es la última de sus hermanos, ellos viven en otros lugares. Hace unos años atrás instalo una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, debido a que en el lugar donde viven no hay más tiendas y su mamá la apoyado bastante.  Los productos que necesita para vender en su tienda, los tiene que adquirir en un pueblo y en una ciudad que esta a treinta minutos de su casa caminando a pie, debido a que no hay transporte colectivo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más productos de la canasta básica y para comprar dos cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos dentro de 3 a 5 meses.  Con la inversión, ella dispondrá de mercadería suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que es la única tienda que existe en su  comunidad, además tendrá los cerdos que los venderá y recibirá ingresos que le servirán para aportar dinero para los gastos del hogar. Ella desea ahorrar para hacerle mejoras a la casa y continuar mejorando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia, 19, is single living with her mother and two nephews.  Since she was very little she’s worked with her mother doing chores in agriculture like growing corn, sorghum and beans.  Silvia is the youngest of her siblings; they all live in other places.

A few years ago she opened a grocery store because there weren’t any stores in the place where they live; her mother has supported her quite a bit.  She has to get the merchandise she sells in the store in a town and city that are a half-hour walk from home; there is no public transportation available.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy more basic staples and to buy two pigs to fatten up and sell in two to five months.  With this investment, she’ll have enough merchandise on hand to meet customer demand and will earn income that will be contributed towards household expenses.  She wants to save up to do some home improvements and to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock the store and to buy two pigs to fatten up and sell.

loans.name: Merikerebu Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth,who is in her late 40s, is married and has two children who go to school. She has had a business selling new clothes for 12 years now. She works from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the business' inventory, finished building her house, paid school fees and household expenses, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more stock of clothes to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to own a frame for her business location.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Marikebu", which totals 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Desde los 10 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, su padre fue quien le enseño. Desde entonces él ha trabajo en eso como una forma de obtener los ingresos para sostenimiento de su familia y también porque le gusta ese trabajo. Él se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a ordeñar sus vacas, luego sale a dejarlas al terreno para que coman y él se toma una taza de café y se lleva su comida al trabajo que esta a treinta minitos de su casa; ahí trabaja durante ocho horas, para regresar a su casa a almorzar e ir a recoger los animales al terreno. Todo este trabajo él lo hace con el firme deseo de que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario para vivir y desarrollarse. 

Para adquirir los insumos para sus cultivos, él debe trasladarse a pie unos diez minutos, para abordar el autobús que lo conduce a la ciudad, el recorrido tarda una hora treinta minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar seis sacos de abono, un galón de foliar y dos litros de herbicidas. Con la inversión, podrá aplicar el abono a su cultivo de maicillo, porque ya esta sembrado pero no tiene dinero para fertilizarlas. Lo que él desea, es trabajar para ahorrar y heredarles a sus hijos una casa para cuando se casen y terreno para que sigan cultivando; proporcionarles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 49, is married and has two children.  Since the age of ten he’s worked in agriculture; his father taught him.  Since then, he’s worked in that as a way of earning income to support his family and also because he likes that kind of work.  He rises at 4am to milk his cows and then takes them out to pasture so that they can eat and he has a cup of coffee and takes his lunch to work which is thirty minutes from home.  He works there for 8 hours and returns home to have lunch and go bring his animals back from the pasture.  He does all this work with the firm desire that his children have everything they need to live and grow.  In order to get the supplies for his crops, he must walk about ten minutes to catch the bus that takes him to the city; the trip takes an hour and a half.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy six sacks of manure, a gallon of leaf fertilizer and two liters of herbicide.  With this investment, he’ll be able to apply manure to his sorghum crops because it’s already planted but he does not have the money to fertilize them.  What he wants is to work to save up and pass down a house to his children when they get married and land so that they can continue farming; he also wants to provide schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of manure, a gallon of leaf fertilizer and two liters of herbicide.

loans.name: Yuth's Group

texts.en:
Yuth, 32, is married and living with her family in a village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For the last 13 years, Yuth and her husband have been farming rice on one hectare of farmland as the main source of the family’s income. Together, they can earn about 15,000 KHR per day from the current business for the family’s needs. 
 
Yuth’s group consists of herself and two additional members, and this is her first cycle as a client with VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan with VisionFund. Yuth, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and fully so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: 010208Thôn Hồng Kỳ- Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle for resale.

Tuyến is 52 years old and she is married with two children. Tuyến is the group leader of the 010208 Thôn Hồng Kỳ- Hoằng Phụ solidarity group, which consists of five members. Tuyến lives with no dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, and her children are grown up.

In 2012, Tuyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyến has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyến has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main harship that Tuyến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Tuyến hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle for resale.

loans.name: Tujikwamue Ukonga Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her mid 40s, is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been selling soft drinks at wholesale price for one year now. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a freezer, made more bricks, paid school fees, increased the soft drinks inventory, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase the soda inventory and to pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Tujikwamue Ukonga", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase inventory of soft drinks for resale and to pay school fees.

loans.name: 030520-Liên Hà- Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết works in agriculture farming, poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle for resale.

Tuyết is 34 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 030520-Liên Hà- Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. Tuyết supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, while another child is grown up.

In 2007, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyết has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tuyết has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Tuyết hopes to buy a motorbike, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle for resale.

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Hean, 39, is a married mother of five children living in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She still has four of her five children to take care of. All of them work for others for pay. To support the family, she and her husband engage in fishing, and they sometimes work for others for pay, to be able feed their family better. They have been in business for five years. They can earn about 50,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save almost 30,000 KHR each day after meeting their daily expenses. 
This is Hean's third loan from VisionFund. She has completely repaid her first two loans, which have helped her support her family. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fishing equipment, such as a cast net, pliers, etc. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cast net, pliers and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Norb

texts.en:
One breadwinner in a family of three children, Norb is 60 years old and a rural villager from Sampov Meas district of Pursat. To make a living, she does rice-cropping and sells clothes, while her husband sells herbal medicines in order sustain her daily expenses. 

She has been involved in this business for 20 years. This is her second-cycle loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Her prior loan has upgraded her living condition gradually. 

She is now seeking a new loan of 3,500,000 KHR. With this portion, she is going to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her cash crop. Moreover, her small portion of it will be added to her existing savings in order to buy a decent motorbike for supporting her business. She hopes that she will gain more yield so she can expand her business gradually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her cash crop.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenetsetseg is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a small house in Khovd Province, Mongolia. Her husband, Nyamtseren, is 51 years old. He works as a driver for a private company. Her daughters, Bolor-erdene and Nandin-erdene, are both 22 years old. They are college students. 

Mrs Erdenetsetseg started her clothing retail business in 2002. In the future, she plans to expand her business into baby clothes and maternity clothes retail. She is a hardworking and diligent woman. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes from China because Mongolian harsh winter is coming and people are starting to buy warm clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes from China.

loans.name: Age

texts.en:
Age, a 54-year-old married mother of two children, 25 and 17 years old, has been the sole financial supporter of her family for a very long time, because her husband is disabled and cannot work.

Some seventeen years ago, Age started her goat husbandry business, which in the first years produced hardships in almost every direction -- financial and physical depletion. As time passed and she became better at it, this activity picked up, and since then it hasn’t slowed at all. Her goat husbandry business has been the only source of income for her family.

Age is applying for a loan at this time, to build a barn and shelter for her goats, so they will sleep warmly in the winter. Note here, that winters in the northern district of Albania are extremely bitter and snowy, and consequently hundreds of animals would if they were not sheltered well.

loans.use: to build a barn and shelter for her goats before winter's bluster starts

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap is 32 years old. She is married and lives with one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $13 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. In order to improve her family’s finances, Pheap is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a walking tractor to run a tilling service. This purchase will help her generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to run a tilling service.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Mr Ganbold is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a small house in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife, Yanjindulam, works as a teacher in a kindergarten. His three children, Gombosuren, Enhjin and Anujin, ages 15, 13 and 9, are secondary school students. 

Mr.Ganbold  started his woodworking business at home in 2002. He makes traditional style furniture and he is popular in the town. He is planning to expand his business, to have his own workplace and to increase working capital in order to maximize his profit. He is a hardworking and honest man. He is asking 1,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his furniture making business.

loans.name: Shkelzen

texts.en:
Shkelzen, a rural villager from south central Albania, worked in Albania's neighboring country - Greece - until recently. He is married and has three children ranging in age from 4 to 12 years old. While he remained most of the time away from his family, his wife managed to take care of their children and agriculture-livestock business and make a good income from that business activity.

Shkelzen is now applying for a loan through VisionFund Albania to finish building a family house that they have already started, but have no money to put everything together before winter starts.

While Shkelzen and his wife seek lenders appreciation in this matter, they want to let them know that lenders’ kindness would be a great help to their family.

loans.use: to finish building his family's house before winter starts.

loans.name: Theavin's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kandal Province’s Kandal Stoeng District, Theavin is a 27 year old mother of four dependent sons, all of whom are still in school. To support her children, she has been working as a tailor for eight years while her husband has been farming rice and sometimes supplementing the family’s income by working as a paid construction worker. Together, they can earn about KHR 20,000 per day, and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. Lack of working capital is the main challenge.

Theavin received her first loan from Kiva’s partner VisionFund a cycle ago, and she completely repaid the loan with VisionFund. She has used the past loan to better support her living. Now she is leading her group of four to apply for a loan. As the leader, Theavin will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice fruitfully and timely so as to better her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Sary is age 50 and married. She has four children to take care of; some of them help the family’s business and others have their own employment. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for twenty years.  She also sells grocery items to earn income for the family. For additional income, Sary’s husband works for others in the local area, for a fee.

Sary’s group consists of three members who are all female.  Sari has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. The past loan helped her to gradually improve her earnings. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund of 1,200,000 KHR, each. Sary, the group leader, is going to use part of her loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and part of it to purchase more grocery items to resell, such as eggs, sugar, and candied fruit. She hopes to grow a healthy rice crop, to increase her family’s income and make their standard of living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and grocery items to resell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yeou

texts.en: Yoeu is 49 years old. She is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $3 daily. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 daily. Yoeu is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and toilet. This money will help her provide sanitary living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her youngest child earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and toilet.

loans.name: Hile

texts.en:
Hile and his family live in northern Albania and he is in his mid-40s, and married with three young children, ages 13, 10 and 8 years old, who are going to school.

For the past 18 years, Hile, a talented welder, has been sustaining his welding business that has brought a decent income to him and his family. He has established a wide and steady clientele throughout the region.

Hile is requesting a loan of 150,000 ALL (Albanian Lek) from VisionFund Albania to purchase different electrodes, a welding mask and other tools that will help him do more work and perform faster, without putting himself at risk for injuries.

loans.use: to buy different types of electrodes, a welding mask and other tools needed in welding.

loans.name: Wastara Group

texts.en:
