Doris, who is in her early 20s, is married and has two children (a boy and a girl); one child goes to school and the other is still a baby. Doris has been running two businesses selling fabrics (vitenge) and also running mamalishe (a restaurant) for three years. She works from 6AM TO 4PM daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

She requests a third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more fabric, increased the food items in her restaurant and covered household expenses, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She requests a new loan to buy more restaurant items to make more food to resell to more customers. Her dream is to one day be able to build a nice house for her family.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Wastara", which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more restaurant items to make more food.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat is 39 years old. She is married and lives with her five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Sinat has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than four years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day. Three of her children are garment workers. They earn about $8 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sinat is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase rice and fertilizer to resell. By doing so, she would earn additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her livestock business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase rice and fertilizer for resale.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chum is 49 years old.  She is a widowed mother living in a rural village of Ek Phnom district in Battambang province.  She has six children, two of whom are dependent on her and still attend school.  As a widow, she has been involved in selling coconuts for 16 years to better feed the family.  The main challenge she faces is the low price of coconuts. 

Chum is a new borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She is applying for a loan of $800 from VisionFund.  Chum is going to use a portion of this loan to buy more coconuts to resell.  She will use the remaining portion of it to buy a proper computer for her children’s education.  Through this loan, she hopes to grow her current business in order to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su madre quien le ayuda en el negocio y así mismo con sus dos hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de cremas, maquillajes, colas y ganchos para el cabello, peines y algunos juguetes, el negocio esta en la esquina de la calle principal de donde reside, donde es vista por muchas personas. Junto con su madre se turnan para tener una jornada de trabaja menos pesada y aprovechar todo el día. Ana solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de incrementar su mercadería y así tener  más variedad de productos y de precios.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old and lives with her mother, who helps with the business. Ana also has two children, ages 6 and 8. She has a shop where she sells crèmes, make-up, hair clips, hairpins, combs, and a few toys. Her business is located on the corner of the main street of her town where it can be seen by many people. Ana and her mother take turns so that the workload is lighter throughout the day.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. Elsa wants to increase her merchandise so that she can have a wider variety of products at different prices.

loans.use: to buy hairpins, cosmetics, and crèmes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde y cría de cerdos. Esta actividad la aprendió gracias a su esposo, ya que juntos trabajaban como jornaleros en los cultivos de caña de azúcar de la localidad. Al identificar que los ingresos que recibían como jornaleros no les eran suficientes decidieron engordar cerdos y novillos para posteriormente venderlos y recibir un ingreso extra. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos novillos de repasto y dos cerdos. Con la inversión, ella estará segura que dentro de unos ocho meses tendrá un ingreso por la venta de esos animales. Lo que desea, es ahorrar para mejorar su vivienda ya que se encuentra muy deteriorada.
texts.en:
Ana, 60, is married and has a son.  She’s been working raising cattle and pigs for the last four years.  She learned this activity thanks to her husband because they used to work together as day laborers in the local sugarcane fields.  When they noted that the income they earned working as day laborers was insufficient they decided to fatten up pigs and calves to resell and earn extra income.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy two calves and two pigs to raise.  With this investment she’s sure that in about 8 months she’ll earn income from the sale of those animals.  What she wants is to save up to do some home repairs because it’s quite deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy two calves and two pigs..

loans.name: Aem

texts.en:
Aem is a villager from the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district.  She is 51 years old and married with two children.  To make a living, she and her husband have been raising pigs as their primary business for 10 years.  In addition, they supplement their income by selling rice-soup in the local area.  From their current business, they are able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Aem is a new borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from VisionFund.  She will use this loan to buy piglets to raise and pig feed to nourish them.  In addition, she will use a portion of this loan to buy spices necessary for making rice-soup.  She hopes to increase her income from the current business, enabling her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and pig feed to nourish them.

loans.name: Bunthoeurn's Group

texts.en: Bunthoeurn, 47, is married and has one child. He and his family live in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. This couple manages their one-and-a-half hectare, on which they grow rice; it is the business that he has been with for five years. His main challenge is the shortage of water supply which causes the crop become fruitless. This is the second loan with Bunthoeurn and the first loan for his co-members; all of them are in the same group. Bunthoeurn can afford sufficient food from the past loan which he has well-managed in a smart manner and completely repaid back. Now, he is seeking 1,200,000 KHR, while other two members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, his loan portion will be used to buy fertilizer for his rice farm and some portion of it will be used to fix his house. He hopes to earn more income so that he can keep upgrading his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice farm and to fix his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds to plant.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sophorn is 30 years old and married with two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To support her family, she has been selling fish in the local area for two years, while her husband also supplements his family’s income by working for others for a fee. From the current business, she can earn about US $7 per day and can save about US $2 each day after deducting daily expenses. 

This is the third microloan for Sophorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans have helped her better support her current business. 

Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund of US $1,100. She is going to use this loan to buy more fish to resell. With this loan, she hopes to increase a large income from the current business so as to better her living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Srurng's Group

texts.en:
Srurng, 43, is married with nine children. She resides in a rural village located in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. Of her nine children, seven are still small and are dependent on Srurng, while the other two have their own employment. For the last ten years, she has been raising pigs as the family's primary source of income, and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee.

Srurng has been a member of VisionFund for four loan cycles already, and she is part of a four-person loan group with other women from her village; they have been with VisionFund from one to four cycles as well. 

Srurng's past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family and allowed her to support her children's travels to work in Thailand. Now, as the group leader for this loan, she will use her portion to buy four piglets to raise. She hopes the loan's impact will increase her pig raising business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy four piglets to raise.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es: José Salvador de cincuenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas; el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y con fácil acceso a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad es muy conocido y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad del producto, los buenos precios pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; José es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, siempre esta a la expectativa de encontrar oportunidades que le ayuden a ganarse un futuro mejor, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo porque sabe que así logrará el éxito, en la ultima siembra tuvo perdidas y en esta temporada quiere aprovechar para recuperarse, necesita invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. José Salvador tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Salvador, 50, lives with his life companion and their children in a house of his own.  He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  He’s been in this line of work for several years and has attained much experience that allows him to obtain the best harvests.  His farmland is located in a zone with a high concentration of agriculture and easily accessible from home.  He sells all around his community and he’s very well-known.  He’s acquired a large clientele that prefers him because of the quality of products, the good prices and above all the excellent service.

José is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work.  He’s always on the lookout for opportunities that will help him attain a better future.  He strives to the maximum every day because he knows that’s the way to attain success.  

He had some losses the previous season and he wants to take advantage of this one to recuperate.  He needs to invest which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.  José Salvador has good payment references and is very responsible. He insists that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time is confident that he will give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en:
Sreang is 39 years old. She is married and resides with her six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling palm juice for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband (who joins her in the picture) is a rice farmer who earns about $3 per day. Three of her children are garment workers. They earn about $8 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sreang is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase farmland to use for farming. This purchase will help her expand her farming business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a livestock business and help her children earn a higher education. Moreover, she wants to fix her house wall.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for farming.

loans.name: Arsenal Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her early 30s, is married and living together with her husband with two girls, of whom one goes to school and another is still a baby.  She has been running a fruits and vegetables business (genge) and also has owned a vegetable garden for three years now. It enables her to make a good monthly profit.

She requested the second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to purchase a garden pump machine and seeds, and to cover household expenses. She has paid back her loan successfully.  

She hopes for a loan to open a new business of secondhand clothes to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a farm for agriculture.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Arsenal", which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a new business of secondhand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila tiene 64 años de edad,  es casada. Vive en casa propia, con  cónyuge e hija mayor. Comunidad ubicada en el Distrito de  Tambogrande .  La comunidad a la que pertenece muestra deseos de superación y ya cuentan con servicio básico de luz eléctrica. 

La actividad que desarrolla Petronila es la confección y venta de ropa para varones y mujeres, siendo conocida en la zona y contando con clientela establecida. Contando a la fecha con amplia experiencia en su negocios. El negocio está a cargo solo de ella ya que esposo trabaja como vendedor de ropa, siendo también maestro sastre. Se dedican a la confección, costura y venta de ropa hace más de 25 años.  Ambos con su trabajo sacan adelante su hogar.

Petronila ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la confección, costura de prendas de vestir y compra de un lote de mercadería de ropa para damas, caballeros. 
Petronila en todo momento demuestra grandes deseos de superación y crecimiento en el negocio.
texts.en:
Petronila, 64, is married and lives with her husband and oldest daughter in her own house in the Tambogrande district.  The community she lives in wants to improve itself and they already have basic electric services.

Petronila's job is tailoring and selling men's and women's clothing.  She's known in the area and has regular customers and wide experience in her business.  She has sole responsibility for the business because her husband works selling clothes, and is also a master tailor.  They have worked tailoring, sewing, and selling clothing for more than 25 years.  Together they get their household ahead with their work.

Petronila has requested a loan for 2000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy supplies for tailoring and sewing clothing and to buy a lot of women's and men's clothing.
 
Petronila always shows a great desire to improve herself and grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make clothing

loans.name: Raem's Group

texts.en:
Raem is 47 years old.  She is rice farmer in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Sangke district in Cambodia.  She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still attend school in the local area.  In addition to rice farming, she has been growing corn on two hectares of farmland for 20 years.  She earns approximately 30,000 KHR per day from her current business and manages to save 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Raem has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles.  She completely repaid the previous loans, which have helped her to better support her current business.  Now she and her group member would like to request another loan with VisionFund of 1,400,000 KHR and 600,000 KHR respectively.   As the leader, Raem will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.  In addition, she will use a portion of it to pay labor fees.  Through this loan, she hopes to obtain a high yield from her plantation business so as to maintain her good progress improving her lifestyle and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Maen's Group

texts.en:
Maen is 33 years old and resides in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia.  She has two dependent children who still attend school.  To make a living, she has been engaged in rice farming on 10 hectares of farmland for 10 years.  Her husband supplements this income by catching fish in the local area. They currently earn approximately 70,000 KHR per day from the existing business and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after paying daily expenses.  Low crop yield is the main challenge Maen faces with her rice-paddy business.

Maen’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle.  Maen completely repaid the previous loan, which has relieved her family’s burden and improved their livelihood.  Now She is leading her group to apply for another loan.  As the leader, Maen will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for labor fees related to water pumping.  

Through this loan, she hopes to ensure a large and timely rice harvest in order to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Kimchuon's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural part of the Mongkul Borey district in Cambodia's Banteay Meanchey province, Kimchuon is 43 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living by raising pigs (she currently has five) while her husband patches tires and cleans motors. Together, they can earn about KHR 35,000 per day and save roughly KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the fifth loan for Kimchuon’s two-member VisionFund loan group, and both women have successfully repaid their past loans with VisionFund. These loans have helped Kimchuon better support her family. As the loan group leader, she wants to use her portion to buy more piglets and pig feed. She hopes to raise her pigs to be fat and healthy, so she can sell them for a good price and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 40, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, in Cambodia. She is a married mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. Her family’s income comes from leasing 1.5 hectares of rice paddy and planting cassava on a two-hectare plot of farmland. Sophy has farmed for twenty-two years to make a living. With her current land to farm, she earns about KHR 55,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 24,000 per day for the family's future needs. 

Sophy has been a member of VisionFund for one loan cycle already and she completely repaid the loan. That loan was successful, and she was able to use it to slightly improve her living standards. Now Sophy is applying for another loan of KHR 2,500,000, and she is going to use it to buy another plot of farmland. By helping her extend her farmland, the loan will increase Sophy's business and help her earn more income - all of which helps her work toward her dream of one day cultivating rubber trees.

loans.use: to buy another plot of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Ином  парень в возрасте 28 лет. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Он всю свою жизнь занимается животноводством так как не имеет образования. У него дома есть дойная корова и его жена продает соседям молоко. У них доход только от этого вида деятельности поэтому они стараются развивать свой бизнес. У них четверо детей и они хотят чтобы дети жили в достатке и учились в учебных заведениях. На полученный кредит Ином хочет купить несколько голов скота и увеличить поголовье. Ином благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Inom is a 28 year-old young man.  He is married and has four children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry all of his life because he does not have education.  He has a dairy cow at home, and his wife sells milk to the neighbors.  Inom and his wife receive income only from this business and this is why they try to develop it.  They have four children and want their children to live well and study at educational institutions.  Inom wants to use this loan to buy several heads of livestock and increase its headcount.  He is grateful to Arvand for the financial support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy several heads of livestock and increase its headcount.

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Saroen is 38 years old and lives with her family members in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province.  She has five dependent children, some work for others for a fee while help with the family’s business. 

For the last 10 years, she has been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income while her husband works as a paid worker in Thailand.   The current business earns Saroen about 60,000 KHR per day and she can save about 20,000 KHR each day for the family’s future needs.

Saroen’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles.  The previous loans, which she has fully repaid, have helped her relieve the family’s burden and improve their livelihood.  Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan.  As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.  She hopes to make increase the output of her rice harvest so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ken's Group

texts.en:
Ken, 40, is married with seven children and residing in a rural village of the Sangke District of Battambang Province. Three of her children are dependents and still in school. To support the big family, she has been farming rice for twenty-five years while her husband works as a worker in Thailand to earn more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 36,000 per day and can save about KHR 16,000 each day for future needs. 

Ken’s group consists of two members who are both female, and they both have been with VisionFund for five cycles. Ken completely paid back the loans with VisionFund and successfully used the loans to better support her family. She and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,100,000 and KHR 1,400,000, respectively. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to produce more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru: Икромчон  мужчина в возрасте  32 лет.  Он женат и имеет четверых детей.  Его жена домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей также продажей молока. Икромчон занимается   животноводством, откармливает скот у себя дома. Так как у него не было возможности учиться и получить образования он вынужден заниматься животноводством.  Икромчон   дома несколько голов скота и  дойная корова которая каждый день дает 10 литров молока. Его жена продает соседям молоко. Откармливание скота это их единственный доход поэтому они стараются развивать свой бизнес. На фотографии он со своим конем на котором ездит в горы и привозит свежую траву для скота.  На полученный кредит Икромчон   хочет приобрести скот и увеличить поголовье скота. Заранее благодарит за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Ikromjon is a 32 year-old man.  He is married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker and involved in raising children and also selling milk.  Ikromjon is involved in animal husbandry and fattens up livestock at home.  Because he did not have an opportunity to obtain education, he had to get involved in animal husbandry.  Ikromjon has several heads of livestock at home and a dairy cow that gives ten liters of milk every day.  His wife sells milk to their neighbors.  Fattening up livestock is their only source of income and this is why they try to develop this business.  The photograph shows Ikromjon with his horse that he uses to go to the mountains and bring fresh grass for livestock.  Ikromjon wants to use this loan to buy livestock and increase livestock headcount.  He is grateful in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Sosaath

texts.en:
Married with two young children, Sosaath, 24, lives in a village in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, in Cambodia. The main source of her family’s income is from planting cassava on 1.5 hectares of farmland. Having farmed cassava for three years, Sosaath is able to earn a daily income of KHR 21,600 to support her family. She manages to save about KHR 6,000 per day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Sosaath with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes the fertilizer will help her increase her crop yields, so as to make a better living and help her family move into a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava crops.

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Dambae district, Samath is 43 years old and married with eight children. Five of her kids are still in school and dependent on her, while the other three have their own employment. She and her husband earn a living through planting cashew and cassava. With twenty years' farming experience, she manages to earn about 44,000 KHR per day and can save about 22,000 KHR each day for the family's future needs. 

Samath is part of a loan group through Viva's partner, VisionFund. Her two-member group is made of she and another woman, both of whom have already successfully paid back their first loan. Samath used that first loan to support her family and pay for her children's education. As the group leader for this second loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes that with these supplies, she can increase her crop yield and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cashew and cassava crops.

loans.name: Yeang's Group

texts.en:
A 55-year-old widow residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Yeang has six children to take care of and earns a living through planting cassava on one-hectare farmland. Having been in this business for ten years, she can earn about KHR 12,500 per day to make a living and can save about KHR 5,000 each day for the future needs. 

Yeang’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and Yeang is the third cycled client, while her group member is the second cycled client, with VisionFund. Yeang successfully used the past loans to better her living conditions. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Yeang, who is the leader, will use a portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for plowing and labor. She hopes to grow more cassava so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Khun is 25 years old and married with one daughter who is still small. For the last four years, he has been farming rice on four-hectare farmland to support his family. With the current business, he can earn about KHR 25,000 per day and can save about KHR 15,000 each day for future needs.

Khun has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles and he completely paid back the loans, which have enabled him to afford a hand tractor and a decent motorbike. Now he is requesting a loan of $1,500 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice fruitfully so as to sell if for a good price in order to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Orn is 36 years old and married with three children. She earns a living through farming rice to feed and support her family members. Having been in this business for eight years, she is able to earn about KHR 5,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 2,500 each day for future needs. 

Orn is the fourth cycled client with VisionFund and she completely paid back the past three loans. She smartly used the loans to gradually improve her standard of living. Now requesting a loan of KHR 1,200,000, she wants to use it to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor. She hopes to grow more rice so as to earn more income to further improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Yien's Group

texts.en:
A woman head of a family of two sons, Yien is 28 years old and originally from Sangke District of Battambang Province.  She has managed her five hectares of farmland, on which she grows rice. To better feed the family, her husband has used his spare time for making additional income through fishing when he is free from the rice farm.  Yien has engaged in this business for six years. 

Yien and her co-member in the same group of two have been with VisionFund at least for two cycles. This cycle is the third loan for Yien, and she has completely paid back the past loan. The past loans have helped her to meet her family's difficult burdens and to improve their livelihood. 

Now, she leads her group for a new loan. As a leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop field. She hopes that this purchase will increase her crop production, so she can earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop field.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, 30, is married and has three school-aged children. For her children's sake, she runs a small food stall, and her husband is a motor-taxi driver.

Sina's group consists of two members. Sina is the group's leader. They just joined VisionFund this cycle. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR and the other group member is seeking 500,000 KHR. 

As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy ingredients for supporting her food-selling business, including noodles, sugar, salt, etc. She hopes to get more customers and make more income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Mirtha Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mirtha de 51 años de edad  soltera tiene 5 hijos siendo el mayor de 33 años todos independientes, su negocio la venta de cosméticos, ropa, prendas, labor que ha sabido desempeñar a pesar de las dificultades que ha enfrentado como el problema de salud en los riñones que afortunadamente en la actualidad está bien, este es su octavo crédito que está solicitando para comprar variedad de ropa como pantalones, camisas de damas y caballeros así como perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, desodorantes de esa manera abastecer los pedidos de su clientela a como siempre lo ha hecho y así ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 51 years old, single, and has five children.  The oldest is 33 and they are all independent.  She works selling cosmetics and clothing.  She was able to continue this work in spite of difficulties she faced such as a health problem with her kidneys, which thankfully is now better.  

This is her eighth loan that she has requested to purchase a variety of clothing such as pants and women's and men's shirts, as well as perfumes, body lotion, and deodorants.  This will allow her to fill her customer's orders as she has always done so that she can improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing such as pants and women's and men's shirts as well as perfumes, body lotions, and deodorants.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une jeune camerounaise de 26 ans célibataire avec un enfant qui va à l'école. Elle a ouvert et gère une petite épicerie  de détail depuis deux (02) ans dans un quartier de douala. Avec le crédit qu'elle sollicite, elle voudrait acheter une bonne quantité d'épices à savoir les cubes, les condiments secs, les pistaches, les arachides, les crevettes sèchées etc... Avec une partie du bénéfice générée, elle espère augmenter son stock de marchandises pour atteindre le statut de grossiste. L'autre partie, elle envisage d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Elisabeth is a 26-year old woman from Cameroon. She is single and the mother of one child, who is in school. She has opened a small grocery  in a district of Douala and has been managing it for two years. She would like to use the loan she requested to stock up various groceries, such as bouillon cubes, dry condiments, pistachios, peanuts, dried shrimp etc. She hopes to use part of her revenues to expand her merchandise stock and eventually become a wholesaler. She plans to use the rest of her revenues to improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to stock up [on groceries].

loans.name: Kimyan

texts.en:
A 31-year-old mother of three, Kimyan resides in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Bovel district in Cambodia. To support her family, she has been selling retail gasoline in her village for several years, while her husband is a tire patcher. Together, they can earn about KHR55,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR40,000 each day for future needs.  

This is the first loan for Kimyan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With the lack of working capital to better support her family’s business, she is applying for a loan of KHR2,000,000 and she will use this loan to buy an air pump for the business. She hopes to expand her family’s business and gain more income to build on some savings to increase her family’s business.

loans.use: to buy an air pump for her family’s business.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: Hul is a 43-year-old woman who has been living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. With businesses of selling Khmer natural medicines and farming, Hul is able to provide food for her family and cover other expenses. She has been in the two businesses for almost 30 years. Hul’s family is comprised of seven family members. She is responsible for five grown-up children, four of whom are still students and depend on her income. The main challenge in her natural medicine sales business is that Hul doesn’t have an appropriate vehicle for distributing her medicines to far-distance areas. Consequently, she is submitting a new loan request because she has insufficient capital to purchase a motorcycle to aid in transporting her natural medicines to new segments of the market. She hopes for a great change in her business and to earn better income in years to come.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to aid in transporting her natural medicines to new segments of the market.

loans.name: Ana Claribel

texts.es: Ana de 37 años de edad, es una mujer muy laboriosa y responsable, ella se dedica a la venta de cocos por mayor y por unidad, su puesto esta ubicado en el parque central del lugar en que reside y su venta es bastante estable, incrementándose sobretodo los fines de semana que las personas van de comprar al mercado, ya que ella se encuentra al paso. Ana vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos que son estudiantes muy dedicados que le ayudan los fines de semana a Ana con la venta. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de cocos y con estos mejorar su margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana, age 37, is an industrious and a responsible woman. She sells coconuts in bulk and by the unit. Her stand is located in the central park of the town where she lives. Ana’s business volume is stable, but it increases on the weekends since there are more people who are on their way to the market. She sets up her shop at the entrance.

Ana lives with her husband and her three children who are dedicated students. On the weekends, they help her with making sales. Ana is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of coconuts, which will help to improve her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Bahía  (Azogues) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de la Bahía está formado por 8 mujeres que trabajan diariamente en el comercio ya se de venta de ropa, calzado o mas artículos, son amigas y compañeras de trabajo que se han unido para formar este hermoso grupo, son personas amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma, que aun mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es muy especial ya que toda su ciudad se encuentra inclinada por su situación geográfica, en lo más alto se encuentra su catedral y desde allí se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, esta ciudad tiene grandes artistas que con sus manos guardaron la historia de esta ciudad, su gastronomía es variada y cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Deysy, tiene 34 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 16 y 13 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Deysy se dedica al comercio de abono orgánico, vende su producto  por todo el país y labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, esta actividad la desempeña hace un año y por el momento le va muy bien.
 
Como es una mujer emprendedora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y espera llegar a tener un almacén. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia en la ciudad de Azogues.

Por esta ocasión en la foto les acompaña  una amiga de las socias que esta con una chompa azul a rayas y bufanda.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres de Bahía" communal bank is made up of eight women who work daily in sales; whether it be selling clothing, footwear or other items. They are friends and workmates who who have come together to form this marvelous group. They are friendly, kind people with great charm, who still keep alive the culture and traditions of their people. 

They live in the city of Azogues. This city is very special, as because of its geographic situation, the entire city is located on a slope. On the highest point is the cathedral, and from there one can see a great part of the city. The city has great artists who with their hands maintain its history. Its cuisine is varied, and captivates the palate of those who visit. 

One of the members of this group is Deysy. She is 34 years old, divorced and has two children ages 16 and 13, who go to school in the city. They do not have their own house so she rents. 

Deysy sells organic fertilizer. She sells her product all over the country and works from Sunday to Sunday with no fixed hours. She has been doing this work for a year, and at the moment it's going very well.  

As she is an enterprising woman, she is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of clothing, and hopes to eventually have a store. Her goal is to have her own house in the city of Azogues.  

On this occasion, a friend of the members is accompanying them in the photo, and is wearing a blue-striped sweater and a scarf.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимжон успешный предприниматель. Он проживает в посёлке. Олимжон женат, ему 38 лет. У него трое сыновей, старший сын учиться в школе, а младшие ходят в детский сад.  Его жена  занимаются домашним хозяйством. Олимжон с 2005 года занимается купля-продажей строительных красок на  местном  центральном рынке. Он начал свою предпринимательскую деятельность с мелкого оборота, но на данный момент его товарооборот значительно увеличился. На полученный кредит    Олимжон  планирует  закупить краски и увеличить свои доходы, тем самым улучшить свои условия проживания. Олимжон заранее выражает свою благодарность  Арванду  за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Olimjon is a successful entrepreneur.  He lives in a village.  Olimjon is 38 years old, married and has three sons.  His oldest son attends a school, and the youngest sons go to kindergarten.  His wife is involved in household work.  Olimjon has been involved in buying and selling construction paint at the local central market since 2005.  He started his entrepreneurship with a small turnover, but currently, his goods turnover has significantly increased.  Olimjon plans to use this loan to buy paint and increase his income and thus, improve his living conditions.  Olimjon expresses his gratitude to Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy paint and increase his income

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que desde la edad de 14 años comenzó a trabajar en la elaboración de hamacas de seda y de cascarilla; sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron, ya que junto a ellos también se dedico a trabajar en la agricultura. Cuando se caso, ella continuo trabajando en la elaboración de hamacas y en la agricultura, tiempo de después que nacieron sus cinco hijos, su esposo emigro a los Estados Unidos.

Para comprar los insumos que necesita para la elaboración de las hamacas y para realizar los trabajos agrícolas, los adquiere en la comunidad más cercana que esta a quince minutos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación  Campo, es para comprar tres sacos de abono, foliares para su cultivo de maíz, pago a los empleados que le ayudan y para comprar una caja de hilo para elaborar hamacas. Con la inversión, podrá fertilizar su cultivo que tanto lo necesita, además dispondrá de materia prima para elaborar hamacas y venderlas en la ciudad, para obtener ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Su objetivo, es ahorrar para comprar 3,500 metros cuadrados de terreno y elaborar una casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel, 34, is married and has five children.  She’s a very tenacious woman who started working at the age of 14 making silk and husk hammocks; her parents taught her because she also worked in agriculture alongside them.  When she got married she continued working making hammocks and in agriculture.  A short time after her five children were born her husband emigrated to the United States.  She buys the supplies she needs to make the hammocks and to do the agricultural work in the nearest community which is fifteen minutes away.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three sacks of manure, leaf fertilizer for her corn crop and to pay the day laborers that help her; she will also buy a box of thread to make hammocks. With this investment she will fertilize her crop which so needs it and will also have raw materials on hand to make hammocks to sell in the city to earn enough income to meet family needs.  Her goal is to save up enough to buy 3,500 square meters of land to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of manure, leaf fertilizer, to pay labor costs and to buy a box of thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Chhim has had a rice farming business for more than ten years. She learned to improve her business gradually through her experiences and farming practices. She works tirelessly at the rice field because she wants to provide a healthy diet for the family and send her children to be educated when they get ready for school. In the same manner, her husband also works hard in fishing activities to have a bright future for their children. 

Chhim and her husband always make sure that their businesses are secured in order achieve financial stability for the whole family. In this regard, Chhim is requesting her first loan through HKL to purchase a new boat, nets and other fishing equipment. This will allow her husband to make his current business more viable and profitable. They realize that the amount of the loan will offer them great changes in improving their businesses as well as their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat, nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Botir

texts.ru: Ботир мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Ботир начал свою предпринимательскую деятельность с 2000 года и в течение 12 лет беспрерывно осуществляет свою деятельность достигая значительного результата.Он занимается продажей продуктов питания.  В течении двух лет он сотрудничает с нашей организацией.   Ботир человек добросовестный, ответственный, пунктуальный и не разу не нарушал политику кредитования.  Ботир в основном покупает товары с города и продает на местном рынке в своем селе .  Жена ему в этом помогает.  Они  день и ночь работают и стараются получит больше прибыли  для обеспечение семьи.
texts.en: Botir is a 35 year-old man.  He is married and has two children.  Botir started his entrepreneurship in 2000 and has been running his business for 12 years, achieving a significant result.  He is involved in selling food products.  He has been partnering with our organization for two years.  Botir is a conscientious, responsible and punctual person, who never violated the financing terms.  Botir primarily buys products from the city and sells them at a local market in his village.  His wife helps him with this.  They work day and night and try to make more profit to provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout is 66 years old and a single parent who is responsible for five grown-up children. She earns a living by operating a retail business in her community. She sells batches of firewood and typically generates income of KHR6,000 each day to support her living situation. She also manages a few plots of rice farm for additional income. 

Hout has been in her firewood retail business for more than ten years. Her son helps her earn income for the family by transporting firewood to sell at marketplaces every day. But recently, their trailer broke and they need spare parts to replace the broken ones. 

To improve in the operation of the firewood selling business, Hout is taking out a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL, to purchase two wheels and other accessories for the maintenance of her trailer. Hout hopes that, after she has her trailer fixed, she will be able to sustain her family-owned business and make a consistent income to feed the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase two wheels and other accessories for the maintenance of her trailer.

loans.name: La Estancia  < Paute> Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Estancia está formado por 7 mujeres quienes son amigas y vecinas, viven por los alrededores del Cantón Paute, lugar que es privilegiado por su clima templado, sus tierras son fértiles en donde se cosecha una gran variedad de frutas y también se cultivan las más hermosas flores. Su gente se dedica al comercio,  a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, son personas amables que siempre brindan una sonrisa a sus visitantes, su gastronomía es variada, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carmita, es socia del banco comunal la Estancia hace un año y medio, vive por la comunidad de Rumihurco en el cantón de Paute. Ella es madre soltera de un niño de 5 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Vive en la casa de su madre y comparten todos los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Carmita pasa en casa dedicándose a los quehaceres del hogar pero para poder tener independencia económica se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y pollos, a los que los vende en pie o pelados, estos animalitos los vende en su comunidad.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y así incrementar la crianza de estos animalitos. 

Su meta es darle a su hijo una buena educación.
texts.en:
The La Estancia community bank is made up of seven women who are friends and neighbors.  They live in the outskirts of the Paute canton, where there is a mild climate, there is fertile land where they plant a large variety of fruits and the most beautiful flowers.  The people work in commerce, agriculture, and raising animals.  They are kind people who always have a smile for visitors.  The cuisine is varied and they maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of the group is Carmita.  She has been a member for a year and a half.  She lives in the community of Rumihurco in the canton of Paute.  She is a single mother of a five year old who is studying in a small school in their town.  She lives in her mother's house and they share all of the household expenses.

Carmita stays at home doing housework but in order to have financial independence, she works raising guinea pigs and chickens which she sells in her community either live or plucked.  

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of guinea pigs so that she can increase her breeding of those animals.

Her goal is to give her son a good education.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 23 años de edad, esta acompañada. Ella junto a su familia poseen un negocio dentro un Instituto; claudia junto a su mamá se dedican a la elaboración de productos comestibles, como: panes, pupusas, yuca frita, churros, etc. Todo para satisfacer las necesidades de los estudiantes. Desde que ella estaba estudiando en la escuela recuerda que su mamá ha trabajado en ese cafetín y ahora claudia la apoya en ese trabajo, fortaleciendo la atención hacia los estudiantes y elaborando ricos bocadillos. 

Tiene que viajar a la ciudad para adquirir los insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos y los insumos para la alimentación de sus animales. Para ello, paga un vehiculo para que se los trasladen a su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación  Campo, es para comprar más productos para el cafetín y para comprar alimento para su ganado y cerdos. De esta manera, podrá apalancar en el negocio familiar para siempre estar trabajando y estar tranquila de que dispone del alimento del ganado y de los cerdos para engordarlos y tenerlos listos para venderlos por el mes de febrero. Como toda una mujer emprendedora y visionaria, desea fortalecer su negocio y trabajar de la mano de los hijos que pueda procrear junto a su pareja.
texts.en:
Claudia, 23, lives with someone.  She and her family have a business inside an institution.  Claudia and her mother work preparing food like bread, pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes], fried manioc, churros, etc. to satisfy the students’ needs.  She remembers her mother working in the snack bar ever since she was attending school and now Claudia helps her with the work strengthening student service and making delicious snacks.  She has to go to the city to buy the supplies she needs to make the food and also has to buy animal feed.  To do so she hires a car.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy more supplies for the snack bar and to buy feed for her cattle and pigs.  In this way she’ll be able to leverage the family business so that she’ll always have work and have peace of mind that she’ll have feed for her cattle and pigs available to fatten them up and have them ready for sale in February.  Like all enterprising, visionary women she wants to strengthen her business and to work hand in hand with children she might have with her partner.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her snack bar and to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Se and her spouse are raising their two children in a rural area of Kampong Chhnang province. She just turned 30 years old and she is involved in a farming business to add more income to her husband’s while he works in a construction industry, going across the provinces to be employed for a decent wage. Plus, he climbs palm trees for juice, which will be cooked for red palm sugar when he is available from his construction work, especially during his unemployed period.

With the requested loan amount, Se will be able to purchase stock of firewood that she will use for producing palm sugar as a way of gaining income. Also, a portion of the loan will be utilized to purchase dried palm leaves for tiling a wall of her house. She is convinced that this financial assistance will have positive impact to improve the business and better her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood that she will use for producing palm sugar and to purchase dried palm leaves for tiling a wall of her house.

loans.name: Holidahon

texts.ru: Холидахон родилась в 1971 году в семье разнорабочего.  У нее четверо детей.  Холидахон  занимается продажей детской одежды.   В этой деятельности она с 2000 года.   Раньше она брала товар в рассрочку, сейчас же она закупает товар на собственные деньги, и имеет свою торговую точку.   Холидахон мечтает купить или построить свой собственный магазин,  поэтому она копит денежные средства.   Она благодарна, за то, что может взять в кредит и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Holidahon was born in 1971 into a family of a handyman.  She has four children.  Holidahon is involved in selling children's clothing.  She has been in this business since 2000.  Previously, she got merchandise under an installment plan, but now buys it with her own money and has a retail outlet.  Holidahon dreams of buying or building her own store and this is why she is saving money.  She is grateful that she can borrow money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Khea

texts.en:
Khea started a hog-raising business six years ago. She is 46 years old and married with six children. She also cultivates her family land by planting rice, both for food and for sale, while her husband fishes every day along the Tonle Sap River. They are very passionate about supporting their family through their agricultural businesses. Together, they are able to generate an average income of $5 per day.

As of now, Khea plans to buy ten sacks of fertilizer to provide good nutrition to her rice crop. Also, she will use a portion of the loan to pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice. She’s sure that this loan amount and her patience would make her farming business more viable and profitable in the near future. She hopes Kiva lenders will continuously grant this loan as during the previous time. She has been with HKL seven times and she has made good payment back to HKL as well as Kiva.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of fertilizer for her rice crop and to pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men is 57 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is married. Men is a farmer who owns and manages a farming business as the major source of her income. She is very hard working in at the rice fields, growing rice and potatoes for sale. Through her perseverance and hard work, she hopes to make improvements in the business and be able to achieve financial stability someday.

She plans to grow potatoes this season, but she has insufficient capital for the purchase of farm supplies needed for the operation. Therefore, she is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase potato plants for growing, as well as fertilizer and pesticides, and also to pay for labor costs. This will enable her to obtain a fruitful harvest and yield a better income to satisfy her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase potato plants for growing, as well fertilizer and pesticides, and also to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao has been a construction worker for almost five years. From this job, he can make a decent wage to meet his family's living needs. He is happy because his wife helps generate income by working in a local garment factory. This couple has a small child who will be enrolled in school in the next two years. He dreams of sending his child into higher levels of education to give him a better way of life someday.

Mao would like to take out a loan form Kiva lenders to enable him to tile his roof again with new zinc. This will protect the family during the rainy season. He believes that through his hard work and perseverance, he will be able to provide his family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to tile his roof again with new zinc.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 69 años de edad, es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Ella comenzó destazando cerdos, sus tres hijos le colaboraban con el negocio. Al fallecer su esposo, ella instalo una pequeña tienda de productos básicos, esta fue creciendo y creciendo durante tres años, luego fueron surgiendo otras tiendas en la comunidad. Por lo que, se vio obligada en ofrecer más variedad de productos, como bebidas, alimentos, granos básicos, etc. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación  Campo, es para comprar unos cerdos para el negocio del destazo y para comprar productos para la tienda. Ella a buscado una persona que le ayude con el destazo, ella lo dirigirá como hacerlo. Doña María sobrevive con los ingresos de la tienda y con la ayuda de sus hijos. Ella siempre ha sido una persona emprendedora que ha sabido salir adelante junto con sus hijos. Su anhelo es que su tienda sea la mejor en la comunidad como fue antes, que el destazo sea duradero y que su familia se sienta orgullosa de ella.
texts.en:
María, 69, is a widow; she has three children.  She started butchering pigs and her three children help with the business.  When her husband died she opened a small grocery store which had been growing for three years but then other stores sprung up in the community so she now must stock more variety of goods like beverages, food, basic grains, etc.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy some pigs to butcher and to buy products for the store.  She has looked for someone to help her with the butchering; she’ll train him.

María survives with income from the store and with help from her children.  She’s always been an enterprising person who has known how to get ahead with her children.  Her hope for the store is that it be the best in the community like it once was and that the butchering will last and that her family is proud of her.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and to buy stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach, aged 51, is a hardworking mother who currently lives with her married son and a daughter-in-law in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Raising hogs is a supplementary business for Lach, which is followed by farming. From her hog-raising business, she is able to earn additional income of KHR6,000 each day. She has been in these businesses for more than ten years. Her son also sells firewood to help support the family. 

During her entrepreneurship, Lach aspires to improve her farming business so that it will return her back a satisfied profit through the years. In order to attain her dreams, Lach is asking for support in the form of a loan of $1,500. She will use the loan to purchase a plow for the maintenance of the rice fields. Moreover, the plow can be attached to a trailer at the back for transporting firewood to marketplaces. Lach knows that she will be able to make her dream come true through the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a plow for the maintenance of rice fields.

loans.name: Choun

texts.en:
Choun is 46 years old and a mother of six children, residing in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Choun, together with her husband, pursue a rice farming business to generate their livelihoods. Despite their hardship, they aim to improve their business and educate those of their children who are still attending to school. Two of their children are already married and have independent lives. 

Choun is asking for a loan of KHR1,000,000 to purchase fertilizers to spread on her crops. This purchase will allow Choun to secure proper growth of her rice crop. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to gain better yields this coming season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Choun

texts.en:
From Kompong Speu province of Cambodia, Choun as well as most of local villagers started a farming business as the main source for her income. Choun has been in this type of business since she was in her teens; she is now 32 years old and has three young children. Due to the high cost of commodities and home utility bills, she also has a hog-raising business to generate additional income. 

Choun is submitting a new request for her fourth loan to purchase more piglets for fattening and necessary feed to ensure proper growth of her pigs. She hopes to sell her pigs at a profitable price upon their maturity in the next few months. She will reinvest the earnings from her hog-raising business back into her business and save a portion for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets for fattening and necessary feed to ensure proper growth of her pigs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: El señora Margarita tiene 36 años de edad casado con el Sr. Sabino hace 18 años tienen 5 hijos menores dependientes viven en la comunidad de Alto Colomi Liquintaya a 54 km de la ciudad de Cbba. Doña Margarita y su familia se dedican a la actividad agrícola de donde tiene ingresos económicos vende papa, haba, oca en la feria semanal de Colomi al contado, también cría ganado vacuno, Doña Margarita es una persona humilde trabajadora y responsable. Doña Margarita para comprar insumos  agrícolas abono orgánico, semilla de papa, productos agroquímicos, el ahorro que tenía gasto en la compra de terreno agrícola en la comunidad de Santa Isabel, ahora teniendo insumos agrícolas sembrara en esta campaña agrícola garantizando la seguridad alimentaria de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is 36 years old.  She has been married to Sabino for 18 years and they have five minor children.  They live in the community of Alto Colomi Liquintaya, which is located 54 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  Margarita and her family are farmers and earn income from selling potatoes, beans, and oca at the weekly market in Colomi.  She also raises cattle.  

Margarita is a humble, hardworking, and responsible person.  She will use this loan to purchase farming supplies, organic fertilizer, potato seeds, and agrochemical products.  She spent her savings on the purchase of farm land in the community of Santa Isabel.  Now she will use these supplies to plant during this season to ensure her family's food security.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies, fertilizer, potato seeds, and agrochemical products.

loans.name: Miriam De La Paz

texts.es: Es una clienta esforzada, lleva con afodenic 4 créditos cancelados, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en la ciudad capital de Managua aproximadamente 6 años, este nuevo crédito es para compra de materiales de construcción para embaldosar los muros y levantar el nivel del piso de su casa ya que es muy bajo y al llover el agua que pasa de la calle se introduce con facilidad a su vivienda, incomodando a sus hijos quienes todavía son unos adolecentes y requieren de mucho cuidado para su salud. Con este crédito solicitado comprara materiales de cemento, hierro, arena, bloques y el pago de la mano de obra.
texts.en: She’s a dedicated client who has repaid four Afodenic loans.  She has sold cosmetics in the capital city of Managua for about six years.  This new loan is to buy building materials and supplies to tile the walls and raise the level of the floor at home because it’s too low and when it rains water from the street easily gets into the house making her children who are still adolescents uncomfortable; they need much care to stay healthy.  She will use this requested loan to buy cement, rebar, sand, concrete blocks and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Fanaka Group

texts.en:
Winifrida,who is in her late 20s, is married and lives with her husband. She has been a tailor since 2008. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly income.

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, which she paid back successfully,  to purchase more clothing material, a home mattress, television, radio and tailoring machines. She requests a new loan to buy more material to make more clothes to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to increase the tailoring machines and employ more people.

She will share this loan with her loan group, " Fanaka" which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make more clothes.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en: Originally from ThmorKol district of Cambodia, Samnang is a married mother with three children. To feed her household, she sells grocery items in a small stall while her husband works for others for a wage. Having been in this business for five years, she is able to earn about 22,000 KHR per day. Four cycles ago was her original loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. For that loan, she was in a group of two members. With the past loan fully repaid, she can earn a decent income and uplift her lifestyle. Now, she and her co-member are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, her loan portion will be used to buy more grocery items for resale, including sugar, salt, canned food and instant noodles. She hopes this loan will help her to replenish her grocery items on time for customers' needs, so as she can make more income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim is 44 years old and married with four children, three of whom are married and one who is single. Tim is a conscientious mother who runs a farming business in the small village of Kompong Speu province. She has had this occupation for almost 30 years. Earnings from her current business are just enough to meet her daily living needs, especially food that is very quickly consumed. Rice farming is the sole source of her income, which is why Tim aims to improve it gradually so that she can increase income for the whole family. In this way, Tim plans to purchase an extra plot of farmland to expand her production.

Due to a shortage of capital, Tim is taking out a loan of $800 to buy a piece of farmland. She is hoping that this loan will make it possible for her to improve her farming business. She would appreciate it if she could have the loan for her second time.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice seed and chemical fertilizer, and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Dom

texts.en: Dom is a widower and a father of four single children. He is raising his children in the small village of Kompong Speu province. Dom is the operator of a transportation business in his community, besides having a rice farming business. He has been doing this for almost 20 years, earning an average income of 8,000 KHR per day. He wants earn more income to secure his family financially, but his old motorcycle breaks frequently, which affects his operation and decreases his income. For this reason, Dom sold his motorcycle and decided to seek a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a new one. This will enable him to keep improving his business for the overall well-being of his family. In the future, he hopes that he can have extra plots of farmland and send some of his children to be educated at a good college.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for a transportation business.

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Suos is 54 years old, married and the mother of five grown-up children. She has tried very hard to feed the family since she became a widow due to family conflicts and unavoidable circumstances. Suos pursues her farming business to generate the major source of income for her family. Though she earns a small income from this business, she is proud to have the support her children, who always help with most of the maintenance at the rice field. Currently, three of her children are married.

At the moment, Suos is in need of necessary farming supplies to spread on her rice crops in order to ensure proper growth. Due to insufficient funds, she is borrowing a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase fertilizer for good nutrition of her crop. She is hoping that someday, she will be a successful entrepreneur in her community and she can afford to send her two younger children to a good university. She is very thankful to all kind lenders for the support of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Flor Lastenia

texts.es: Flor de 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad, quienes dependen por completo de ella, ya que ellas es madre soltera y debe sacar adelante a su familia con sus esfuerzos. Flor realiza un trabajo bastante duro el cual es la siembra de frijoles y maíz en una parcela que alquila para realizar esta actividad, luego de sembrar las semillas ella se dedica a cuidar las matas para posteriormente obtener los granos básicos para comercializar. Flor solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar semillas de maíz y frijoles para sembrar y así aumentar su producción de granos básicos y teniendo fe en que sus ventas crecerán.
texts.en:
Flor is 39 years old and lives with her three young children who are completely dependent on her. Since she is a single mother, Flor gives her best effort to move her family forward. She works hard planting beans and corn on a parcel of land that she rents for her business. After the seeds are sown, Flor cares for the plants that will eventually bear basic grains that she can sell.

Flor is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy corn and bean seeds to plant. This will increase her production of basic grains. Flor has faith that her sales will increase.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn is involved in rice farming as well as hog-raising for her livelihood. She is 39 years old and responsible for three teen-aged children who are attending school. Her priority is to educate all of her children up to college and provide them basic living needs. She is very industrious and always keeps herself busy with her current businesses because she wants to achieve goals and secure her family. Her effort has been a great help to her family and her husband, who devotes himself to a fishing business.

Due to the lack of vehicle to transport fish to the marketplace, Vorn is now requesting a loan through HKL to purchase a motorcycle. She hopes for great changes in their present businesses through the help of the loan. She wishes to be a successful entrepreneur in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to transport fish to the marketplace.

loans.name: Pellumb

texts.en:
Pellumb and his family live in the south of Albania, a district known for its delicious apple fruits. He is married and has one son, 33, who is a soccer player and coach for children ages 15-16 years old. 

For the past eight years, Pellumb has been planting and taking care of apple orchards. He owns a few “dynyms” of such land. Throughout the years, the growth in clientele has been at a steady pace and the results make Pellumb happy. The increase in earnings that he’s been experiencing in these recent years has made him happier :). His clients are store owners, and his products are sold within the country and also in neighboring countries.

To maintain production quantity and quality, Pellumb is seeking a Kiva loan to buy pesticides. He is hopeful that lenders will support him.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for his apple orchards

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is an industrious farmer, raising her family that is comprised of four members in a small village of Kompong Speu province. She grows rice during the rainy season lasting from May to October, while her husband devotes himself to a construction business to provide for his family. In the dry season, Phan usually finds other supplementary businesses for additional income, such as raising piglets or poultry. 

Phan aims to sustain her business to earn better yields so that she will be able to satisfy her living needs and save money for sending her two children to a good college after they finish high school. In the same manner, Phan’s husband strives to work hard and seeks ways to achieve their dreams. He plans to operate a motorcycle transportation business, but they have insufficient funds to buy a motorcycle. That is why Phan is requesting a loan in the sum of $600 to purchase a motorcycle, which will be used by her husband for the new transportation business. With the loan, Phan mentioned that she will be able to improve her family's status of living and she hopes to lift her family out of poverty someday as she and her husband strive to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle, which will be used by her husband for a transportation business.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Chy is 28 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang province. She has a common law relationship with her spouse and has been blessed with two school-aged children. She manages her own farmland by planting rice both for daily food and for sale. For additional income, she is employed in the local garment industry, when she has her farm work done in each season. Chy has been a seamstress for more than six years. Despite her hardships, Chy hopes to meet the needs of her family and educate her two children.

Chy wants to operate a retail business, selling fruit in her neighborhood. With this new business, she is hoping for more income and more time to be with her family, rather than working in the factory for 8-10 hours each day. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to invest in purchasing stock of fruit for selling. She believes that the loan will make it possible for her to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing stock of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang is 25 years old and the mother of two young children, currently residing in Kompong Speu province. Raising and educating her two children to be good citizens are her responsibilities and obligations; she has to have them done in life. Kang and her husband help each other to manage their family-owned businesses to achieve their dreams. Kang cultivates her farmland by planting rice, with constant support from her spouse each season, while his primary business is to sell charcoal from his trailer. 

They have aimed to increase their yields and income so that they can afford to send their children to school soon in the upcoming year. In connection with this, Kang would like to make improvements in her rice farming business to ensure a high production. Therefore, she is taking out a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR for farming purposes. With the loan, she will be able to pay for labor costs, and to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for growing her rice crop. She is hoping to have a fruitful harvest and thereby make a higher income.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, and purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for growing her rice crop.

loans.name: Nancy Viviana

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy forma parte del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, ciudad que tiene una arquitectura colonial y  moderna, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora Nancy tiene 23 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Ella labora diariamente en la venta de mariscos en un mercado de la ciudad, actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años y gracias a su carisma ha logrado tener una clientela selecta, este trabajo le da el espacio para poder cuidar de sus hijos quienes aun son pequeños.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de una gran variedad de mariscos para su negocio y la cancelación de dicho crédito lo ha realizado en las fechas correspondientes sin dificultad. Su nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir comprando mariscos.

El banco comunal le gusta porque es una manera rápida de poder tener capital para su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the "12 de Abril" communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca, a city that's been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since December, 1999.  It's a city with colonial and modern architecture.  It's residents are kind, pleasant and still preserve their culture and traditions.

Nancy's 23-years-old and the single mother of two children who are 5 and 3 years old.  Her oldest daughter goes to the local elementary school.  Nancy's house is hers.  She works daily selling seafood in a city market, an activity she's been in for three years and that thanks to her charisma has led to having a select clientele.  This work gives her time to care for her children who are still little.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy a large selection of seafood for her business and repaid said loan on time and with no difficulties.  She will also use her new loan to buy seafood.  She likes her communal bank because it's a quick way to get business capital.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria trabajó durante más de 14 años en una repostería donde alcanzó a adquirir una gran experiencia en la actividad, pero debido a que el salario que allí estaba recibiendo no era suficiente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, pues es madre soltera cabeza de hogar de su hijo de 18 años, ha decidido montar su propio negocio. Es así como ahora busca un préstamo para comprar un horno, moldes, nevera, batidora, y otras herramientas más los insumos necesarios para montar su propia repostería.

De esta manera aspira a mejorar los ingresos que genera para su hogar y así la calidad de vida de su hijo pueda mejorar considerablemente.
texts.en:
Luz Maria worked in a cake shop for over 14 years where she gained extensive experience. However her salary was not sufficient to sustain her living expenses as she is a single mother and the main caretaker of her 18 year old son. Therefore she has decided to start her own business.
