Chi has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle, with which she succeeded in meeting her family’s needs. Now she is leading a group member who has just been with VisionFund for the first time to apply for a loan. Chi will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer in order to support her business. With the help of her loan portion, she believes that her business will provide her with a higher and better quality crop yields so that she can sell them for greater income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her famland.

loans.name: Margielyn

texts.en: To support the daily necessities of family, Margielyn’s husband is operating a tricycle while she has a piggery business. She believes that patience and hard work are needed in operating a business, but financial support is most important. Now, Margielyn is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional new tires and oil for their tricycle and feed for her pigs. She came up with the business because she wanted to help her husband generate extra income to support their children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase additional new tires and oil, as well as feed for her pigs

loans.name: Savet's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of one son residing in RatanakMondul of Cambodia, Savet is 22 years old and a farmer. Her main source of income is farming a one-hectare plot of land. She has been in this business for two years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day. For her, lacking of working capital is a key difficulty for her family. 

Saret's group is composed of three members. Saret is the leader and the second-cycle client, while her remaining group members are first-time borrowers. Saret was very satisfied with her past loan, which she repaid back with success, and it returned her a decent income for supporting her business. Forming a group to seek a new loan, Saret will use her portion to pay a plowing fee and to buy rice seeds for her crop field. She hopes to increase her income from her current businesss so that she can expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee and to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Raising hogs is the viable source of Editha's income. From selling the raised hogs, she was able to gain 3,000 PHP for each hog disposed. She is 51 years old, married and has five children. Her spouse is a rice farmer. 

Editha now borrows a loan of 8,000 PHP to invest in feed and medicines for sustaining her hogs. This will ensure good nutrition to them and could offer hogs at higher cost. Editha hopes to keep raising healthy hogs and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hog sustainability

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a businesswoman who manages a small store next to her house. She is 52 years old, has one child and is married to a carpenter. Erlinda sells grocery items and gains 200 PHP a day in her business. She utilizes income to pay school fees and meals at home too. She would like to increase her sales. That is why she is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, eggs, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell in her store. Though she only generates minimal income from the store, she hopes to improve it for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Wilfina

texts.en: Wilfina, age 48, would like to ask for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP which she can use to maintain her buy and sell business. She will use the loan to purchase string beans, squash, carrots and cabbage. She really cares about her business because this is her only way of helping her husband in money matters. She is hoping that her business will prosper for them to have a better life. She is also planning to jump into a sari-sari store business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase string beans, squash, carrots and cabbage

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte hace 2 años del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, ciudad que tiene una arquitectura colonial y lo moderna, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 61 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Doña María trabaja en un mercado de la ciudad, tiene un local de frutas y verduras en el cual trabaja todos los días sin descanso, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseño el arte de las ventas, ahora este negocio le ha ayudado para sacar  adelante a todo su familia y mejorar su estabilidad económica.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de frutas y verduras, la cancelación de dicho crédito lo realizo en las fechas indicadas. Este  nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas de temporada.
 
La banca comunal el gusta por el compañerismo de todo el grupo.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the “12 de Abril” communal bank for two years.  She lives in Cuenca, a city that’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since December, 1999.  It has colonial and modern architecture and its residents are kind, pleasant and still preserve their culture and traditions.

María is 61-years-old and a single mother of two children who are married, independent adults now.  The house she lives in is hers.  

María works in a city market; she has a fruit and vegetable stand she works in every day with no rest.  She learned this activity from her mother who taught her the art of sales.  This business has helped her raise her family and improve her economic stability.

She used her previous loan to buy fruit and vegetables and repaid the loan as scheduled.  She will use this new loan to buy seasonal fruit.  She likes the communal bank because of the companionship among the group members.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en: Sophat is 25 years of age and a villager residing in Battambong province’s Sangke district, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two kids (one daughter and one son), both of whom are still under her responsibility. To support her family, Sophat has been working as a rice farmer for 10 years, earning approximately 25,000 KHR per day and saving around 13,000 KHR after deducting her daily expenses. Sophat is leading a group to request a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. For both of them, this will be their second time requesting a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has helped group leader Sophat to better support her family and expand her business. With her loan, Sophat will buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her cultivated land and pay the fees for plowing her rice field and transplanting rice seedlings. Her hope for the future is to be able to boost her income even more so that she can better secure her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds and pay for plowing and planting

loans.name: Sivorn's Group

texts.en: Sivorn, age 49, is a villager in a rural area of Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. She is married and has three children, one of whom is employed as a factory worker. To earn a living, Sivorn has a business selling cakes and, to add more income to the family, her husband works as a fisherman. Sivorn is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and is now leading a group member, who also is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund, to apply for a loan of 1,800,000 KHR in total. The past loans have helped Sivorn to improve her family’s living standard and secure food for her family. Now she is in need of money to buy fishing materials (such as fish trap, cast net, etc.) for her husband’s business. She dreams of being able to build a comfortable house in which her family can live.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Biloliddin

texts.ru: Билолиддин родился в 1980 году в сельской местности в семье колхозника. Он женат и имеет  4 детей.  На фотографии он в красной рубашке. Билолиддин  занимается приготовлением  шашлыка(barbecue). Он начал заниматься этои деятельностью в 1997 году. Продает он шашалык на рынке. В начале он был помощником, а в 2000 году вместе с братом открыл свой собственный бизнес. Чтобы сэкономить на покупке мяса,  он покупает крупный рогатый скот и его дети выращивают животных дома. Дети Билолиддина помогают в  его работе. На полученный кредит он хочет купить крупный рогатый скот.  Он благодарен за то что у него есть возможность взять в кредит и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Biloliddin was born in 1980 in the countryside, in the family of a farmer. He is married and has four children. In the picture, he is in the red shirt. Biloliddin is involved in preparing "shashlik" (barbecue). He started this business in 1997. He sells barbecue at the market. In the beginning, he was an assistant. In 2000, along with his brother, he opened his own business. To save on buying meat, he buys cattle and his children grow the animals at home. His children help Biloliddin in his work. With the loan he wants to buy cattle. He is grateful that he has the ability to borrow and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Chreab's Group

texts.en: Chreab is a 30-year-old married woman residing in a rural area of Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has two daughters and five sons, all of whom are dependent on her. Some of her kids are school-aged and some are too young to attend school. To make a living, she works as a rice farmer on a two-hectare farm. Each day she earns approximately 16,000 KHR and manages to save around 6,000 KHR. Chreab has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already and she has successfully paid back the loan. The past loan enabled her to cover the expenses of her family. Now she is leading her group member to take out a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Chreab will use her loan to buy fertilizers and cover the cost of plowing her rice field. In the future, she would like to see an improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the cost of plowing her rice field

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 43 years old, married and has five children. She sells personal and home products to the people in her village and gains about 3,000 PHP each month from this business. She has been managing it for 4 years now. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy soap, fabric conditioner and air freshener to sell. This will help increase her sales. She aims to keep improving it so she will able to pay school fees on time.

loans.use: to buy soap, fabric conditioner and air freshener to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a retail store owner. She usually gains P300 each day selling grocery items. Josephine aims to improve her sales, but has not had sufficient funds. This encouraged her to apply for a loan of P7,000 to buy noodles, canned goods, vinegar and sugar to sell in her store, which will help increase her sales capacity. She promises to faithfully pay back her loan in full.

Josephine is widowed and has one child. She hopes to keep making a good profit in order to save funds for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, vinegar, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Tol's Group

texts.en:
Tol, 44, is originally from Kror Lanh district of Cambodia. In her household, there are seven family members, including her five children who currently are helping the family's business. Rice farming is the only main source of the family's income, which she does in order to provide the daily needs of her family, while sometimes her husband works for others for additional income. Tol has ten years of experience in rice farming and now it earns her about 19,00 KHR per day.

In a group of two, Tol is the leader. She and her fellow group member have been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for five cycles and have paid back the loan with success. The past loan has provided her a postive outcome in upgrading her living conditions, especilly with decent food for the entire family. Now, she is a sixth-time borrower. Tol and her co-member are applying for the same amount, 1,200,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Tol will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her crop and buy pigs for raising as extra income. She hopes to gain more output so that she can make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pigs.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 35-year-old, hardworking woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, 2 sons and 2 daughters. All of her children are studying. Her husband is a taxi driver. She herself has run her own poultry farm at home since 2005. 

On the upper floor of her house, Farzana has made a small poultry farm based on two rooms in which she keeps poultry like hens and birds. The area is much too congested so she wants to construct one more room. And for that purpose, as a member of a 9-person lending group, Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help her to grow her business, but will also increase their net income as well as savings. With the profit amount, she will meet household expenses and will open a new egg shop in the market. Farzana is dreaming for her daughter that she will get married soon. Many thanks and kind regards from her to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture, Farzana holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To construct a new room for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria, a responsible mother and wife, manages her small store at Enrile. She patiently sells grocery items at retail and extends good services to her customers. She is now 54 years old, married and has two grown-up children. 

Gregoria would like to increase her merchandise so her income will increase, too. She doesn't want to rely on her children's remittances. Gregoria had an inadequate fund and would like to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to invest in buying more merchandise to sell. With her loan, she will buy noodles, eggs, breads, canned goods, and soft drinks to sell. This will help increase sales capacity. 

Aside from gaining profits from her business, she also ensures to give friendly services and good products necessary in developing her small business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, breads, canned goods, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Wuilman Antonio

texts.es: Don Wilman de 46 años de edad, su esposa tiene un negocio de una pequeña pulpería, sus 3 hijos todavía estudian, es dueño de un taxi los créditos solicitados han sido para mejoras de su vivienda al igual que en esta ocasión será para hacer un anexo de cuarto por lo que solicita su quinto préstamo ya que necesita comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, láminas de zinc y perlines para levantar la obra, así irá mejorando su vivienda poco a poco para que sus hijos vivan cómodos.
texts.en: Wilman, 46, owns a taxi and his wife has a small grocery store.  His three children are still attending school.  The loans he’s requested have been for home improvements and this one will be too.  He wants to add a room and is requesting his 5th loan to do so because he needs to buy building materials and supplies like cement, sand, rebar, concrete blocks, metal sheeting and roof purlins to do the job and gradually continue to improve his house so his children can live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, concrete blocks, metal sheeting and purlins.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a determined mother. She manages a small bakery in her house. Together with her spouse, they cook and sell breads for income. Through their income, they were able to send their children to school, and they are now happily employed and earn for their own families. 

Cristina would like to keep managing the business to sustain their daily needs. In a week, she earns about PHP 2,000. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy flour, margarine, and sacks of sugar to use in cooking breads to sell. This loan will help maintain the smooth flow of her operation and will improve her sales, too. 

With good income from the business, she will be able to save for future expenses of the family. She also promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy flour, margarine, and sacks of sugar to use in making breads to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatros socias microempresarias que se dedican a sus actividades, una de ellas es la socia Gilma Elieth que se dedica a vender refrescos naturales desde hace varios años, mujer casada con dos hijos de su actividad aporta al sustento diario de su familia, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, frutas, bolsas plásticas frutas, hielo etc. Gema Eloísa tiene 20 años se dedica a la venta de calzados, Karla Patricia vende refrescos ambulante, Martha tiene un taller de bolsos en sus domicilio que los comercializa en el mercado de su localidad.
texts.en:
This is a group of four micro businesswomen each with her own activity.  One of them is Gilma Elieth who has been selling natural soft-drinks for several years.  She’s married and has two children.  She contributes to her family’s support by means of her activity.  She will use the loan to buy sugar, fruit, plastic bags, ice, etc.

Gema Eloísa, 20, sells shoes, Karla Patricia sells soft-drinks from place to place and Martha makes tote bags at home that she sells in the local market.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit, plastic bags, ice, etc.

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Es el primer crédito que realiza el banco comunal Buena Esperanza, está formado por 5 socias y 2 socios quienes laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares, son personas amables, gentiles que día a día ven la manera de mejorar su situación económica y sacar  adelante a sus familias. Viven todos por la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene grandes llanuras las que les permite a sus habitantes dedicarse a la ganadería, cría de animales y a la agricultura, aun su población mantiene la cultura y tradiciones que sus padres les han inculcado.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Laura María, tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, 6 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayuda económicamente, su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero y la casa en la que vive es de propiedad conyugal.
 
Doña Laura María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar en donde también cría cuyes, pollos y ganado del cual vende la leche. Cultiva sus terrenos y sus cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es tener un criadero de animales más grande.
texts.en:
This is the first loan the “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) communal bank takes out.  It has five female and two male members who work every day in various economic activities that allow them to cover household expenses.  They are kind, pleasant people who day to day find ways to improve their economic situation and move their families forward.  They all live in the city of Cuenca’s Victoria del Portete Parish.  This is a place with a cold climate with great plains that make it possible for the inhabitants to work in cattle raising, animal husbandry and agriculture.  The population still preserves the culture and traditions passed down from their parents.

One of this group’s members is Laura María, 55.  She’s married and has had 8 children.  Six of them are married and live on their own, one of her sons is single and helps her out economically and her youngest son attends the local secondary school.   Her husband works as a day laborer and the house they live in is their joint property.

Laura María does her housework but also raises guinea pigs, chickens and cattle whose milk she sells.  She farms her land and uses what she grows for family consumption; if there are any leftovers she sells them.  

She will use the loan to buy chicks and animal feed.  Her goal is to have larger animal nursery.

loans.use: to buy chicks and animal feed.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok resides in a rural area of Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is a 55-year-old married mother of nine children, one (a son) of whom is dependent on her and currently in school. To make a living, Sok works as a rice famer on two hectares of farmland and her husband complements the income by working as a Tuk-Tuk taxi driver. She has been involved in her rice farming business for 32 years, earning approximately 25,000 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already. These loans help her to meet her family’s needs. She is now leading a group of three female members to apply for a loan of 2,200,000 KHR in total. With her loan of 1,000,000 KHR, Sok will spend a portion of it to buy fertilizers to apply to her farmland and the other portion of it will be used to repair her husband’s Tuk-Tuk (motorized rickshaw). In the future, she would like to see growth in her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old, hardworking housewife. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, daughter and three sons. Her elder son owns a vegetable shop. Since 2004, her husband has been driving his own taxi. But for the past few days, he is not able to generate any income as the wheels of his taxi are not working properly. Therefore as a member of 10-person lending group, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase new wheels for the taxi so that he can continue his business and meet the financial expenses of his family. With the profit amount, Nasreen wants to purchase a new taxi for her son. She dreams for a better future for her children. Many thanks and best wishes for all staff of Kiva from her.

Note: In the picture, Nasreen is carrying a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase wheels for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda wants to have a better life so she patiently operates her small store which only generates a daily income of about 200 PHP. In order to increase her business income, she is requesting a loan amount of 8,000 PHP to add the range of stock in the store. The loan will be used to purchase canned good, biscuits, spices and snack foods. She hopes her loan will eventually develop her enterprise into a progressive operation.

loans.use: to purchase canned good, biscuits, spices and snack foods

loans.name: Jeremías

texts.es:
Jeremías tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero. Él empezó desde muy temprana edad, a elaborar artesanías con hilo, lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que a la vez lo heredaron de sus padres. Toda su familia se ha dedicado a esa actividad, hasta el día de hoy jeremías elabora hamacas de seda, gracias al esfuerzo de toda su familia han logrado obtener beneficios económicos. Él también se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas, siembra maíz y fríjol. Sus padres también le han enseñado a crecer y engordar cerdos para destazarlos.

Cada 22 días viaja a la ciudad más cercana que esta a treinta minutos en autobús de su comunidad, a comprar el material para tejer las hamacas de seda y los insumos agrícolas como el concentrado, entre otros más; debido a que en su comunidad no hay este tipo de productos a la venta. La elaboración de las hamacas lo hace en compañía de su hermana, debido a que su madre se encarga de cuidar el hogar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una caja de hilo, dos cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos. Así, Jeremías dispondrá de materiales para continuar con su negocio de elaborar hamacas, y tendrá los cerdos para engordarlos y negociarlos dentro de unos cinco a seis meses. Con los ingresos que reciba él desea ayudar a su familia. Su objetivo, es convertirse en un negociante de cerdos y ganado, desea establecer su propia granja de cerdos y ayudar a sus hermanos menores para que estudien.
texts.en:
Jeremías, 23, is single.  He started at a very young age to make crafts with thread.  He learned thanks to his parents who in turn learned from their parents.  All of his family has worked in this activity and to this day Jeremías makes silk hammocks.  Thanks to the entire family’s efforts, they’ve succeeded in earning economic profits.  He also works in agriculture growing corn and beans.  His parents have also taught him how to raise and fatten up pigs to butcher.

He heads to the nearest city which is a thirty-minute bus ride away every 22 days to buy the supplies needed to weave the silk hammocks and farm supplies like animal feed, among others because these types of products are not sold in his community.  He makes the hammocks with his sister because his mother takes care of the home.

The loan he’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a box of thread, two pigs and feed for them.  In this way, Jeremías will have the materials on hand to continue with his hammock making business and will have pigs to fatten up and sell in five or six months.

With income obtained he wants to help his family.  His goal is to become a pig and cattle merchant; he wants to set up his own pig farm and help with his younger siblings’ schooling.

loans.use: to buy a box of thread, two pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en:
Ammie is a loving wife whose husband is a motorcycle driver. They have three grown children and decent jobs. She is very happy for their achievements. They were able to send their children to school because of patience, hard work, and good income from their motorcycle transport business that they have operated for over 10 years. 

Ammie would like to keep making their business profitable, and wants to borrow 33,000 PHP to buy gasoline and crude oil, and to repair their motorcycle. Part of the loan will also be used to buy vegetables to sell, supplementing her husband's income. 

Ammie and her spouse aspire to become successful entrepreneurs in the transport and vegetable-vending business, leading to financial stability.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, crude oil, and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 50 years old, married and has one child working overseas. To generate income, she cooks and sells snacks such as boiled eggs, bananas and soup. She had been patiently doing it for over four years now. She gains about PHP 200 each day. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy sugar, flour, eggs and cooking oil to use in her food selling business. 

In the future, Norma wants to diversify her business and come up with a small store for an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, eggs and cooking oil to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en: Constancia manages a buy and sell business in the village. She would like to expand her business. For this reason, Constancia requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy eggplants, squash, cabbages, okra and bitter melon. She is working diligently to develop this additional source of income in order to supply the daily needs of her family and save for the education of her five children. To further achieve better living and save for future use, Constancia and her husband will double their time and efforts in their particular businesses.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, squash, cabbages, okra and bitter melon

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Farming has been the primary source of income for Diosdado's family. He and his family live within the village of San Sebastian Ramon. Diosdado is married and has three children. His main goal is to increase his yields this next crop season. In this way he could sustain all his family's needs and save some for emergency purposes when he gets weak.

Diosdado manages his one hectare of rice field. He has managed this field of business for more than 15 years. He is thankful because his farming strategies are effective. With those farming strategies he has used, he is able to increase his yield and was able to pay back his previous loan. Now he is asking for another loan amounting to 37,000 PHP. This amount will be use for land preparation of his rice farm plot and some amount will be used to buy certified seed, fertilizer and insecticide. He knows that he could improve his rice farm through his hard work, patience and continuous financial support from lenders.

loans.use: to buy certified seed and insecticides and some amount will be used to pay for land preparation

loans.name: John Michael

texts.en: As a way of gaining income, John Michael engages in buying and selling of fruits and vegetables. He is 27 years old, married and has one infant child. Being a responsible father, he aimed to become financially stable so that he will provide his family's needs and give them a better life. He planned to improve and strengthen the business to make it a more viable and profitable source of income. To improve the business, John Michael is asking for additional capital of 30,000 PHP to buy pineapples, guyabano, bananas, papaya, pomelo, rattan fruits, cabbages, beans, carrots, soft brooms and charcoal for sale. He believes that this financial assistance will make it possible to improve the business and is hoping that someday, he will make the business grow and achieve his goals in life.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, guyabano, bananas, papaya, pomelo, rattan fruits, cabbages, beans, carrots, soft brooms and charcoal for sale

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: She is a very dedicated mother of two school-aged children who lives in the remote area of Maluno. She has been selling different products for two years in the community. In order to sustain the needs of her family, she is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy a variety of products to display in her store. She will be the happiest person when she sees her children someday walking around wearing their graduation dresses

loans.use: to buy spices, canned goods and beverages for her store

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is 50 years old and married with three children. To sustain their daily needs and sustenance, Perla manages a store in which she sells grocery items at retail. She usually gains PHP 3,000 each month. Perla is now asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to invest in expanding the business. She will buy soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, eggs and bread to sell. Though she only has a small business, Perla has a big heart in making her family live fortunately.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, eggs and bread to sell

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en: Rubilyn says that for 18 years, she has been in business offering different products in the community. Still, the income is not enough to manage the daily needs of the family. She wants to strive harder just to have enough income so that she can provide a better quality of life. That's why she is asking for a loan from Kiva amounting to 10,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice, bottles of cooking oil, candies, and boxes of snack food.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, candies, and other products to display in her store

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena, 48 years old, is married to Jimmy, a simple farmer. Lucena is engaged in charcoal making and delivers it in their town, where she sells it. In order to be able to have enough income, she is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy wood, gasoline, and other materials she will need in doing her business. She hopes that in the future, she can have her own stall in the market so that she can stock the charcoal.

loans.use: to buy wood, gasoline, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Patricia Marlene

texts.es: Patricia tiene 35 años estado civil casado, Ella tiene 3 hijos, Patricia cuenta que su situación económica ha sido un poco mala pero poco a poco con la ayuda de Dios ha podido salir adelante con su esposo. Ella ahorro dinero y ahora trabaja como comerciante vende sus propias mercaderías como carteras ollas etc. Su mayor temor es la delincuencia que se ha incrementado en el país y tiene miedo a que le roben su mercadería. El gran objetivo de Patricia es tener su propio almacén. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: colchones cubrecamas ollas etc.
texts.en: Patricia, 35, is married and has three children.  Patricia relates that her economic situation has been a bit poor but with God’s help she and her husband have been able to get ahead.  She saved money and now works as a merchant selling her own merchandise like purses, pots, etc.  Her greatest fear is the crime rate that’s been increasing in the country; she’s afraid her merchandise will be stolen.  Patricia’s great goal is to have her own store.  She wants to use the loan to buy mattresses, bedspreads, pots, etc.

loans.use: to buy mattresses, bedspreads, pots, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: María estado civil divorciada. María tiene una tienda pequeña pero bien surtida de víveres, vive en una zona periurbana en Duran zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. Inicio su negocio hace 10 años atrás con una vitrina y una percha. Debido a la demanda de los víveres el comenzó a comprar arroz y aceite, poco a poco con esfuerzo y algunos sacrificios, ahora trabaja en su propio negocio. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta el anochecer. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, enlatados, azúcar etc. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y agrandar más su tienda.
texts.en: María is divorced.  She has a small store that’s very well-stocked with foodstuffs.  She lives in a periurban zone in Duran, a zone noted for unpaved streets and mountains.  She started her business ten years ago with just a display case and a shelf.  Due to demand for foodstuffs she started to buy rice and oil and gradually with effort and some sacrifice she now has her own business.  She works from 6am until nightfall.  She wants to use the loan to buy foodstuffs like rice, canned goods, sugar, etc.  In the future she wants to continue working and enlarging her store more.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, a simple entrepreneur, is 26 years old and lives in the Rizal province of Isabela. She sells fruits and vegetables door-to-door in her community, and wants to buy a variety of these to offer her customers. Anita is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy all the fruits and vegetables she needs to help provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of beans, tomatoes, bananas, and green leafy vegetables

loans.name: Xyndritz

texts.en:
Xyndritz is married with three children. His eldest child is currently studying while the other two are is still infants. Xyndritz wants to educate his three children and give them a better way of living.

Xyndritz has been engaged in his farming business for five years. He grows rice crops on his 1.5 hectares of rice field. Xyndritz would like to improve his farmland for him to gain plentiful yields this next crop season. To make his dream attainable, he is asking for additional working capital of 30,000 PHP allowing him to buy necessary farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides and certified seeds. In addition, he will use this amount of loan to pay for hired laborers who will cultivate his rice field. Xyndritz is hoping for further business growth and continuous access to financial services from lenders. In this way, he could obtain greater profit which will enable him to provide his family's needs and save some amount for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as certified seeds, fertilizer and insecticides and also to pay for hired laborers who will cultivate his farmland

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo started growing rice crops in 1973. He is grateful because in that long period of time, he was able to send his five children to school, though some of his children didn't finish their bachelor courses. His priority this time is to improve his rice crop production for him to earn bigger profits which will serve his family.

Rodolfo enjoys what he does in improving his rice farm business. Profits gained from his rice farm have been used to repay his obligation to lenders. Since he paid back his obligation successfully, Rodolfo is seeking another loan amount of 27,000 PHP. This amount will be used to buy some farm supplies and to pay for farm plot preparation. He hopes to get this loan amount so he could ensure good nutrition of his farm plot and be able to properly nourish the growth of his seedlings. In this way, he could obtain plentiful yields this next crop season.

loans.use: in land preparation of his rice farm plot and to buy farm supplies for his agricultural business

loans.name: Turgunboy

texts.ru: Не хотите ли вы помочь доброму человеку, которого местные жители знают как  «молочника». Его зовут Тургунбой и ему 41 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более  20 лет он занимается скотоводством. У него 3  коровы. Он продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Он хочет развевать бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  3000  сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Wouldn't you like to help a kind man whom the locals refer to as "the milkman"? His name is Turgunboy, he is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children at home. The climate where he lives is conducive to animal husbandry and growing crops. For over 20 years, Turgunboy has been raising cattle and currently has 3 cows. He sells the milk to his neighbours who are very satisfied with its natural good quality. He now wants to develop his business, but he lacks the means to do so. For that reason, Turgunboy is seeking a loan of 3,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy cattle. He plans to use the income generated by this purchase to provide his children with a good education and the latest technology. He is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 31 years old and from Maluno province of Isabela. She has managed a store for five years and sells different products. She is married to a farmer. To sustain her business, she is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional products such as soy sauce, vinegar, beverages, snack foods and flour  that she can offer in the community. She hopes that her business expands so that she can help her family maintain good living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase soy sauce, vinegar, beverages, snack foods and flour for her store.

loans.name: Naila's Group

texts.en:
Naila is a 50-year-old hard-working and diligent woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, 3 daughters and 3 sons. Her husband supplies goods in a market and earns a good income, while one of her sons works as a salesman. 

Since 1999, Naila has run her own general store. She works very hard and honestly. Currently she is in need of additional capital for the growth of her business. And for that, as a member of a 10-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some goods for her general store like soft drinks, shampoo, soap, pulses, rice, etc. With the profit she wants to establish some savings for her children's future. She dreams of owning her own house, as she is currently living in a rented house. She is very much hoping that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for her family. She sends her greetings to BRAC and Kiva users. 

Note: In the picture Naila holds a pink booklet in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her general store.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda shoulders the responsibility as both mother and father of her family. She manages food production such as “bibingka”, “puto” and “suman” and sells to the villagers. She is earning about 200 PHP a day and is wishing for higher income. Now, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy coconut, milk and sugar. She hopes that her wish loan will be approved to make more rice cakes to sell.

loans.use: to buy coconut, milk and sugar

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza enjoys planting vegetables in her backyard. She has been doing this kind of work since 2000. Her spouse's occupation is a tricycle driver and also a farmer within their local community. She and her spouse have been blessed with four children; two are still studying and the other two are working as security and a delivery boy.

Flordeliza would like to increase her sales and profits, but her capital intended for her vending business is not enough. She is seeking financial services from Kiva lenders and requests a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy vegetable seeds such as squash, eggplant, and okra. She hopes to make her vegetable garden more productive so she can generate a bigger income. This would enable her to support her children's educations and improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds such as squash, eggplant, and okra for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor says growing plants is just like caring for a child. He is 47 years old and operates his 1.2-hectares of rice fields. In 22 years of developing his farm plot, Melchor is able to improve his living conditions and educate his two children. Melchor's wife is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). 

Melchor youngest child is a college student on whom he spent his gained profit. His main goal now is to increase his profit so he could let his youngest child finish his degree and have a stable source of income. Melchor plans to purchase necessary farm supplies to ensure proper growth of his rice crops and also to pay hired laborers who will cultivate his farm land. He is requesting additional working capital through a loan of PHP 40,000. He believes that his farm could be one of the best among the rice fields of San Sebastian someday because he applies good agricultural practices he acquired from training and workshops he has attended.

loans.use: to buy necessary farm supplies for his rice field and to pay hired laborers to cultivate his farm land.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando has been raising rice crops for more than 20 years. For that long period of time, he has been able to sustain his family's basic commodities and improve their way of living. Armando is married and has four children. Three of his children currently go to school while the eldest is working.

Armando is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy certified seed and to pay for hired laborers to cultivate his rice farm land. He is hoping that his agricultural practices would help him improve his rice crop production so he could obtain better income. Armando knows that his hard work and focus on his farming business will help him obtain success in life.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and pay hired laborer to cultivate his rice farm.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
Duo Mujeres de san Lorenzo
está formado por la líder doña Catarina de 61 años de edad  ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para invertir una parte en la compra de materiales de muñequitos quitapenas ( alambre, retazos, recistol) y otra parte lo quiere invertir en el cultivo de camote para poder entregar y distribuir a sus clientes, su meta es incrementar mas su producción de camote y muñequitos para poder  tener más distribución en el mercado y tener más ingresos para solventar sus necesidades porque es viuda y ella trabaja para solventar todos sus gastos, de ante mano les agradese por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Women of San Lorenzo Duo

Catarina, 61, is part of this duo and she’s asking for a loan once again to use part of it to buy materials to make ‘quitapenas’ [dolls that remove worries] dolls (wire, remnants, Resistol glue) and part of it to use in her sweet potato crop so she can deliver and sell to her customers.  Her goal is to increase sweet potato and doll production to secure a larger market share and earn higher income to meet her needs because she’s a widow and she works to cover all her expenses.  She gives thanks in advance for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional dolls.

loans.name: Marlon Ivan

texts.es: Microempresario de éxito emprendedor de 47 años con más de 17años de experiencia en su negocio tiene un taller de soldadura en su casa de habitación con tres hijos a su cargo que los sabido sacar adelante a pesar de que es viudo a tenido la paciencia y ha sabido administrar su negocio que le genera ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia, con la institución lleva dos años el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como soldaduras, guantes, mascarillas.
texts.en: A successful, enterprising micro businessman who is 47-years-old with more than 17 years’ experience in his home-based welding shop.  He has three children in his care that he has raised despite being a widower; he’s been patient and has known how to manage his business that generates income to move his family forward.  He’s been with the institution for two years and will use the loan to buy raw materials like solder, gloves and face masks.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like solder, gloves, face masks, etc.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo has been raising rice crops on 2 hectares of rice fields for two years. He is indeed thankful to lenders because his previous loan helped him develop his farm plot and ensure good nutrition for his crops. He has had an increased income which he had used for his family's basic necessities and for the education of his eldest child.

Rodolfo still aims to increase his profit and to ensure proper growth of his crops so he could have a continuous source of income. He is in need of additional working capital of PHP 20,000 due to the increased price of farm supplies and the cost of hired laborers. Rodolfo hopes that his farming business will continue to grow to provide for his family's well-being and to save for security purposes should he get weak.

loans.use: to prepare his rice farm land and to buy farm inputs for his rice field.

loans.name: Yeni Del Carmen

texts.es: Microempresaria de éxito casada, con 31 años de edad con dos hijos se dedica a vender sombrero en el mercado de su localidad desde hace 6 años, tiene de estar con la institución 4 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sombreros variados y de marcas para la comercialización.
texts.en: A successful, married, 31-year-old micro businesswoman with two children who has sold hats in the local market for six years.  She’s been with the institution for four years and will use the loan to buy assorted, brand-name hats to sell.

loans.use: to buy hats.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Целеустремленный и мотивированный человек нуждается вашей поддержки. Его зовут Абдусаттор.  Ему 50  лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 16 и 17 лет. С целью обеспечения семьи более 18 лет он занимается скотоводством. Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Абдусаттор хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  650 доллаов США для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A determined and motivated man needs your support. His name is Abdusattor. He is 50 years old, married, and has 2 children, aged 16 and 17, at home. In order to provide for his family, for the last 18 years Abdusattor has been working in animal husbandry. He spends several months raising cattle which he then sells at the market, where he has many clients. He now wants to develop his business, but he does not have the means to do so. For this reason, Abdusattor is seeking a loan of 650 US dollars to buy cattle. He is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es: Maria Josefa, de 45 años de edad es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque, tiene una tienda donde vende productos comestibles de primera necesidad, posee su tienda desde hace varios años le da gracias a Dios ya que con ayuda de él ha podido salir adelante, ya ha trabajado otros crédito y no a caído en mora, está solicitando este crédito  para la compra de productos comestibles ya que necesita invertir más para generar más ganancias.
texts.en: Maria Josefa, 45 years old, is from San Martin Jilotepeque. She has a store where she sells basic food products. She has owned the store for several years, and thanks to God's help, she has been able to move forward. She has already taken out other loans and has not defaulted. She is requesting this loan to buy food products because she needs to invest more in order to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 60 years of age, married, and has six children. Four of her children are married, one is an Overseas Filipino Worker, and the youngest is a labourer in their village.

Marcelina is engaged in a direct selling business, particularly AVON and cosmetic sales. She has operated this business since 2000. With her patience and hard work, she is able to sustain the family's needs and supply all the farm supplies needed for her farming business. Marcelina's profits are used to cover their household expenses and to improve her rice-farming business.

Marcelina aims to increase the volume of cosmetic products she offers so that she can improve her financial stability. She is asking for financial support amounting to a loan of 12,000 PHP. She believes that this amount would be very useful for buying more stocks of cosmetic products and for the start-up of her variety store. She is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products such as lipstick, makeup kits, perfume, and hand and body lotions, some of which will be used for the start-up of her store.

loans.name: Manar

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Manar prefers that her photo not be shown on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Manar is a 25-year-old married woman with two family members from Al Koorah, Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy household items to resell in the same area.  She wants to increase her stock and also buy food stuffs. In the future she hopes to expand her shop and buy a bus. Since Manar is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy household items to resell

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 39-year-old housewife. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband and three daughters. All of her daughters are studying in a private school. Since 2007, her husband has had been running his own general store, which is the only source of income for the family. He works very hard to meet his family's needs and currently needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Shagufta is a member of 10-person lending group that has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase goods like soft drinks, shampoos, soaps, pulses, rice, etc. for the general store. With the profit, she wants to renovate her house and save for her daughter's marriage. She dreams for her daughters' better future and the growth of her husband's business. Shagufta and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. She is very much thankful to KIVA. 
Note: In the picture Shagufta carrying a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 56 years old and from the village of Quirino. She is a very responsible mother of six.

So that she is able to meet the important daily needs of her family, Mercedes is requesting a loan amounting to 9000 PHP. With this loan she will buy bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, and onions for her business so that she will have additional income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Zhra

texts.en: Zahra is a married tailor who has been in her line of work for many years. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen and has ten children. She makes ladies' clothes and spends many hours a day working. She is requesting a loan of 270,000 YER from AMB so that she can buy fabric and trimmings with which to make clothing.  An increase in her income would allow her to better cover her expenses, to build savings, and to improve her family's food conditions. She also hopes to enroll her children in a good education.

loans.use: to buy fabric and trimmings with which to make clothing

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a hardworking husband and responsible father to his three children. According to him, his eldest child is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW), while his other two children work within the Philippines only. He is grateful because his previous loan had a great impact in the improvement of his farming business.

Mario grows rice crops on his two hectares of farm plot. He has managed this business for 20 years at this time. Mario would like to take out a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs and to pay for hired laborers who will cultivate his farm plot. He knows that this amount of loan would really help him in making his farming business more productive and profitable someday. Mario expects that his rice field will improve because of his patience, determination and hard work.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay for hired laborers

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias microempresaria de éxito una de ellas es Adriana que tiene un taller de costura desde hace 15 años, su familia formada por dos hijos y su esposo le apoya en la búsqueda y comercialización de los productos que hacen, ella trabaja por encargo y entrega pedidos a  los mercados de la capital  y al mercado de su localidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de telas, zipper, botones, elásticos, etc. Cándida Rosa vende frutas frescas ambulantes desde hace varios años y José Mario vende nacatamal los fines de semanas y leña a la comunidad.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three successful small businesspeople. One of them is Adriana, who has had a sewing studio for 15 years. Her family includes two children and her husband, who helps her search for and market their products. She works on request and delivers the orders to the markets in the capital and the market in her town. She will invest the loan into buying fabric, zippers, buttons, elastic, etc. Cándida Rosa has sold fresh fruit from the street for several years and José Mario sells nacatamal (corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf) on the weekends. He also sells firewood to the community.

loans.use: to invest in buying fabric, zippers, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Romy

texts.en:
Romy is a proud farmer within his local community. He is 45 years of age, married, and has been blessed with two children. He aims to obtain greater profits from his business so he can provide his two children with higher levels of education and save some money for his family for emergency purposes. 

Romy grows rice crops on his two hectares of farm land. He has been in this field for 20 years. He is really grateful to Kiva lenders because his previous loan helped him so much. He would like to continue developing his farming operation so he is requesting another loan amounting to PHP 20,000, which will be used to buy necessary farm inputs. He knows that this loan will make his business more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy necessary farm inputs

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry, 41 years old, is married to a simple farmer, Danilo, from the remote area of Maluno province of Isabela. She has been busy managing her store for 4 years. To have additional income, Cherry is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice, cooking oil and snacks for her business. From the additional products purchased, she is looking forward to providing the daily needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional products that she can sell in her store

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 54 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen in their village. 

Jennifer has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. Now, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell. Jennifer plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell.

loans.name: Fachima Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the Fachima group. They are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000.00 Leones each to invest in their respective businesses. 

Aiah is the leader of this group. Aiah is 33 years old and married with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Aiah sells ready-to-wear clothing. He has been a businessman for seven years now. With the help of this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of clothing to add to his business.  

(Also posing second from right is loan officer Edward.)

loans.use: to buy dozens of garments to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is 55 years old and lives in Rizal. He has two children, Aldritz and Bernadette. Arturo works as a tricycle driver in their village. He gives at least 200 PHP per day to the tricycle owner as his boundary, and the rest of his income is for his family. Aside from working as a tricycle driver, Arturo is also busy on his farm where he plants and sells vegetables for extra income. 

He wants to borrow a loan of 26,000 PHP that he will use for cultivating his vegetables. He is hoping that through his business he can provide a better life for his family, and hopefully he can have his own motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor involved in rice farming.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is an industrious wife. To supplement her spouse's income, who is a construction worker, Edna operates a small store selling grocery items to the people in her village. She has been selling items for over 5 years now and gains about 4,000 PHP each month. She is now 38 years old and has three children. The family peacefully resides at Enrile. 

Edna would like to increase her sales but she has insufficient funds. She is now asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, sugar, coffee, milk and noodles to sell. She promises to pay back her loan in full. Edna's goal in improving her small business will lead to income stability, and therefore allows her family to live fortunately in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, coffee, milk and noodles to sell

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en: Edelita operates a buy-and-sell business in her village. She earns an income of PHP 500 a day and usually spends it on basic necessities, such as food. She wants to increase her income so she can save for the future. To make this possible, she is now applying for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fruits and vegetables to sell such as tomatoes, calamansi (a citrus fruit), cabbage, pechay (another type of cabbage) and carrots. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so she can achieve her desired income, which would provide her with a better living and help her to save for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell such as tomatoes, calamansi (a citrus fruit), cabbage, pechay (another type of cabbage) and carrots.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita a 43 years old and is married to Beruardo, a simple man. Teresita has been engaged in raising pigs in the community for six years. She is a very patient woman. For their everyday needs, she is also selling meat house-to-house. 

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy two piglets and more feed. In the future, Teresita hopes that she can buy a small area of land so that she can build a small store where she can display her products.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed for her business.

loans.name: Luchando Por  La Vida Group

texts.es: Microempresarios formado  por tres socios exitosos que se dedican a sus diferentes actividades, una de ellas es Yara de 20 años que se dedica a la venta de comida y ropa usada en su comunidad, esta actividad la viene realizando hace dos años consecutivos como una opción de trabajo para el sustento de su familia, el crédito lo solicitara para compra de materia prima como es arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, verduras, e inyectar un poco a su  otro negocio colateral de ropa usada por piezas. Una meta de ella es comprar la ropa usada por paca. Cándido vende comida en su domicilio desde hace 1 año es casada y tiene dos hijos, María Estevana  se dedica a producir tortilla, yoltamal y tiene un pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en:
These three successful entrepreneurs work in different sectors. One of them is Yara, 20 years old, who works by selling food and second-hand clothing in her community. She has performed this work for the past two years as a way to support her family. She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, chicken, and vegetables. She will also use a bit of the loan for her secondary business of selling second-hand clothing. One of her goals is to buy second-hand clothing in bulk. 

Cándido has sold food from his home for a year. He is married and has two children. María Estevana works by making tortillas and sweet corn tamales. She also has a small sewing studio.

loans.use: to buy grains, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Demie

texts.en: Demie, aged 32, is patiently managing a sari-sari store in his village. The hardships of living triggered him to set up this business. He wants to improve it to help support his family, but he suffers from inadequate funds. To improve this situation, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, soap, and soft drinks. He hopes to increase his sales through the addition of these products, and believes that the loan will help him to improve the business overall.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soap, and soft drinks

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a widow and a mother of seven children. She is an industrious and hard-working woman who wants to get ahead in life. At this time, two of her children are supported by her parents, and the other five are living with her. These five children are attending school right now, so she is doubling her efforts and hard work in order to cover all their household expenses and provide her children with daily allowances.

The profits Deborah gets from her general store and boarding house are not enough, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. This will be used to buy merchandise and a complete set of basic necessities for her to increase her sales and profits. She knows that her dreams can come true because she will find ways to improve her general store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a complete set of basic necessities for her general store

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: "Working hard is the best way of earning more for the welfare of the family," said Domingo, a 56-year-old man. He is married to Arcelie, his partner in pursuing life and business. Domingo really devotes himself in his business to pay for the growing needs of his two children. His eldest is 15 while his youngest is four. They are still too young to conquer their living conditions, so the couple is striving hard to save for their bright future. He wants to improve his business and fulfill his plan of providing a good education for his children, especially since they are getting older. He is asking for financial assistance of PHP 50,000 to buy more fish, a new weight scale, five Styrofoam containers, and ice. He hopes to have a stable business in order to acquire a better standard of living with his family as well as save for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy more fish, a new weight scale, five Styrofoam containers, and ice

loans.name: Roula

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Roula prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother. Roula is a 33-year-old married woman, who has 5 family members, from Al-Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell to her friends and neighbors in the area. She hopes in the future to open a shop to show her products and increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for materials for flower arranging.

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en: The major reason Emerlita works hard is to save for the education of her three children. She has been buying and selling bananas for more than five years. With her continual devotion to her business, she needs to have enough money to invest in it.  So, she would like to request a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more bananas to sell. This would make her business prosper.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Ludy Eduviges

texts.es: Ludy vive en el sur de Guayaquil conocido como el Suburbio. A sus 37 años tiene una profesión poco común en hombres, la corte y confección .  Ella empezo  hace 15 años aprendiendo de su tío quien tenía esta misma profesión, le gusto mucho por lo que realizo varios cursos para ampliar sus conocimientos y mejorar las técnicas. Ludy comenta que en todo trabajo lo que más cuenta es la experiencia que se adquiere con el tiempo y ella ya tiene bastante. Trabaja solo de lunes a domingos desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde siempre que termine con el pedido. Su especialidad son los ternos de caballeros , vestidos de gala , los cuales tienen gran acogida, también confecciona camisas, pantalones unisex, blusas y uniformes. El taller está ubicado en su domicilio donde tiene su máquina y una mesa para el corte. El mayor problema que enfrenta Ludy es la entrega de las prendas una vez terminadas, como se mueve en busetas teme que los ladrones roben su trabajo. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la ya que la actual esta vieja y necesita un cambio, igual no la desechara ya que de necesitar contratar alguien le serviría. Espera a futuro comprar una maquina industrial con la que brindaría mejores servicios a sus clientelas .Con el préstamo Ludy comprara telas, hilos ,etc.
texts.en: Ludy lives in an area in south Guayaquil known as  El Suburbio. At 37 years old, she has a profession not common among men, cutting and sewing. She started 15 years ago, learning from her uncle who had the same profession. She really liked it and took several courses to expand her knowledge and improve her technique. Ludy says that for every job what counts the most is experience, which is acquired over time, and she already has a lot. She works Monday through Sunday from 7 in the morning until 6 at night, as long as she finishes the order. her specialty are men's suits, formal dresses, Her are very popular. She also makes shirts, unisex pants, blouses and uniforms. Her workshop is located in her house where she has her machine and her cutting table. The biggest problem Ludy faces is delivering the items once they are finished. She gets around in a lot of buses and theives steal her work. The loan she is asking for is to buy a sewing machine. The one she has is old and needs to be changed. She won't throw it out, but will hhire someone to use it. In the future, she hopes to buy an industrial machine to offer better service to her customers. With the loan, Ludy will buy fabric, thread, etc.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine, fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Mt Rungwe Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 30s, is single and has a boy who goes to school.  She has had a cafe business since 2010.  She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more items to resell, paid rent for her business, bought a fridge for her business, covered household expenses, and she has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy a blender for making more juices and to purchase more drinks for her business. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own, nice house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Rungwe," which totals 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy a blender for making more juices and purchase more drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tea and spices for selling.

loans.name: Abd Allatif

texts.en: Abd Allatif is a 30-year-old single man from Jarash, Jordan.  He is requesting a loan of 800 JD to buy materials for his cafe such as coffee, tea, milk and other products.  He wants to expand and develop his cafe. He hopes to increase his products in the future.

loans.use: buy materials for his cafe

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina is a 38-year-old married female from Al Hashmi in Jordan.  She has 4 children.  Dina requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothes from her own home.  In the future, Dian is looking forward to open her own shop and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 28-year-old married female from Al Russfifeh in Jordan.  She has requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. Sana is looking forward to improve the living conditions of her family and home.

Since Sana is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Tahani prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her mother.

Tahani is a 34-year-old single female from Bani Kenanah in Jordan.  She requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for buying a sewing machine and raw materials to be used in making clothes for sale. Tahani is planning to have her own shop and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena has multi-cab business travelling from Aparri to Camalaniugan and vice versa. Her husband drives this cab everyday and earns PHP 600 daily. Their multi-cab has already been operating for over 6 years.  During these years, it had so many hardships in travelling.  So now Nena wants to achieve a loan of PHP 10,000 to use in the repair and maintenance to their multi-cab. She hopes for your kindness and help to approve her wished for loan in order to continue this operation for their household.

loans.use: maintain and repair her cab vehicle

loans.name: Wajeeha

texts.en: Wajeeha is a 52-year-old married female from Al Bayader in Jordan.  She has 3 children.  Wajeeha requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy a new fridge.  In the future, Wajeeha would like to make more amendments to her home and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Rabe'

texts.en:
Rabe' is a 24-year-old single male from Al Zarqa in Jordan.  He has requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for his wedding expenses.  In the future, Rabe' is planning to have his own business and his own home.

Since Rabe' is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: pay for his wedding expenses

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna, 49, is a very hard-working person who is devoted to her only child. She has a piggery that cares for three piglets. She began this business in order to generate enough income to support her child. At the moment, she is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. This amount will be a big help in maintaining her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: La señora Maria Erlinda, es una persona de 27 años de edad de estado civil madre soltera, alcanzo a estudiar una carrera técnica (auxiliar en enfermería), cuenta con un dependiente económico a cargo el cual es su pequeño hijo y actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres que se halla situada en la comunidad de Cuartel Parcela - Iluri del municipio de Tíraque, distante aproximadamente desde la ciudad de Cochabamba a 75 km. La señora María Erlinda actualmente presta sus servicios de enfermera en la población de Ivirgazama, es contratada según manifiesta cada 3 meses por una organización internacional. Finalmente la clienta manifiesta tener ganas de superarse y obtener ingresos económicos adicionales y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de operación para comercializar hortalizas los fines de semana ya que manifiesta que cuenta con la experiencia necesaria en este rubro y de tal forma obtener ingresos adicionales que vayan a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Erlinda is 27 years old and her civil status is a single mother. She managed to study a technical program (nursing assistant), and counts her little son as her dependent. They currently live in her parents' house, which is located in the community of Cuartel Parcela - Iluri in the Tíraque municipality. It is approximately 75 km from Cochabamba. María Erlinda is loaning her services as a nurse to the population of Ivirgazama, and has three-month contract with an international organization. Finally, the client holds the desire to overcome and obtain additional economic income. For this purpose she needs to ask for trading capital to commercialize vegetables on the weekend. She counts on this for necessary experience which will help her obtain additional income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: gain trading capital to commercialize vegetables.

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en: Shahla is a 52-year-old married female from Jarash in Jordan.  She has 3 children.  Shahla requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her son's educational expenses.

loans.use: pay for her son's educational expenses

loans.name: Naiem

texts.en: Naiem is a 33-year-old married man  from Hay Nazal in Jordan who supports 1 family members. He is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for his home improvements.  He would like to do maintenance of the home and to buy new furniture. He hopes in the future to buy a new home

loans.use: pay for his home improvements

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia makes a living by running a general store in the rural village of San Ignacio, Isabela, Philippines. She aspires to have her business grow and be competitive with other stores in her village. She has four children with Monato, her husband, who works overseas. Their four children are all studying. They need to help each other to give their children a good education so that some day all of them will have a good future. Their eldest is now 15 years old and studying in high school with their second child. The two younger children are both in elementary school. 

Alicia is asking for a loan to purchase commodities for her general store. She hopes to access a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will surely be very useful in improving her store. Alicia believes that time is gold; thus, they work very hard and help each other in the progress of their daily lives, doing their best not to waste time.

loans.use: To purchase commodities for her general store

loans.name: Deema

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Deema prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her husband.

Deema is a 36-year-old married female from Al Bayader in Jordan.  She has 6 children.  Deema requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for working in flower designing.  In the future, Deema is looking forward to have her own flower shop.

loans.use: develop her flower design business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
“Time is gold” is a quotation that Vicenta applies in her life. She is 46 years old and married to Fernando, who is a farmer. Together, they have three children. Farming is their family's main source of income. In order to provide for the growing needs of their family, Vicenta and her husband decided to start a hog raising business.

Vicenta would like to request a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP. She will use the loan to maintain her hogs and to buy enough feed for their growth. She is also planning to purchase new piglets for additional income. She is very patient in raising the hogs because she knows that raising them is a big help in meeting her family's needs in a sustainable manner. Vicenta believes that by utilizing her time wisely in her business, she will become successful in her business endeavor.

loans.use: to support her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Mariam prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Mariam is a 31-year-old married woman from Nao'or, Jordan, who has 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to buy children and women clothing to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area.  She would like to increase her products and to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to open a shop to increase her family income.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: A very diligent and hardworking mother, Norma manages a store where she sells different products to the people of her community. She is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional products such as snack foods, spices and drinks for her store. These purchases will allow her to have additional income to sustain the needs of her family. In the future, Norma hopes that her business can expand so that she can sustain the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, spices, and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en: Etaf is a 42-year-old married woman who has 4 family members from Al Karak, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements.  She wants to expand her home and to increase the number of rooms. In the future she hopes to repaint her home and to do maintenance of the home.

loans.use: pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works every day in her business of buying and selling fish. This enables her to support her household expenses and the cost of her children's schooling.
