She believes that she is doing well in her business because she is very friendly to her customers and because she offers good-quality products at affordable prices.

Lolita is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy a second-hand freezer and more fish to resell. This will enable her to keep her products in good quality. This, in turn, will enable her to improve her income as she continues working.

loans.use: buy a second-hand freezer and fish to resell

loans.name: Patricidra

texts.en:
Patricidra is married to Danilo. Their marriage was blessed with four children: Danilo, the twins Rowena and Ronald, and the youngest, Quincy, who is 22 years old. They live in Rizal, a place that has rough road conditions and that is far from the public market.

Patricia is doing a direct selling business of Avon products. With her need of additional capital, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 17,000.00 that she will use for her direct selling business. She promised herself to exert more effort in selling to have additional income for the education of her youngest daughter.

loans.use: Improve her Avon retail business

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en: Nicolas, 51 years old, is married. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has thirty years of experience. With his last crop, he earned about PHP 35,000. Now, he is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings and pay the labor cost for planting his farm. Future loans from KIVA would be very useful to him, as he sees the loans as the only chance for the growth of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings and pay for the labor cost for planting his farm

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: a señora Francisca vive en Patacamaya junto a su esposo e hijos los cuales son 9 de diferentes edades, ellos son agricultores de papa y quinua en sus terrenos de la comunidad Santiago de callapa las cuales le heredaron sus abuelos y así siguen de generación en generación , francisca es muy trabajadora ya que al tener la responsabilidad de tener una familia numerosa le hizo reflexionar en obtener mas ingresos y es así que ella decide poner un negocio comercial que es la venta de refrescos, gelatinas ,ensaladas de frutas y otros productos  mas, esta actividad lo realiza a lo largo del año con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores. Ya que ellos van ambulando por las calles para así obtener más ingresos para la canasta familiar, ellos quieren mejorar su puesto de venta gelatina por eso este el motivo del crédito, necesitan comprar sillas, capital de operación para su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca lives in Patacamaya with her husband and nine children of various ages.  They grow potatoes and quinoa on their land in the Santiago de Callapa community.  They inherited the land from their grandparents, so they're continuing through the generations.

Francisca's very hardworking because having the responsibility of a big family made her think about getting more income.  This is how she decided to start a business selling refreshments, gelatin, fruit salad, and other products.  She does this job year round with the help of her older children, who sell in the streets to get more income for the family shopping basket.

The goal of the loan is to improve her sales stall.  They need to buy chairs and have operating capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and dishes

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en: Gregorio, 48 years old, is married to Margilyn. They live in the community of Rizal, in the province of Isabela. He has been engaged in raising pigs for two years. He wants to add another piglet so that he can sell it in the future. He is requesting a loan of Php 12,000. In the future, Gregorio hopes that he can expand his business so that he can provide for all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets for his business

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia has already been a widow for 11 years. She serves as the mother and father to her three children. Her youngest daughter Wilma was not able to pursue her studies due to life difficulties. At present, the family stands firm and helps one another to surpass the hardships of life.

Lucrecia is a vegetable vendor in their village. Most of the time, she earns a daily income of PHP 200 that they budget for the immediate needs of the family. She wants to improve her business and for this she is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000. She will use the additional capital to improve her small enterprise. She is hoping that with the financial assistance she is requesting, and through the help of God, she will be able to expand her business and earn a higher income to better provide for the needs of her family. She is thankful that her three children are very responsible and helpful in their poor living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in her business selling vegetables.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita raises four hogs and sells them for profit. She is happily married and has four children.  She hopes that her livestock business is profitable so she can send her children into a higher level of education and give them a better future.

Rosita's four fattening pigs are about to be disposed of this month since they had reached their optimum growth already.  For now, she plans to buy four more piglets and livestock feed for her hog maintenance, so she request for a loan of PHP15,000.  She hopes that she can improve her business continuously for her to gain better income and have a comfortable living condition.

On the business picture, Rosita is wearing a blue shirt.  Her companion in the picture is the project officer-in-charge of their barangay.

loans.use: buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
Jossie is 49 years old.  She is married and has two children who attend college. She started her business 13 years ago, selling different viands and groceries and she has always been a saleswoman who likes to innovate. This is also a way of attracting customers. 

Jossie currently works alone, so she wants to hire a companion.  She would like to ask financial assistance in the amount of PHP 10,000 to expand her business in order to have a greater income to pay for her another saleslady for her business. The loan will be use to buy meat and more groceries to generate more proceeds.

loans.use: buy groceries and meat to sell

loans.name: 01.06.07 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

Hoa is 52 years old and is married with 1 child.  She is the group leader of the 01.06.07 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. Hoa lives in Thanh Hoa City with 1 dependent.

In 2012, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main harship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: buy fruit to resell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hog raiser in the village of Villa Beltran.  She is 39 years of age and married to a farmer. They have two children, both of her two children go to school.

Grace is raising two sows, which are about to give birth this month.  She would like to ensure the proper growth of her sows through sustaining them with the necessary hog feed, vitamins and vaccines.  But due to the expensive price of these livestock supplies, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000.  She hopes that this loan amount will be granted for her to improve her hog raising business, which will serve to educate her two children and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a food vendor in the village of Lallo.  She sells peanuts, coco juice and eggs.  This is the only source of income that she has.   Delia serves as mother and father to her children because her husband already left this world. She is patiently doing this activity to support her children. 

To increase her sales, Delia is seeking a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy peanut, eggs, sugar, coconut and cooking oil to sell.  Hopefully her requested loan will be given to her.

loans.use: buy peanut, eggs, sugar, coconut and cooking oil

loans.name: 01.05.08 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Quyết has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to mend and make tailor-made clothes. 

Quyết, 43, is married with 2 children.

Quyết is the group leader of the 01.05.08 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Quyết joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Quyết has successfully repaid 3 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Quyết has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Quyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase machines to make and repair clothes.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a 30-year-old married man from Ashrafia Amman Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for his home improvements. He would like to do maintenance of the home and to buy new furniture. He wants to create a comfortable space for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvvements

loans.name: 04.3.3 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Lân operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell.

Lân is 46 years old and is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 04.3.3 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents -- her children are grown up.

In 2007, Lân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lân has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lân has been involved in her business for 5 years.  The main harship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lân hopes to build a new house.  She also hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Yesenia Marisol

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Las Palmitas.

En este lugar vive la señora Yessenia, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 8 años que estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es artesano y agricultor.

Ella junto al esposo se dedican a elaborar sombreros de paja toquilla desde hace mas de 10 años y esto les ha dado lo necesario para sacar adelante a su familia, ellos elaboran los sombreros y luego una vez por semana llevan a entregar sus productos  a comerciantes en Montecristi los mismos que los comercializan en esta ciudad a turistas que gustan mucho de estos productos típicos del lugar. 

Este crédito es para comprar paja toquilla, pinturas y cintas necesarias para elaborar los sombreros. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudar en algo a su esposo.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro para vender los sombreros.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for the diversity of its typical products, for example the straw panama hats known far and wide. This is where the members of Communal Bank Las Palmitas meet every 15 days.

Yesenia lives here. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children aged 8 and 9 who are in school. Her husband is an artisan and farmer. 
She and her husband have worked making these straw hats for more than 10 years, and this has given them what they need to advance their family. They make the hats, and then once a week they take their good to traders in Montecristi, who sell the products to tourist who really like the typical products of these places. 

This loan is to buy the straw, paints, and ribbons necessary to make the hats. She has been part of the Communal Bank for 2 years. She is the president of the Bank, and she likes it because with the loans she can help her husband.

Her dream is to have a place in the city where she can sell the hats.

loans.use: to buy straw, paints, and ribbon.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan is a 45-year-old rice farmer who lives with her husband and five children in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. Out of her five children, she still has four children to take care of and they help their family business. Besides rice farming on a 2-hectare area of farmland, Phan’s husband also earns income by working for others in the local area for a fee. Having been in this occupation for 20 years, Phan and her husband are able to earn almost 30,000 KHR per day. They save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her rice paddy.

Phan has been with VisionFund for four cycles and has fully paid back the past loans. She has wisely used the previous loans to better support her family living’s condition. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan with VisionFund of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Phan is going to utilize her portion to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and timely to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Moamar

texts.en: Moamar is a 29-year-old single male from Ashrafia. He requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for his home improvement and painting expenses. He would also like to buy some furniture.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Leena prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Leena is a 24-year-old married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Pheakdey's Group

texts.en:
Pheakdey, a citizen of KrorLanh district of Siem Reap Province in Cambodia, is a 37-year-old mother and has three children. She supports her family by selling grocery items, and her husband catches fish for resale. She has been involved in the grocery business for 10 years. Pheakdey is the leader of a group of four female members. All four members have been with VisionFund for at least two cycles. 

Pheakdey feels confident that she can improve her family's conditions. This is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund. As the group leader, her loan portion will be used on purchasing grocery items like soap, instant noodles, canned food, and food ingredients. She hopes to buy her additional material on time and sell with a high margin.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Yasmeen prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her mother. 

Yasmeen is a 23-year-old married woman who has 2 family members from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to do maintenance to her home.  In the future she wants to create a good environment to live in.
 
Since Yasmeen is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is a kind-hearted person. She is a mother of three and sells hotdogs and sausages to the people in her village. She offers her products on a house-to-house basis and earns about PHP 3,000 each month. 

Precy hopes to increase her income and sell more products, but she has insufficient funds now. So, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy hot dogs, cured beef, pork sausages and fish balls to sell. She is very thankful even though she only generates minimal income from her business. Someday, she hopes to increase sales as well as good relationships to all her customers.  The additional revenue will sustain all her family's needs.

loans.use: buy hot dogs, cured beef, pork sausages and fish balls to sell

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Dalia prefers that her photo not be on the Internet. As such, the above photo is that of her brother. Dalia is a 21-year-old married woman who has two family members from Hay Nazal, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to buy materials for making handcrafts. In the future, she hopes to open a shop to show her products and to buy a home. Since Dalia is under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for making handcrafts.

loans.name: Ebtihaj

texts.en: Ebtihaj is a 54-year-old married female from Marka in Jordan.  She has 4 children.   Ebtihaj requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for buying raw materials needed to work in embroideries.  In the future, Ebtihaj is looking forward to opening her own shop.

loans.use: buy embroidery materials

loans.name: 09.02.02 -Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Chiến operates a food stall/restaurant selling liquor, beer, and snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refeshment bar (a small bar with coffee, tea, soft drink, fast food, etc.)

Chiến is 65 years old and is married with 2 children.  She is the leader of an 8-member group, the 09.02.02 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group. Chiến lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  She has no dependent since her children are grown up.

This is Chiến first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  She has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.  The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Chiến hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: restock her refreshment bar business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a proud farmer and patiently grows rice and sells them to traders in his village. He goes down the rice field everyday, both rainy or sunny. From selling the raised crop, he usually gains about PHP 15,000 each harvest season (twice in a year).  Edgar had been in his farming business for almost 15 years now. He has four children who needs assistance, especially for school expenses.  

Edgar would like to improve his crop production, but he had inadequate funds. That is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizers(UREA), insecticides and pesticides used in the farming business.

Someday, with stable income and more crop production, Edgar will able to give a fortunate life to his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: 09.02.01 Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Hoa has a service business cutting hair. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain her barber shop.

Hoa is 38 years old and is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 09.02.01 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  Hoa lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her children are grown up.

This is Hoa first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  She has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.  The main harship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: buy tools for her hair salon

loans.name: 09.03.03 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mỹ works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Mỹ is 57 years old and is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 09.03.03 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of 9 members.  She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her children are grown up.

This is Mỹ first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  She has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.  The main harship that Mỹ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Mỹ hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha wants to prove that through farming she and her husband will uplift their standard of living. Alpha has four children who are attending school. Alpha always advises her children to learn to tighten their belts. They have to minimize their expenditures because someday they will enter the college level of education. 

With regards to their farming business, Alpha wishes to get a high yield from the crops. Alpha has difficulties in financing their farm. This reason pushed her to request a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for the labor cost in farming. 

Alpha and her husband continue to improve their practices in farming to further achieve her wish.

loans.use: pay for buy seeds, fertilizers, and farming labor costs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a simple 55-year-old mother from the mountainous region of Maluno Sur in the province of Isabela in the Philippines. She is engaged in selling a variety of products to the community. According to her, she needs to double her work effort so that she can give the good life to her family. In relation to that, she is asking for a loan of Php 26,000 to buy different products that she can offer to the people in the community. In the future, Carmelita hopes that she can provide all that her family needs.

loans.use: to buy noodles, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil for her store.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is a hardworking mother who manages a vegetable stall.  She has been selling food to the people in her village for over 10 years now. She has four children and her spouse helps her manage their business. She would like to keep improving the business and keep it selling, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to invest in expanding her merchandise stock. She will buy cabbages, potatoes, eggplants, onions and bananas to sell.  Rosel  can gain more income if she will keep extending friendly services and good products to all her customers. 

In the future, Rosel would like to earn good profits and have a stable income for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
Em lives in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is a 58-year-old married mother of eight children. To make a living, Em has been growing cassava on a 2.5-hectare area of farmland while her husband supplements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her family approximately 30,000 KHR per day and allows them to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low cassava yield is still the main challenge.

Em’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Em completely repaid the past loan which has helped better support her current business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Em will use her portion to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow her cassava healthfully and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To spend on labor fees

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Sana prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; therefore, the above photo is of her son.

Sana is a 40-year-old married female from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She has 3 children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for clothes to retail from her own house. In the future, Sana is planning to have her own shop and buy a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bara'a

texts.en:
Bara'a is a 21-year-old single female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She requested a 500 JOD loan to fund a clothes-retailing business in her own home. In the future, Bara'a is planning to open her own shop and buy a house.

Since Bara'a is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to retail.

loans.name: Don's Group

texts.en:
Don is 59 years old and a married father who has been blessed with eight children, two of whom are dependent on him and still in school. He resides in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To support the family, he has been working as a rice farmer for thirty years. Besides rice farming, he also grows sesame on a 6-hectare area of farmland. Don can earn from his current business approximately KHR 50,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 30,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses. Insufficient working capital is the main challenge for him to support his paddy-field. 

Don has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. The past loan, which he successfully paid back, has relieved his family’s burden and improved his livelihood. Now he is leading his group of two to apply for a loan of KHR 1,200,000 each. As the leader, Don will use his portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to grow his business and earn a larger income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: El Cielo Group

texts.es: Microempresarias formada por tres socias una de ellas es Benicia Victoria de 60 años quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 11 años  es casada con dos hijos mayores quien ella misma atiende el negocio, de estar en la institución lleva 4 años consecutivo el crédito lo invertirá para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, jabón de baños, jabón de lavar trastes, medicamentos populares etc. Elyin Patricia tiene un pequeño taller de espejo lo cual fabrica y repara al mismo tiempo en su domicilio, Luz Marina vende ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed by three members with microbusinesses. One of them is Benicia Victoria, who is 60 years old. She has had a grocery store for 11 years. She is married and has two adult children. She herself tends to the business. She has been in the communal bank for 4 consecutive years. She will invest the loan in the purchase of staple products such as rice, oil, sugar, bath soap, dish-washing soap, popular medicines, etc. 

Elyin Patricia has a little glass workshop in her home, where she makes and repairs glass items. Luz Martina sells clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of staple products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, bath soap, dish-washing soap, etc., for her store.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng, 49, is a farmer in a rural village in Battambang province’s Kam Rieng district in Cambodia. She has six children, four of whom are dependent on her and they are still in school in the local area. 

Sokheng has been raising pigs and cows for four years. Besides this, Sokheng also grows various kinds of vegetables such as cabbages, lettuce and chilies, etc. on two hectares of farmland to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her approximately US$ 13 per day and she manages to save about US$ 6 each day after offsetting daily expenses.

This is the first loan cycle for Sokheng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She is applying for a loan of US$ 1,000. She is going to utilize this loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on pig feed for nourishing her pigs. Sokheng hopes to get a high yield from her plantation business and also hopes to fatten her pigs so as to keep up a good progress of her lifestyle.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticides, and pig feed

loans.name: Roqaya

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Roqaya prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her father.

Roqaya is a 24-year-old single female from Jarash in Jordan.  She requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing home appliances and kitchen tools. 

Since Roqaya is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: pay for retailing home appliances and kitchen tools

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Ms. Aysha is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been in he business of making footballs for 15 years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone.

Aysha is a motivated mother of four. She is liable to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 20,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees). The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use the part of profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers for making footballs.

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en:
Yong, 39, lives in a rural area in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has eight children, all of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. 

Rice farming and pig raising are the main sources of the family’s income, which Yong has been in for thirteen years. To add more income for the family, her husband also catches fish and works as a paid worker in the local area. The current businesses earns them approximately KHR 30,000 per day and they manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy field. 

Yong has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five cycles and had completely paid back the past loans, which have constantly supported her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Yong will use her portion to buy fishing tackles for her husband’s business, such as cast net and fishing pliers, etc. She hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy fishing supplies for her husband’s business

loans.name: Ranya

texts.en: Ranya is a 30-year-old married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan.  She has 2 children.  Ranya requested a 300 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture.

loans.use: pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en:
Song, aged 45, is a married mother of five children who has been engaged in rice farming and sesame growing in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has been in this business for almost twenty years. The current occupation earns Song approximately 30,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. The lack of working capital is the main challenge for her farming business. 

This is the first microloan for Song with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group of two to ask for a loan 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy insecticides and fertilizer for her farmland. Through this loan, Song hopes to grow her current business to earn a larger income so as to make convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: buy insecticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Hind

texts.en: Hind is a 36-year-old married female from Jarash in Jordan.  She has 3 children.  Hind requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for supplies to make cheese and dairy products.

loans.use: pay for cheese making supplies

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Bopha is 56 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child (daughter) in a rural village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. Her daughter is still in school. 

Rice farming and sesame growing are the primary sources of her family’s income. She has been in this business for ten years. Bopha’s daily income is approximately 30,000 KHR and she can manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. The scarcity of working capital is the main challenge for supporting her farming business. 

Bopha has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle and has fully paid back the past loan. She has successfully and wisely utilized the previous loan to secure food needs for her family and also to support her family with enough household supplies for consumption. Now Bopha is leading her group of two to request another loan. She is going to use her portion to buy insecticides and fertilizer for her farmland.

Bopha hopes to grow her rice and sesame successfully and increase a large income to better off her family’s living condition and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: buy insecticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Fadia prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her son.

Muna is a 50-year-old married female from Al Russeifeh in Jordan.  She has 5 children.  Muna requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses.  In the future, Muna is planning to build two additional rooms in the house for her sons and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a proud farmer since it's her family's main source of income. She is married and has four children. At this time, she spends much on her three children, who currently go to school.

Lolita plans to purchase farm inputs such as insecticides, fertilizer and certified seeds. In addition, she will use some of the loan amount in paying for the labor cost of hired laborers who will prepare her farm plot.  Due to insufficient funds, Lolita is requesting for a loan of PHP 30,000.  She knows that this amount of loan will help her in improving the quality of her rice crops because she can provide proper care to her crops.

Lolita is looking forward for the success of her business and improvement of her financial stability.

loans.use: pay for farm inputs and labor costs

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is an open-minded, hard-working and industrious woman. She is 25 years of age and married. Despite her marital status, she still has time for  finishing her degree course.  She is taking a Commerce course at the University of La Sallete Santiago. Her husband is working at a microfinance institution. Aside from the agricultural business, Diana also has a retail store and offers a personal collection.  She has been doing all these things for her to succeed and have a stable source of income.

Diana is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000, which will be use in preparing her farm plot and to buy farm inputs for her agricultural business. She hopes that her request loan amount will be granted.  In this way, she can obtain greater income, which will serve her family's basic needs and her own education.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Divinagracia

texts.en:
DivinaGracia has been engaged in farming since 1997. She obtained her rice field from her parents. Divinagracia is married with two children. She is both father and mother to her two children because her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker in Saudi Arabia. 

Divinagracia would like to help her husband by generating income to educate their two children and provide them with comfortable living conditions. At her very best, she works hard and finds ways to improve the quality of her rice crops. Divinagracia would like to ask for a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will  allow her to buy necessary farm supplies, such as certified seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers. Some of the amount will be used to hire laborers to perform farming activities. She hopes to improve her rice crop production to better her quality of life and allow her obtain more hectares of farmland to manage.

loans.use: to buy necessary farm supplies and pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Net's Group

texts.en:
Net is 62 years old and a married mother of eight children. The main income of the family is from farming rice on two hectares of farmland and growing sesame. Involved in this business for thirty-eight years, Net is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from insufficient working capital is still the main challenge. 

Net has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the past loan which has helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Net will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. Net hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice and sesame successfully so as to improve hygienic living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ana Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene siete hijos, 5 de ellos ya son mayores de edad y dos de 9 y 7 años  los mismos que estudian en la escuela, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su marido hace fletes en un carro de su propiedad.
 
Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad con la cual obtuvo el título de artesana en esta rama. Tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa desde hace muchos años, ella confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares aunque también coge contratos con instituciones como escuelas y colegios de la localidad para elaborar uniformes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y en ciertas ocasiones hasta más tarde cuando tiene obras por entregar. Ella también fabrica chifles los mismos que los vende a personas que llegan hasta su hogar a comprar, lleva más de 20 años con su taller el mismo que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones  y otros materiales para la costura. Está desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su trabajo y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Virgen De Monserrate (Virgin of Monserrate) Communal Bank meet every two weeks.

This is where Ana lives. She is 62 years old, married, and with her husband she has seven children. Five of them are now adults and two, ages 9 and 7, attend school. Three of her children still live with her. Her husband drives his own car for hire.
 
Several years ago Ana learned dressmaking in a local academy, where she earned the title of artisan in this branch of sewing. She has had a small sewing workshop in her house for many years, and she makes all types of clothing. She works on orders from individuals, although she also has contracts with institutions like elementary schools and high schools in the town for making uniforms.She works everyday from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m and at times even later when she has work to deliver. She also makes plantain chips, which she sells to people who come to her house to buy them. Ana has had her workshop for more than 20 years, and it has helped her to give her children a good education.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials. Ana has been in the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help the loans give her.
 
Her dreams are to get ahead with her work and to give all the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 33, sells puto, a type of rice cake, in her village. She is a married mother of five children who are currently studying. She has been selling with love and patience for the last 12 years with great success. 

She plans to produce more kakanin, a kind of snack, to generate a higher income. In connection to this, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy coconuts, milk, sugar, pandan leaves and malagkit. She anticipates that she will earn higher profits from her business, which will allow her to give a better schooling to her children. She also hopes that through her business and hard work, she will have a prosperous life with her family.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, milk, sugar, pandan leaves and malagkit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy milk for a milk and yogurt business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 38 years old, is married and lives in a remote area of Maluno Sur. For five years, he has been managing his store. His monthly income is 5,000 Philippines pesos (Php) and that is not enough to sustain the needs of his family. 

Michael is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 to buy different products. In the future, Michael hopes that his business expands so that he can give a high quality of living to his family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soy sauce, cooking oil and spices for his store.

loans.name: Valeriano

texts.es:
Don Valeriano es un hombre de 42 años de edad el esta casado y vive en Sololá.  Junto a su esposo y sus 3  hijos de los cuales 2 varones y una mujer que trabajan con el y 1 de ellos esta estudiando a punto de terminar su carrera académica.
El se dedica a la fabricación de figuras de diferentes clases en hilos que se utilizan en los trajes típicos femeninos que  usan en su comunidad la cual se le llama (jaspeado). El aprendió hace muchos años a realizar este trabajo con algunas personas que le pudieron enseñar.
El es independiente trabajando con su propio capital desde hace 21 años junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Viendo  que su ganancia es buena y quiere seguir invirtiendo capital para seguir fabricando este tipo de producto por en la época del año existe mayor demanda.
El solicita un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para ampliar su negocio comprando hilos y tintes que utilizara para fabricar mas jaspeado obteniendo mejores ganancias para la familia.
Su mayor sueño es ver a su hijo graduarse de una carrera académica ya que solo le queda un año para hacerlo de modo que en un futuro las condiciones de vida mejoren.
texts.en:
Don Valeriano is a man of 42. He is married and lives in Sololá together with his wife and their three children, two boys and a girl, who work with him, and one of them is in school and on the verge of finishing his course of study.

He makes different types of designs in threads, which are used in the typical women's clothing of his community and are called "jaspeado." He learned to do this work many years ago from some people who were able to teach him.

He is independent, working with his own capital for 21 years, along with his wife and his children. Seeing that his earnings are good, he wants to continue investing capital to continue making this type of product, because there is greater demand at this time of year.

He is applying for a loan of 7000 Q to expand his business, buying thread and dyes that he will use to make more jaspeado and obtain better earnings for his family.

His great dream is to see his son graduate from his course of study, since he has only one year left, so that living conditions in the future will improve.

loans.use: to buy threads and dyes to make jaspeado

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente has sold plastic products and garments for more than 16 years. He sells his products in many municipalities, such as Cagayan, Claveria and Sta. Ana. He is thankful because his business is continually growing. He has four helpers, as well as his own service for transporting his products.

Vicente is able to sell 15 sets of plastic furniture each day. He would like to increase the number of items that he offers in order to supply all his buyers satisfactorily. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP. This loan will allow him to buy 100 sets of mono block chairs and tables. He knows that he will be able to reach his dream because he has the ability to adopt new marketing strategies and techniques.

Vicente is grateful for the continuous financial support that Kiva lenders provide, for it will help him increase his profits. In this way, he can educate his three children and give them a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 100 sets of plastic furniture to sell.

loans.name: Molortsetseg

texts.en: Molortsetseg is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her husband and her three children in a small house in Ger district, which is in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a teacher in a secondary school. Her eldest son is a college student and her younger children are secondary school students. In 2003, she opened her grocery store in one room of her apartment because the location of her apartment was ideal. It is surrounded by the local kindergarten, schools and other apartment blocks and it is on the first floor of the building. Her grocery store sales reach 200,000MNT per day during the high season. Her working capital is 1,500,000MNT. She is a hard-working and open-minded person who says, "I want to renovate my business place and expand to a bigger grocery store." She is asking 1,800,000MNT to increase her working capital in order to boost her sales and profit.

loans.use: to increase her working capital in order to boost her sales and profit and eventually expand her grocery store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a simple entrepreneur. She sells different fruits and vegetables in her village, using her improvised cart. She is 41 years old and married to Gilbert, a carpenter. They live peacefully in the village of Rizal  with their two children: Algietfae and Janefpypper. Alma is thankful that they have a healthy family. She wants to improve her business and, she hopes, put up a small store one day, so she can have additional income. 

Now, she wants a loan of at least 11,000 PHP as business capital, which she will use to buy fruits and vegetables to resell. According to Alma, through her good relationship with her customers, she is able to generate a good income. Someday, she is also planning to engage in rice vending. She hopes that through her business, she can continue to provide the school allowance for her children, and they can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and bananas to resell.

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 9, 6 y 4 años respectivamente. Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa; fue con su hermana con quien aprendió este negocio. Antes solo realizaba los oficios domésticos. Para comprar la mercadería debe desplazarse a 100 kilómetros aproximadamente en autobús, pues allí consigue la mercadería a mejores precios.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ropa, debido a que se acerca la navidad y es una buena temporada para vender más. Ella debe trabajar muy fuerte, pues el padre de sus hijos la abandono y necesita brindarles a sus hijos alimentación, salud y vestuario. María esta estudiando los fines de semana el bachillerato, ya que desea obtener un mejor empleo para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor vida y superación personal a ella misma.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old. She is a single mother of three children, ages 9, 6, and 4. For two years she has sold clothing. She learned this business from working with her sister. Before this she only did domestic work. To buy her merchandise, she needs to travel about 100 kilometers by bus, since there she obtains merchandise at better prices.

She is applying to Funcación Campo for a loan that she will use to buy clothing, since Christmas is coming and it is a good season for selling more. She needs to work very hard, since the father of her children abandoned her, and she needs to offer her children food, health, and clothing. Maria is studying on weekends for her high school diploma, since she wants to obtain a better job to offer her children a better life and complete this personal achievement for herself.

loans.use: to buy clothing, since it is getting close to Christmas and it is a good season to sell more.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan Ramón de cincuenta y dos años de edad vive junto a compañera de vida, sus hijos y sus nietos en casa propia; él se dedica a la venta de quesos en variedad queso duro, fresco, quesillo, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucho experiencia en la venta que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde un puesto en el mercado de la localidad, es muy conocido y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Juan se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y con muchas ganas de alcanzar sus sueños, dia a dia se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo por que sabe que así logrará su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar quesos por mayor. Juan Ramón tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y ala vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
52-year-old Juan Ramón lives with his life partner, his children, and his grandkids in his own house.  He makes a living by selling a variety of cheese, like queso duro (a hard Salvadoran cheese), queso fresco, quesillo (a soft cheese), and others.  He has had several years in the business and this has given much experience in sales which has allowed him to make better profits.  

He sells from a stand in the market in town, is well-known, and has gotten many customers who prefer him for the quality, the good prices, and above all, for the excellent service.  Juan is known for his great kindness and honesty; he is an enterprising man, dedicated to his work, and is very eager to achieve his dreams.  Every day he works as hard as he can at his job because this way he will reach his goal.  

In the last weeks the demand has increased and he wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment.  This is why he asks INTEGRAL for a loan that allows him to buy cheese at wholesale cost.  Juan Ramón has good pay references and impeccable morals. He is certain that he will pay off the debt and at the same time is confident that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese at wholesale cost.

loans.name: Mtakuja Group

texts.en:
Aisha is in her 30's. She is married and lives with her husband and child (who goes to school). She has been making a living since 2009 by running a beauty salon business. She works from 9am to 9pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

Aisha is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, from which she wants to buy more salon equipment. Her dream is to be able to own a cosmetics shop one day. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mtakuja, which has 13 members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda inherited two hectares of rice field from her parent. At the age of 27, she settled for marriage, and since then she started to cultivate her two hectares of rice field. She and her spouse have been blessed with three children. With the profits gained from her rice farming, she has been able to establish hog raising and a fish pond, as additional sources of income. According to Nilda, her profit had really a great impact in making her farming business more productive and profitable.

Nilda paid back her previous loan, and this time asks for a loan of 30,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy farm inputs (such as certified seeds and fertilizer) and to pay for having her land prepared for planting. She knows that her sacrifices and resourcefulness will enable her to develop and maintain proper care of her rice crop.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (such as certified seeds and fertilizer) and to pay for having her land prepared for planting.

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Sarat, 57, is married and lives with her family in a village of the MoungKul Borey district, of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She has five children. One of the children is dependent on her and works as a laborer in the local area, to help the family generate income. For the past ten years, Sarat and her husband have been farming rice as the main source of their family’s income. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day from their current businesses, to support the family.
  
Sarat’s Group consists of two members, and Sarat is on her fourth loan cycle, while the other group member is on her third loan cycle, with VisionFund. The past loans, which Sarat successfully repaid, helped her support her family with sufficient food. Now requesting a loan as part of her group, Sarat, who is the leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice timely and fruitfully, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: María Lucciola

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Las Palmitas.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 23, 20, 16, 15, 12 y 10 años de edad, cinco de ellos aun viven con ella, tres estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante y artesano.

Doña María realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, muy de madrugada él parte en su carro hasta el mercado de mayoristas para surtirse de sus productos los mismos que luego de esto los lleva a distribuir por toda la localidad en especial a los campos donde realiza muchas ventas, también en las tardes se dedica a elaborar sombreros de paja toquilla los mismos que una vez por semana entrega a comerciantes en Montecristi, lleva más de 15 años con sus actividades comerciales con lo cual ha sacado adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y paja toquilla para elaborar los sombreros. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.

Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tienen está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city well known for its abundance of traditional items such as the straw hats known throughout the country and abroad, there is a bimonthly meeting of the members of the Las Palmitas Communal Bank.

Maria lives in this area, she is 41 years old, married, and has six children ages 23, 20, 16, 15, 12, and 10 years. Five of her children still live at home with her, three are in high school, and one is in grade school. Her husband is a businessman and artisan. 

Maria is requesting this loan on behalf of her husband who works selling fruits and vegetables. Very early in the morning he leaves in his car to go to the wholesale market to stock up on the produce which he will later take to sell in the city, particularly to areas where where he makes many sales. In the afternoons he also works making straw hats which once a week he sells to vendors in Montecristi. He has been running these businesses for more than 15 years and this has allowed him to get his family ahead in life. 

This loan will be used to purchase fruits, vegetables, and straw for making hats. She has been with the Communal Bank through four rounds and she appreciates the assistance they provide through the loans.

She hopes to one day purchase another car as the one she has is somewhat old.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, and material for straw hats.

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Nasima prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Nasima is a 25-year-old married woman who lives with three family members in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy some new household items, such as an oven, a TV, and furniture. She hopes to buy other items in the future, such as bedroom and living room furniture, to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en: Fadwa is a 35-year-old, married woman from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has five children.  She requested an 800 JOD loan to pay for buying the raw materials needed for working in embroidery. Fadwa is planning to have her own shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for materials to use in embroidery work.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean lives in a rural area, located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Hean is 41 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support her family, she has been farming rice for twenty-one years, and she supplements her family’s income by working for others, for a fee. From her current business activities, she can earn about 37,000 KHR per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs.
 
This is the second microloan for Hean with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has fully repaid the prior loan. The first loan helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from the rice paddy, so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Muykea

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Muykea is 52 years old and widowed. She has four children, and one of them is dependent and still in school. To feed her family, she has planted cassava for twelve years and sold grocery items in her local area.
 
Muykea has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the loan.  It helped her to gradually improve her living. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR from VisionFund. With this new loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland, and pay for labor. She hopes to grow healthy cassava, to increase her family’s income, so as to make a better life. Her dream is to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland, and to pay for some labor in the field.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen's Group

texts.es: La Microempresaria formado por tres socias una de ellas es Maria Auxiladora  de éxito de 45 años casada con más de 10 años de tener su negocio como es venta de comidas, gaseosas los cuales los comercializa en un centro turístico cercano  en su localidad cuenta con dos trabajadoras conocidas del lugar y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, verduras, leñas etc. Alba Luz de 46 años tiene un taller de artesanía invertirá el crédito en la compra de barro y leñas, y Rosa del Carmen vende nacatamales los fines  de semana en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur group is made up of three members.  One of them is María Auxiliadora, 45.  She's married and has had a business selling food and soda for more than 10 years.  She sells in a tourist area near her town.  She has two well-known workers from the area.

She's going to invest the loan in buying staples such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, firewood, etc.

Alba Luz, 46, who has a craft workshop, will invest the loan in clay and firewood.  Rosa del Carmen sells "nacatamales" [Nicaraguan tamales] in her home on the weekend.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Aracely

texts.es: Gloria de 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija que trabaja para suplir sus gastos personales. Gloria trabaja muy duro en su propio negocio en el que se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas, así comercializa bebidas frías y calientes y desayunos, Gloria posee su negocio desde hace 20 años, tiempo durante el cual ha tratado de hacer lo mejor posible su actividad permitiéndole contar con muchos clientes fijos quienes a diario consumen sus productos. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz, harina de arroz, queso, chicharrón y otros materiales primordiales para elaborar las pupusas, con esto Gloria ansía mejorar sus ganancias y así vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 59, lives with her husband and a daughter who works to cover her personal expenses.

Gloria works very hard at her own business of making “pupusas”. She also sells hot and cold beverages and breakfast foods. Gloria has been in business for 20 years. Throughout this time, she has tried to do her best in managing her business. As a result, she has many established customers who eat her dishes every day.

Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can buy corn, rice flour, cheese, pork skins, and other essential supplies for making “pupusas”. As a result, Gloria will be able to improve her earnings and live better.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for making "pupusas".

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Maram prefers that her photo is not on the Internet.  The above photo is of her husband.  

Maram is a 23-year-old married female and mother of 3 children from Ashrafia, Jordan.  She requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 JOD to buy clothing for resale from her own house.  In the future, Maram is planning to have her own shop and to improve the living conditions of her family.  Since Maram is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jumaboy

texts.ru: Джумабою 40 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 10, 13 и 15 лет. Более 10  лет он занимается скотоводством. У него 5  коровы и  6 барана. Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  12000  сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Jumaboy is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 10, 13 and 15 years old. For over 10 years, he has been working in animal husbandry and currently has 5 cows and 6 sheep. He spends several months raising cattle, then sells them at a market where he has many clients. He wants to develop his business but does not have the means to do so. For this reason, Jumaboy is seeking a loan of 12,000 Tajikistan Somoni. He plans to use the income generated by this purchase to provide his children with a good education and the latest technology. He is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, aged 39 years, is a diligent farmer who lives with her spouse and four children in a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province.  All of her children are in her care and still in school.  To support the family, Pheap grows rice on a 2.5-hectare area of farmland while her husband raises pigs and sometimes works locally for others.  Having been in this business for eighteen years, they are able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day and to save about 10,000 KHR per day (after deducting daily expenses). 
 
Pheap has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has fully paid back the previous loans, which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and to improve their livelihood.  Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan.  Pheap will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and more piglets for raising.  Pheap hopes to grow her rice successfully and to increase the income from her current business in order to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kimhon's Group

texts.en:
Aged 54 years, Kimhon is a married mother of two children living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. All of her children help their family’s field business. She has been growing cassava on a 1-hectare area of farmland for ten years, and she can earn about 13,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and save about 7,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

This is the second loan for Kimhon; she completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her better support her family with sufficient foods. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Kimhon will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. Through this loan, she hopes grow her cassava healthfully so as to sell it for a good price in order to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Laura Jacqueline

texts.es: Laura tiene 34 años estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos vive en el norte  de Guayaquil conocido como el Orquídeas. Ella aprendiendo de su tío quien tenía esta misma profesión, le gusto mucho por lo que realizo varios cursos para ampliar sus conocimientos y mejorar las técnicas. Laura comenta que en todo trabajo lo que más cuenta es la experiencia que se adquiere con el tiempo y el ya tiene bastante. Trabaja sola de lunes a domingos desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde siempre que termine con el pedido. Su especialidad son los ternos de caballeros los cuales tienen gran acogida, también confecciona camisas, pantalones unisex, blusas y uniformes, y vestidos. El taller está ubicado en su domicilio donde tiene su máquina y una mesa para el corte. El mayor problema que enfrenta Laura es la entrega de las prendas una vez terminadas, como se mueve en busetas teme que los ladrones roben su trabajo. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de otra máquina de coser ya que la actual esta vieja y necesita un cambio, igual no la desechara ya que de necesitar contratar alguien le serviría. Espera a futuro comprar una maquina industrial con la que brindaría mejores servicios. Con el préstamo Laura comprara : hilo, telas, maquina industrial etc.
texts.en: Laura is 34 years old and her civil status is married. She lives in northern Guayaquil, known as Orquídeas. She is learning from her uncle who had the same profession, which she enjoys because she takes courses to widen her knowledge and improve techniques. Laura says that in all of her work what counts most is the experience one gains over time, and she has plenty of it. She works alone Monday to Sunday from seven in the morning to six in the afternoon and always finishes with the order. Her specialties are horse-riding clothes which are widely selected, as well as shirts, unisex pants, blouses, uniforms, and dresses. The workshop is located in her house where she has her machine and a table for cutting. The major problem which Laura faces is handing in the garments when they're finished, because the minibus moves and she fears thieves will steal her work. She is asking for the loan to buy another sewing machine because her current one is old and she needs a change, though she won't throw it out because she needs to find someone who it will serve. She hopes to buy an industrial machine in the future with which she would bring better service. With this loan Laura will buy thread, cloth, an industrial machine, etc.

loans.use: to buy thread, an industrial machine, etc.

loans.name: Edith Marlene

texts.es: Edith Marlene de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Jorge y su hijo; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa camisas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en el comercio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; vende de forma ambulante en los diferentes alrededores de la localidad donde reside, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con productos de calidad y con un buen servicio; Edith es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere alcanzar sus sueños y llegar al éxito, esta dispuesta a trabajar duro hasta lograrlo; como toda buena comerciante ahora que aumento la demanda quiere aprovechar y aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Edith Marlene tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edith Marlene, age 36, lives with her life companion Jorge and their son. She sells clothing such as shirts, trousers, blouses, dresses, and other items. Edith has worked in this trade for several years and has gained a great deal of sales experience so that she can generate better earnings. She sells as a street vendor in the different neighborhood of the town where she lives. Edith has many customers who prefer to do business with her because she offers what they need at affordable prices. Her products are of good quality and she offers great service. Edith is an active woman who is dedicated to her work and has the drive to succeed. She wants to fulfill her dreams and become successful. Edith is willing to work hard to achieve these goals. Like all good merchants, she now wants to take advantage of the increased demand by investing more.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy clothing in bulk. Edith Marlene has good credit references who vouch for her ability to repay this debt. She is confident that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Saqer

texts.en:
Saqer is a 20-year-old single male from Sahab, Jordan.  He requested a loan of 500 JOD to pay for opening a small coffee booth.  In the future, Saqer is planning to expand his project and improve the living conditions of his family.

Since Saqer is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for opening a small coffee booth.

loans.name: Yesenia Marilin

texts.es: Yesenia de 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Yesenia trabaja elaborando cortinas, cubrecamas, manteles y tapetes los cuales comercializan en su casa y así mismo los vende de forma ambulante por diferentes zonas del departamento que reside, con esto ella puede brindarle ayuda económica a su esposo, haciendo de una forma más fácil el sostenimiento del hogar. Yesenia es muy trabajadora y responsable y que desea darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 35 years old and lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, and their three young children. She produces curtains, bed sheets, tablecloths, and tapestries and then sells them from her home. Yesenia also sells her products as a street vendor in different areas of the department where she lives. This enables her to assist her husband financially, thus making it easier for both of them to sustain their household.

Yesenia is a hard worker who is responsible. She wants to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making curtains.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Вы не можете представить себе, в каком трудном жилищном условии живет добрая женщина Рафоат. Ей 50 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. Они семейные и с каждым годом количества их семьи вырастает, а дом у них маленький и не имеет нормальных условий. Рафоат планирует достроить дополнительные комнаты и отремонтировать имеющиеся комнаты. Ее зарплата не хватает осуществить ее планы, так как она работает в типографии района. Рафоат запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, цемента и камня для ремонта дома. Рафоат и ее дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: You cannot imagine how difficult housing conditions are for a kind-hearted woman named Rafoat. She is 50 years old and married. She has 3 adult children who now have their own families that get larger every year; however, their house is small and lacks adequate conditions. Rafoat plans to build additional rooms and renovate existing rooms, but the salary that she earns working in the field of printing is not sufficient for her to cover the costs. For this reason, Rafoat is seeking a loan of 3,000 US dollars to buy building materials, cement and stone to renovate her house. She and her children are awaiting the assistance of kind lenders who will help them solve their housing difficulties.

loans.use: To buy cement and stone to repair her house

loans.name: Sanjeeda

texts.en: Ms. Sanjeeda is a 27-year-old married woman.  Two years ago, Sanjeeda started a parlor in a small corner of her two-room house.  It was becoming very difficult for her husband to meet the family needs alone, as he is employed in a general store.  So Sanjeeda initiated her business in order to support her family.  Sanjeeda became well known in her town by providing good quality services to her customers.  Now she is facing the problem of low cash-in-hand to buy the basic utensils and various products for her parlor.  To help her to continue her operations, she requested for a loan of 20,000 PKR.  She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more skin care products, makeup kits, rollers and steamers.  This enables her to treat more clients at a time which will help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase more skin care products, makeup kits, rollers and steamers.

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Leena prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Leena is a 25 year old married woman from Al Russeifeh in Jordan. She has 2 children and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture. in the future, Leena is planning to open her own project.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Dildor

texts.ru:
Дилдор более тринадцати лет занимается животноводством. Она зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота у себя дома. Животноводством она занимается вместе со всей семьей. Дилдор просит кредит для закупа бычков. 
Дилдор проживает в Спитаменском районе. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей.
texts.en: Dildor lives in the Spitamen region. She is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. For more than 13 years, she has been working in animal husbandry. She earns a living by raising cattle at home, and her family helps her in her work. Dildor is asking for a loan for the purchase of bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou, 36, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She has three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. For the last ten years, Chanthou has been working as a hairdresser--the family"s primary source of income--while her husband works as a taxi-driver to earn extra income. The current business earns them about KHR 50,000 per day and she can save about KHR 10,000 each day after deducting daily expenses.

Chanthou’s group consists of three members. She and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, Chanthou wants to use her portion to buy more hairdressing materials to support her current business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to better her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more hairdressing materials to support her current business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Salomatjon

texts.ru: Саломатджону 40 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 2 года опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается изготовлением и продажей пирожков в собственном кафе. В последнее время у нее мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и она не может придерживать своих клиентов. Она хочет купить масло и муку для изготовления больше пирожков. Таким образом, она будет развевать свой бизнес и с дохода улучшить условия жизни.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони.  Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Salomatjon is 40 years old, married, and raising two children.  She is a very hardworking woman who has more than two years of experience in her business.

Salomatjon prepares and sells small pies (pirojki) in her own cafe.  Lately, the number of her customers has been quite low, due to competition, and she is having a hard time retaining her customer base.

She would like to buy some oil and flour to be able to prepare larger quantities of pirojki.  This would help her to expand her business and she would use her income to improve her living conditions.

She is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni.  She is relying on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy flour and oil to boost her business.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sophea is a 35-year-old mother of two dependent children, both of whom are in school. To support her children Sophea has been farming rice and cassava for fifteen years while her husband has been working locally to earn more money.
