She is very happy with her income but still needs to increase it so she can sustain her family and give her children the best education possible. She is now asking for a loan of 8,00 PHP to buy more used clothes, bags, and belts to sell.

She hopes to keep making her business profitable and gain the income necessary to raise her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes, bags, and belts to sell.

loans.name: Lab's Group

texts.en:
Lab, 48, is a married mother living in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She has six children, two of whom are dependents; one is in school, while the other works in a garment factory to help the family generate income. She is a hard-working farmer who grows rice and sells various kinds of vegetables, such as cucumber, salad, etc., while her husband supplements the family income by working as a taxi-driver in the local area. By both working hard, they can earn about 33,000 KHR per day and save about 10,00 0KHR each day for their future needs. 
Lab’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for four cycles. Lab fully repaid her past loans, which have helped her to gradually improve her family’s standard of living. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a new loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay for plowing and other farm labor. She hopes to produce more rice and thus increase the family’s income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay farm labor.

loans.name: Kro Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Kro Nhanh is 48 years old and married with four children. To make a living, she has been producing Khmer noodles for selling for 15 years as her primary business, while her husband works hard as a rice farmer to gain extra income for the family. 

Kro Nhanh’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. Kro Nhanh has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles already and completely paid back the loans, which have helped better support her family’s living to an extent. Now, she can earn about 25,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and can save about 6,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. Kro Nhanh hopes to increase her crop yields and sell for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, 45, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She has seven children, two of whom are dependent and still in school. For the last 20 years, she and her husband have been growing oranges on 1.5-hectare of farmland as a primary source of family income to make a living; they supplement the income by raising pigs. The current business earns her family about 13,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and they can save about 3,000 KHR each day for the future needs. A lack of a water supply is the main challenge for her plantation business. 

Sopheap is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 3,500,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her plantation business and will use a portion of it to spend on buying piglets for raising. She hopes to make more fruitful oranges so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her orange plantation business.

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with thatched walls in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Chanry is aged 39 years and married with no kids. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and selling firewood. Having been in this business for 13 years, they are able to earn about 17,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and they can save about 6,000 KHR each day for their future needs. Insufficient working capital to support her current business is the main challenge she faces.

Chanry’s group consists of two members who live in the same village, and she has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. The past loan, which she fully paid back, has supported her family with enough food. Now, she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chanry will use her portion to buy plots of farmland for her rice farming. She hopes this loan will enable her to have more plots of farmland to grow her rice timely and fruitfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy plots of farmland for her rice farming.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Leng is 38 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last 19 years, she has been growing rice to support her family, while her husband works as a construction worker in the local area to earn additional income. Together, they can earn about 22,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 
Leng’s group consists of two members who have been with VisonFund for four cycles. Leng has completely repaid her past loans, which have helped her lighten the burdens of her family and improve their livelihood. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Leng, the group's leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to succeed in producing more rice, so as to improve her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Sengheap's Group

texts.en:
Sengheap, 19, lives with family members in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district, and she has one daughter who is dependent and still too young for school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting oranges and sugarcane, which they both have been in for 10 years to make a living. The current business earns them about 16,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and they can save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs.  

This is the first microloan for Sengheap’s group with VisionFund. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Sengheap, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living and keep her daughter in school when she is old enough.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Mathurine

texts.fr: Agée de 43ans, Mathurine est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 19ans et 12ans. Elle vend de divers et des boissons depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mathurine is 43 years old, married, and mother of three children, all of whom have received schooling. Her eldest child is 19 years old, and her youngest child is 12 years old.

She has been selling beverages and various other items for a few years now, and she stocks up at one of the markets in Benin.

Striving to strengthen her business and satisfy the demand of her customers, she sought and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev with a view to maximizing her supplementary income and helping to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of corn, 5 containers of sardines, and 12 cases of assorted beverages

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra is 27 years old and lives with her family in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with two children, all of whom are dependents and still too young for school.

Rice farming has been the only main source of income for her family for seven years. Her husband also complements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 12,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 6,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Ra’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle while her group member is just with VisionFund this cycle. She successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s living condition and now she is confident she can make a better living.

Ra's group is requesting a loan from VisionFund. Ra, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Ms. Sadia is a 22-year-old unmarried lady. She is very talented and excels in her stitching work. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community, so she decided to initiate her own business with support of Kashf Foundation. She is living with her parents and has four siblings; she is the eldest among them. Her father is a government servant. His income is not enough to cover family expenditures. Sadia wants to support her family by using her great talent.

Sadia requested for a loan of 20,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees) to buy a stock of threads in different colors, buttons, zips, etc., to keep up with the demand. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her siblings through all her hard slog in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, buttons, zips, etc., to keep up with the demand.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 21, who is married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family. 

Ali is a blacksmith. He started working in this field in 2006 and after having a good experience he established his own business. He has now 2 employees and a good reputation in his local community. 

He is requesting $2000 as loan to buy a generator and buy more raw materials. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Makara

texts.en: Makara is 30 years old. She is married, has one child and resides in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling jewelry for more than two years, earning approximately $15 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Makara is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more jewelry to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. She would like to buy a store in the future, and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to resell

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is aged 43 years and married with two children. Residing in a rural village of Pursat province, Kror Kor district, she and her husband have been farming rice and rising pigs for twelve years to make a living. To better support the family, she also sells grocery items in her local area. The current business earns her family about KHR 17,000 per day and they can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

Sokhom’s group consists of two members and they both have been with VisionFund for two cycles. Sokhom fully paid back the past loans and successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support her living and basic necessities. Now she and her group are applying for another loan. 

The leader, Sokhom, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion to buy piglets for raising. Sokhom hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for the family to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 46 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a soldier who earns about $3 each day. Three of her children are garment workers. They earn about $9 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops. This purchase will help her increase income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating.

loans.name: Hay's Group

texts.en:
Hay, 47, lives with her family members in a rural village of Siem Reap province, Srey Snom district, Cambodia. She has three dependent children who are still in school. For the last five years, she and her husband have been farming rice on one-hectare of farmland as the main source of her family’s income. The current business earns her about KHR 5,000 per day and she manages to save about 2,000 KHR after offsetting daily expenses.  

This is the fourth loan for Hay with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have enabled her to buy a proper motorbike for her family to use for commuting. She and her co-member are applying for another loan. Hay will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell the produce for a good price so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening up cattle for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a knife and ax maker. He earns about $5 daily. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Rin is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase metal for her husband to use for producing more knives and axes to sell. This money will help him earn more income for the family. In the future, Rin would like to expand the businesses and send her children to earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase metal for her husband to use for producing more knives and axes to sell

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach is 41 years old and a married mother of five children. Out of her children, she still has three children to take care of and they are still in school. 

The main income of the family is from growing cassava on one hectare of farmland. Involved in this business for 21 years, Mach is able to earn about 16,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

The low price of cassava is still the main challenge.
 
Mach has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Her group co-member is new with VisionFund this cycle. Now, she and her co-member are applying for a loan. Mach, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for cultivated land. Mach hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice successfully so as to improve hygienic living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for cultivated land.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is a 47-year-old widowed mother of four children in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. All of her children are dependent on her; some are still in school and some help the family’s business. 

Besides rice farming, Oun also complements the income by working for others for a fee. Having been in this occupation for 23 years, they are able to earn almost 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from drought is the main challenge for her paddy-field business.

Oun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and fully paid back the past loan. She has wisely used the previous loan to better support her family living’s conditions. 

Oun is now asking for another loan with VisionFund of 2,500,000 KHR. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, Oun hopes to cultivate her rice healthfully to earn more income to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en:
Roeurn is 45 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 each day. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $12 per day.

In order to finish the construction of her house, Roeurn is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase timbers. This purchase will help her finish the building of her house faster. In the future, she would like to purchase a store in the market to sell groceries and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a bathroom to provide good hygiene for her family.

loans.use: to purchase timber to finish construction of her house

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Theg is 45 years old and a widowed mother who has been blessed with four children. She resides in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

As a widow, she has struggled to feed her family by farming rice and growing beans and cassava. Engaging in this business for 20 years, Theng can earn approximately KHR 35,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses.
  
Theng has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. The past loans, which she successfully paid back, have relieved her family’s burden and supported her children’s education. 

Now she would like to acquire a loan of KHR 3,000,000 from VisionFund. Theng will use this loan to pay for labor fees and to purchase rubber seedlings for planting to gain additional income for the family. Theng hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married, and has two children. His parents live with him and they are employed. 

Alaa owns a carpentry shop. He has acquired this profession by working as an employee in carpentry shops for several years. In 2010, he established his own shop. He now has two employees and a good reputation in his local community. 

He is requesting a $1500 loan to buy a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 49 year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is been in the business of selling milk for many years. Her husband does labor work and his daily income is very low. It was very difficult for her to cover the necessities of life with the income of her husband. So she decided to help her husband as well as her family. For this purpose, she purchased a buffalo five years ago and started selling the milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She counts a good client list. Her business is good enough for her to lead a  decent life. She worked hard and made savings for expanding her business and now she has two buffaloes and good number of customers.  She needs a loan of Rs.30,000 for purchasing a buffalo because her customers are increasing day by day.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a very hardworking woman who has six children. Her husband sells fruit on a small cart. The income of her husband was not enough for filling the necessities of life, education of their children and for medical requirements. 

She has good skills of sewing women's clothes, so she started the sewing work in her home for helping her husband. Now she has a good number of customers and she always tries to improve the quality of her work. 

She wants to expand her business by making a small tailoring workshop at her home. For that she needs to purchase two to three more sewing machines and has requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). It will help her to earn more income. She dreams to spend the part of profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To purchase two to three more sewing machines for opening a tailoring workshop at her home.

loans.name: Chhum's Group

texts.en:
Chhum, a citizen from the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, is 42 years old and single. She has managed her daily basic needs through rice farming and chilies planting. Engaging in this business for 22 years, she is able to earn about 12,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Including this loan cycle, she has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Her past two loans, which she has paid back, have helped her to better support her business on time. Now, she forms a group of two to seek a new loan. As the leader, her loan portion will be used to buy fertilizer for both cash crops. She hopes this purchase will increase her yield and return her more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash crops.

loans.name: Danna Stephanie

texts.es: La señorita Danna tiene 22 años, es estudiante a nivel licenciatura de la carrera de derecho, actualmente es soltera y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en la zona de central de la ciudad de Cochabamba  junto a sus padres, al inicio de su estudio universitario le ayudaron sus padres, pero mas adelante no tuvieron la capacidad para seguir colaborándole, por lo que ella tuvo que entrar a trabajar de día y estudiar de noche. De sus ingresos fue parte fue destinado a sus estudios y la otra parte para el ahorro para comprase un vehículo, con el que cuenta actualmente. La solicitante actualmente tiene ingresos de su sueldo y del servicio de transporte urbano. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento y reparación de vehículo, debido que sufrió desperfectos en estos últimos meses, esto le permitirá tener los mismos ingresos para que pueda destinarlos al pago de sus mensualidades en la universidad.
texts.en: Danna is 22 years old.  She is an undergraduate student studying law.  She is single and has no children.  She lives in the central area of the city of Cochabamba with her parents.  At the beginning of her studies, her parents helped her, but later on they were not able to continue making payments, so she began working during the day and studying at night.  Part of her income pays for her studies and she saved the other part to purchase a vehicle, which she has succeeded in purchasing.  She now has income from her salary and from the urban transport service.  She is requesting this loan to perform maintenance and repairs on her vehicle, which has suffered damages in the last few months.  This will allow her to maintain the same income so that she can make her monthly payments to the university.

loans.use: to repair her taxi.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch is 56 years old and originally from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province. She has five children and all of them have their own employment, working on rice fields, clothes tailoring, and working at a construction site.  Her main source of family income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for 15 years and from which she is able to earn almost 13,000 KHR per day.  Now in a group of three, Touch is a group leader. This is her fifth-time loan with Kiva's partner. Her past loan, which she has paid back, has supported her cash-crops growing on time and returns her a decent income. Now she is applying for 300,000 KHR.  She is going to use it to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this purchase will boost her productivity, so she can make more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: San Luis De Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Luís de Cumbe está conformado por 8 socias y 2 socios, quienes trabajan arduamente cada día en diferentes trabajos ya sea del campo o en la ciudad, estas actividades les dan la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida en sus hogares y entregarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia está rodeada de montañas y hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, la arquitectura de la parroquia está mezclada entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Amalia, se encuentra realizando el segundo crédito en el banco comunal San Luís de Cumbe, vive por la comunidad de San Capac que pertenece a la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 37 años de edad, es viuda y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 20, 18, 15, 13, 6 y 5 años de edad, su primer y tercer hijo trabajan y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo está casado y vive independiente, su cuarta hija pasa en casa ayudando a los quehaceres de su hogar, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa Amalia trabaja en los quehaceres de su hogar, cuando le llaman trabaja como jornalera y en casa se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, gallinas y borregos los que los vende en su comunidad.
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. 

Su meta es llegar a tener una mayor cantidad de animales para la venta.
texts.en:
The San Luís de Cumbe communal bank has eight female members and two male members. The members work had every day at different jobs in both the country and the city. These jobs give them the opportunity to improve the quality of life in their homes and to give their children a better future.  They live in the Cumbe parish in Cuenca. This parish is surrounded by mountains and beautiful landscapes where nature can be enjoyed. The architecture in the parish is a mix of colonial and modern styles. The town still maintain the culture and traditions of their people. 

One of the members in this group is Rosa Amalia. She is executing her second loan with the San Luís de Cumbe communal bank. She lives in the San Capac community which is a part of the Cumbe parish. She is 37 years old. She is a widow and with her partner, she had six children. They are 20, 18, 15, 13, 6 and 5 years old. Her first and third sons work and help her economically. Her second son is married and lives independently. Her fourth, a daughter, helps with the chores in the house. The last two children study at a little school in the community. The house where she lives is her own property. 

Rosa Amalia works on the household chores. When she is called, she works as a day laborer. At home, she raises guinea pigs, chickens and sheep that she sells in her community. 

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens.

loans.use: purchase chickens.

loans.name: Chamroen's Group

texts.en:
Chamroen is 24 years old. He is married and resides with his wife and two sons in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Me Mot district. 

Cassava growing and pig raising are the primary sources of his family’s income and he has been in this business for four years. His daily income is approximately 27,000 KHR and he can manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.
 
Chamroen has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles and fully paid back the past loan. The other group member is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. 

Chamroen successfully and wisely used the previous loan to better support his cassava planting. Now he is leading his group of two to request another loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Chamroen is going to use his portion to buy pig feed for his pig business and to buy pesticides for protecting his crop. 

He hopes to grow his crop successfully and also hopes to fatten his pigs so as to increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for his pig business and pesticides for his crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
A 49-year-old mother, Heang is a paddy farmer in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She has seven children in total, only two of whom are still under her responsibility as they are in school. To tackle daily expenses, rice farming is the main source of her income and working for others for a fee is her additional income. It is the only business owned by her that she has been with for 10 years. Her main challenge is the unpredictable flood which destroys her crop. 

Heang is the leader of this group of two. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for ages, having taken out eight loans. She has managed her loans with success in order to keep up a good pace of her business and improve her living conditions gradually. Now, she and her group are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 Riels (KHR) each. She is going to spend her loan portion on fertilizer, seed, and a plowing fee. She hopes to grow her crop on time and receive double income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Sort's Group

texts.en: A 36-year-old single lady originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province (Cambodia), Sort does rainy season paddy farming on two hectares of farmland as her primary source of income. She also runs a small stall for selling grocery items as well as fruit. Sort has been with VisionFund for two loans and has completely paid back with success. She has used it in a wise manner to improve her lifestyle and maintain good progress in her business. Now, she has formed a group of three to seek a loan of 1,400,000 Riels (KHR) each. She is the leader of this group. Her loan's portion will be used to buy five sacks of fertilizer and rice seed. She expects to gain high yield so as she can make more income for expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Kajaran town in the Syunik region with her husband and 2 children. Narine’s husband, Edik, runs a little facility where he repairs cars and provides other technical services for cars.  Narine’s 2 children are both students.  Her daughter, Zhenya, is in the 1st course in Armanian State Pedagogical University, studying primary education pedagogy, and her son, Garnik, is in the 3rd course in Armenian State Engineering University.
 
Edik is the only breadwinner in the family, and the profit he earns from his business is barely enough to make ends meet. The universities where children study are located 327 km from Kajaran, and Narine has to rent a house for their children to live in Yerevan. She also has to provide her children the necessary financial means to cover daily costs. All these costs do not allow Narine to make savings to pay all her children's tuiton fees.  Narine has applied for a loan of AMD 400000 to pay her daughter's annual tuition fee.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Al-Omniat Group

texts.en: This loan group is called Al-Omniat and has four members, all of them women. They are hardworking and live in Sana`a, Yemen. Mkia leads this group. She is 36 years old, married and has four children. She is a housewife who works hard to ensure that her children will have a good life. She has a house and would like to buy home appliances. She is requesting for a loan for 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator for her home. She hopes to improve her house and enroll her children in a private school.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her house.
